story:
Our Story

This all started when we had friends that desperately wished to attend Electric Daisy Carnival 2011 in Las Vegas, yet had no means to make it. My wife and I have always taken great care of our friends and felt the desire to help in whatever way we could. We began the movement to help our friends and its turned into a quest to help anyone that truly needs the help. Its not a handout but a way to help someone that deserves it.


The Impact

You can make a difference in your friends life or those that this will help.


What We Need & What You Get

We are wanting to raise at least $1000 for a lucky individual. This will be for an all expenses  paid weekend in Las Vegas for Electric Daisy Carnival 2012. This will cover a General Admission Ticket for all 3 days, Airfare,  Hotel,  and  food while there.

How else can you help?
Please Visit our Facebook to submit your ideas on how you can make this event better for others. If you have something that you can donate to the cause other than $$, please take the time to let us know.

Are you in need?
If you are in need or fallen on hard times and would like to be considered for this trip, please visit the Facebook page and tell us your story. How you need help and it could be you that wins this trip.

story:
We've all been playing one instrument or another for at least a decade, and have each been in many bands throughout the years.  Rock bands, ska bands, all-girl bands, band-and-orchestra bands, duos, trios, jam session groups . . .


We've played at wineries, breweries, coffee shops, bars, restaurants, festivals, fairs, parties and theaters.

Since coming together as Whippoorwillow, we've had a goal of getting our tunes together for a professional recording.  We're so close!  

With your help, we're going to make it happen!  $2,500 will cover the cost of mixing and mastering, as well as CD duplication.  Pre-order the CD (or download, for you youngins), get yourself a t-shirt, let us chauffeur you to a show, or have us play at that huge party you're planning!  Any way that you're able to contribute is going to get this project closer to fruition and mean the world to us, so thank you, thank you, thank you!



IMPORTANT NOTE ABOUT SHIPPING:  We can absolutely ship cds, stickers, t-shirts, picks, AND cookies.  If you would like us to do that, just add $5 to your contribution.  Click "contact us" on this page, or click this, to send us your mailing address.

story:
Listen to our first completed song, "Strange Place", and our soon to completed demo of Honey on Broken Mirrors:    http://iv-nyc.bandcamp.com

IV is the exciting combination of Jesse Quattro, Seán van Doornum, Devin Hoff and Shahzad Ismaily. We’ve been working diligently to write and produce this album which is a culmination of life experiences, developing great friendships, and pursuing our love of music...just waiting for the perfect combination to manifest… 

Over the years, Jesse has worked with Trey Spruance, Kid606, Fred Frith, Terry Riley, and Colin Stetson among others. After moving to Brooklyn, she met Seán van Doornum, an award winning composer/producer from Sydney, Australia. Shahzad Ismaily is a long time friend and sought after multi-instrumentalist/composer, currently playing in Marc Ribot's Ceramic Dog. Lastly, Devin Hoff, who has played with The Nels Cline Singers, Good for Cows, Xiu Xiu among others, has recently joined IV with his gut-string upright bass.

We are also honored to be working with the mixing genius of Bryce Goggin at Trout Studios, the artistic talent of Nate Denver for our merchandise and cover art, and finally the terribly sought-after Scott Hull at Masterdisk.

We just need a little help to deliver this album to the world! We’re asking for $2,000 to pay for a recording session we did with Shahzad, and to have those demos mixed and mastered so that we can share our music with you and with labels who might be interested in releasing our music! 

For your contribution, we've thought of some fantastic gifts to offer you. Download codes, care packages, private concerts, limited vinyl and t-shirts. Even the smallest donation makes the biggest difference for us. 

Thank you so much.

You mean the world!

story:
Hello and Welcome

Hi folks, thanks for checking out my indiegogo campaign! I'm Elder Sister Plum, otherwise known as Tanya Semple, and I'm a folk singer/musician living in Toronto, ON. I've been writing and performing music as Elder Sister Plum since my teenage years on Vancouver Island, B.C. I've sung my stories and performed my swashbuckling folk lullabies all over Canada and I finally have the opportunity to record these tunes on my first professionally recorded album, 'People Like Us'.

This album means the world to me! Many of the songs you'll hear I've been playing for years, and have only imagined how they would sound being played by a full band. Now, with full creative control and Kaleb Hikele, an unbelievably helpful and supportive Engineer/Musician by my side, I finally get to hear what I've only been able to imagine up until now. 

This album is an extremely honest look into my personal journey over the years. There are songs from nearly every stage of my life as a songwriter, from the age of 17 until now, at 25. I have been continuosly writing through the good and the bad times, the amazing adventures and the unfortunate missteps. And of course there will be a healthy dose of pirates dancing the hempen jig, and sirens singing ships into the rocks. 

 

note: I am planning CD release shows in Toronto and Montreal. Check in to my facebook page for updates!

www.facebook.com/eldersisterplum

 

The Nitty Gritty

I need to raise $1500 to make this album happen.

That money will go towards...

- Recording costs (studio time, mixing, mastering)

- CD duplication

- Packaging 

- The creation of an Elder Sister Plum website

- Merch materials

Of course no good deed goes unnoticed! You will receive awesome perks when you donate. 

Fun fact: if you were plannging on buying the CD anyway, you can just pre-order it now! And if you're feeling extra generous, there is plenty of sweet swag just waiting to be yours.

For the first time ever I have Elder Sister Plum patches (homemade with love); a CD of rare Elder Sister Plum recordings from the vaults, including remixes and never before heard garageband creations; I will even be your very own songbird and will sweetly serenade you wherever and whenever you choose!

All that and more, plus you get to know that you played an integral part in the creation of this album, and put a huge smile on my face!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Of course I understand not everyone has the means to contribute financially.

Everyone can help by sharing this video and campaign far and wide! Share it with your friends, your family, and all the strangers in the far corners of the internet! Yell it out from your rooftops!

Help me achieve my dream, and I will be forever grateful to you!

story:
HELP US IGNITE THE CULTURE AND GET THESE 8 ARTISTS ON TOUR PLEASE!

The Hip Hop Break was created to bring back that creativity and credibility that has been washed out by clones and the corporate structure.

Let’s face it, major labels have share holders and have to meet their quota, so we cannot depend on them to provide us with the best representation of the culture. There are artists all over the world who are original, fresh, and hungry for that “break”. The Hip Hop Break will give it to you, and help garnish a new wave of artists!

The Hip Hop Break is a collective of fans and enthusiast, who have pooled their resources together to advance the hip hop culture. We are taking 8 of the hottest artists from the world on  on the road for 3 weeks in the U.S. to showcase their talent and gain a following. The tour will produce a reality show to reveal the ups and downs of new independent artists on the road. By the end of the tour, the artists will have touched over 10 million hip hop supporters world wide that will give them that push to a greater career. 




What We Need From You?

  • We need your support to fully fund this tour.
  • To be apart of history and help the art form that has influenced the world.
  • Tell help us find something new for Hip Hop.



The Impact

Why do we need your support?

After the early 2000s, rap sales started to slowly decline.  However, it wasn’t until 2005 when the decline became more rapid.  It is now worse than it has ever been, with rap turning into a battle of who gets more “hos” and more money.  Rap got boring very quickly in the late 2000s.  After the innovative rap music coming right after the new millennium, hip-hop started to die.  Rappers started talking about what makes them look more manly in the hood, instead of telling stories people love to hear.  Although the economy has suffered and overall music sales have declined, rap has taken the hardest hit.  White teenage kids, raps biggest investor, have quit spending their money on a boring and typical product.  Why? Because it has turned into crap. Who wants to listen to music that talks about drugs, money, diamonds, cars, and clubs all the time?  I sure don’t.  I agree with music consultant Tom Vickers, who says in a TIME Magazine article, “Rap has to look at the bigger issues confronting society. There's only so much “bling” the public can take.” Yes there are a few anomalies, maybe one song on a CD is really good, but the rest aren’t worth buying.  No wonder album sales are down.  Record companies waste so much time and effort producing a hit single, that the rest of the album is trash, so we only buy the one hit single. 

The solution here is simple.  Reform hip-hop.  Many people love rap music and they’d hate to see it diminish.  The reform of hip-hop must be soon, swift, and big if executives want the industry to bounce back.  There are enough people out there who want rap to succeed and would pay to see it get better.  Honestly, how hard could it really be?  Writing more creative songs and using less profanity shouldn’t be a challenge for rappers like Jay-Z, T.I., Kanye West, and Lil’ Wayne.  These rappers can create a rhyme out of anything, so why must it be the same thing over and over again.  Try something new and see if people buy it. - By Sam Rakoczy



MAJOR LABEL ARTISTS SUPPORTS THE MOVEMENT



Other Ways You Can Help The HIP HOP BREAK

  • Please spread the word to help the movement (SHARE on Facebook/ Post on Twitter/ Post on Instagram)!
  • Post the information on blogs, contact a music maker you know!

Exclusive Merchandise Rewards for Supporters:





 

WHAT IS THE HIP HOP BREAK?

The Hip Hop Break is a collective of fans and enthusiast, who have pooled their resources together to advance the hip hop culture. 

HOW IS THIS HIP HOP BREAK TOUR FUNDED?

The Hip Hop Break tour is funded by the members of THHB and pledges who choose to be apart of this ground-breaking opportunity to make history.

HOW CAN I SIGN UP TO BE ON THE TOUR?

Simply go to the top right of the Perks boxes, locate "Be an Artist on the Tour" and pledge $20.  Upon completing this action, please email thehiphopbreak@gmail.com the confirmation of your pledge, Indiegogo Username, Contact # and, a MP3 version of a song.  "This can be either an acappella version or full song".   All music must be orginal.  THHB will send you a confirmation email upon receipt of both the confirmation of pledge and song. DO NOT SEND ANY MUSIC TO THE EMAIL IF YOU HAVE NOT MADE A PLEDGE  

WHAT TYPE OF ARTIST CAN BE APART OF THIS?

Hip Hop/ Rap solo artist only. No Groups can pledge to be in the selection.

HOW ARE THE FINAL 8 ARTISTS SELECTED TO GO ON THE TOUR?

All artists will make a pledge $20 and submit one mp3 to (thehiphopbreak@gmail.com) for The Hip Hop Break’s members to rate. The top 100 artist will be contacted to submit a final song and based on that submission; the 8 final artists will be selected as participants in The Hip Hop Break tour. 

WHAT IS THE MINIMUM AGE TO SUBMIT A SONG AND BE CONSIDERED TO GO ON THE TOUR?

The minimum age requirement to make a pledge and submit a song and be eligible for tour selection is 18.  Please note that the artist must be 18 at the time of music submission.  THHB will request proof of age during the final selection process.

HOW LONG WILL EACH SHOW BE?

The total performance time for all shows will be a 45 minute set in total for all 8 artist on the tour.

HOW LONG WILL THE TOUR BE?

The tour will start in 2nd week of January for 3 weeks. 

WHEN WILL THE FINAL 8 ARTISTS BE SELECTED?

By then third week of December 2013.

WHAT IS THE PRICE TO GET INTO EACH SHOW?

The price for entry into all performances will vary based on the venue and location.  The artist are not required to sell a set number or tickets to performances however we do encourage the artist promote the tour. The 8 final artist are encouraged to promote the shows on social media sites including but not limited to blogs, facebook, twitter and instagram.

WILL WE RECEIVE A RECORDING CONTRACT?

No, this is only a tour to help new artists break out into the culture. 

WILL ARTISTS BE PAID FOR THE TOUR?

Artist on the tour will receive a weekly per diem for food.

WILL MANAGERS OR ANY OTHER PERSON BE ABLE TO TRAVEL WITH THE ARTIST ON THE TOUR? 

No one will be able to be on the tour but the artists selected.









SEE THE OTHER MEMBERS VIDEOS ON www.TheHipHopBreak.com

story:
Seriously Silly Songs

A concert fundraiser for The Boiler Room

7:00pm Sat April 11, 2015 
Northwest Maritime Center 
Ballroom
431 Water Street
Port Townsend WA

Featuring The Kings of Mongrel Folk (Mark Graham and Orville Johnson)
http://www.mongrelfolk.com
Listen Mark sing to Oedipus Rex

And also featuring The Colonels of Corn (The Canote Brothers)
http://www.canote.com/home.php
The Canotes sing: Twins
I got nuthin

These are the funniest singer song-writers in Cascadia (the North-West), maybe nationwide. They are brought to you by The Boiler Room, a 501(c)3 charitable institution.


The Boiler Room

"The Boiler Room is a volunteer-operated coffeehouse and social services hub dedicated to building community by providing a safe place for the growth and improvement of individuals."

The Boiler Room sponsors and hosts a number of free events including free concerts, free art shows, and free food every weekend.



The Boiler Room web page is at www.ptbr.org and they can also be found on facebook and twitter.

Port Townsend's unofficial motto is: "We are all here because we are not all there".   Here is a picture of some of our staff and friends avoiding eye contact.  Guitars on the wall on right are for the use of our guests.  A different local artist shows every month--the art here is from our youngest showing artist, who is 11.  We also have a piano, games, free wifi, and a rack of brochures of other agencies in town.  We serve really-really good coffee, cookies and other snacks.



The Boiler Room provides unique services to youth in Port Townsend.

This concert is intended to raise money to help us function for the rest of the year 2015.   In addition it should be a fun party with the funniest singer songwriters in Cascadia.

What We Need & What You Get

We have reserved the Maritime Center for this event.  We would like to bring in both the these acts.  Regardless of the level of support we will have an event, but we can bring in The Kings of Mongrel Folk (Mark Graham and Orville Johnson) and The Colonels of Korn (The Canote Brothers) only if we raise over $4,000 (our official goal).  Let's raise $10,000+ dollars to put both the show and The Boiler Room on a firmer footing.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please share this link.  Let others know about our campaign.
  • Give a song to seagulls, and a card as a gift!
  • Visit our website at www.ptbr.org
  • We are a 501(c)3 charitable organization.  Your donations are tax deductible.

This is not a formal event so please dress inappropriately. 


Our manager is clearly excited about the show.


    

Disclaimer:

These performers have tentatively agreed to perform barring earthquakes, floods, plagues, invasions of martians etc, and that if for some reason they can't appear, invoke force majeure or casus fortuitus or some other crazy French or Latin legal term we don't really understand, we will try to find two other performers who in sum might equal at least half the quality of the absent performer.

only if we raise over $4,000 (our official goal).  Let's raise $10,000+ dollars to put both the show and The Boiler Room on a firmer footing.  Other Ways You Can Help 
Please share this link.  Let others know about our campaign. Give a song to seagulls, and a card as a gift!
Visit our website at www.ptbr.org


We are a 501(c)3 charitable organization.  Your donations are tax deductible.




This is not a formal event so please dress inappropriately. 

Our manager is clearly excited about the show.      

 Disclaimer:

These performers have tentatively agreed to perform barring earthquakes, floods, plagues, invasions of martians etc, and that if for some reason they can't appear, invoke force majeure or casus fortuitus or some other crazy French or Latin legal term we don't really understand, we will try to find two other performers who in sum might equal at least half the quality of the absent performer.

story:
Meeting The Philistines

   A few years back I received a random message on Facebook. It contained no text, just a black and white video with semi-muffled sound of three guys playing some raw punk rock. I immediately replied back and told them that if ever they want to get together and do some photos or video to give me a ring... A couple photoshoots, a music video, and numerous delicious home cooked meals later, here we are.

   What initially drew me to this band was, of course, their sound. That raw punk rock sound that I spoke of earlier. I felt like it was something I hadn't heard in a long while. A sound that somewhere, between all of the screaming and androgynous  vocals that litter the modern scene today, got lost. Don't get me wrong, there are tons of bands around today that fit that description I just mentioned... but it was really refreshing to hear that kind of intense, in your face punk that we all know and love. 

   What made me continue to want to help this band, and what made me want to help them with their Indiegogo campaign, was the members of the band themselves. They welcomed me into their home, fed me WAY too much food, and invited me back; never asking for anything in return, except a listen and a brainstorm of ideas. Behind the rough vocals and the heavy instrumentals is a family. A family that lives, loves, struggles, and continues on.

   When I met them I immediately knew that every one of them was genuine. They're real people. And the only thing that I've ever seen them equally as passionate about as their families, is their music. That is what convinced me to try and help them any way I could. Because nowadays, it seems that it's not too often that good people get what they deserve... and I'm hoping that through this campaign this wonderful group of individuals can start to support themselves and their families, but also do that while doing the thing they love...

- Conrad Martyn
Photographer/Filmmaker - Infirmary 63

What We Need & What You Get

   Being that no one knows exactly how much capital any project will receive through crowd funding, It's hard to break down exactly how much should be allotted for different aspects of our business model. However we can tell you the points the capital will be spent on in order of importance.

  • Reward packs
  • Music production
  • Manufacturing
  • Equipment / maintenance
  • Touring
  • Video production
  • Merchandising

The Impact

   We've often wondered what we could accomplish with a budget behind our musical ventures. The freedom to concentrate completely on our craft (if only for a short time) might allow us to build a foundation for a future career in the music industry. Getting a job doing what you love is any persons dream...

Risks & Challenges

   Any artists challenge is to get through life as a creative.... The risk is never finding a chance to get the creativity out.

    Other Ways You Can Help

       We understand being broke... So don't feel bad if you wanna help but cant... The best way to help us is to get the word out. Share this link with only your COOLEST most forward thinking friends and PLEASE ask them to do the same.

    Facebook.com/thephilistinesgreaserpunk

    Reverbnation.com/thephilistins9

story:
It's important to clarify that this is a "flexible funding" campaign. The album will go ahead even if the full target is not reached. Go ahead and order with confidence. Thanks to all who have contributed so far! - Donnacha.

New ambient mix containing work from 1998-2011 uploaded to soundcloud. Several unreleased works:

LISTEN NOW


New REMIX perk added. ONLY 3 AVAILABLE!

CHECK IT OUT



LOVE FROM DUST

The Basics

My name is Donnacha Costello. I've been making music for as long as I can remember and have been releasing it commercially since 1996:

http://www.discogs.com/artist/5735-Donnacha-Costello

In 2010 my life changed quite dramatically. I took a step back from music, quickly sold my entire studio and focused on other things.

I always knew I would come back to music and in the past year I have been working with a little synthesiser, OP-1, and posting sketches made with this to my Soundcloud page.

As my life continues to change, I finally feel ready to build up a new studio and to make a new album of ambient, emotional, experimental music - Love From Dust. 


BUY LOVE FROM DUST NOW >


Serendipity

I've been on a waiting list for an EMS Synthi A since 2001, when I first found out that Robin Wood had plans to hand-build a small batch in Cornwall, England. Even as production continued to be delayed, I waited patiently for my Synthi for many years. Eventually, I gave up hope of ever owning this instrument.

Then, something amazing happened. I was contacted by EMS to say that my Synthi was about to be built and would be ready this summer. Unbelievably, the 13 year wait was over. The timing could not have been more perfect as I had just started production on Love From Dust.


Crowdfunding

Selling Love From Dust via a crowdfunding campaign will allow me to generate the funds needed to record/manufacture the album as I want to make it:

  1. €2000 - Recording/Mastering/Design/Manufacture
  2. €720 - The cost in fees to Indiegogo and Paypal to run the campaign
  3. €6200 - EMS Sythi (Or €4000 for Buchla Music Easel)
  4. €700 - I/O device for recording

The approximate cost of making the album I want to make is €9600

Selling Love From Dust the old-fashioned way, it could take more than a year to recoup these costs. By that time, the opportunity to purchase the Synthi would also have passed me by.

I'm aiming for 66% funding, with the remainder coming from my pocket, which is why I've set the target at €6000. Indiegogo offers flexible funding, which means that if the target isn't reached, the campaign is still funded. I will continue to make the album and manufacture the physical release with the resources at my disposal should I fail to reach my ideal funding target.


Offering

I have started work on Love From Dust and will finish it by the end of 2014. It's ambient music, with a modern aesthetic and uses new ideas and techniques I've developed since the last time I made an ambient album in 2001.

As with all of the music I've released, it offers up a slice of life view of how I'm feeling, my perspective on current aesthetics in electronic music and reflections of the tools I'm choosing.

You can expect to find shades of the emotional approach of my Together Is The New Alone album (Mille Plateaux, 2001) and some of the modular synthesiser experimentalism of my  Modul.Isol album (Raster-Noton, 2004).

Don't expect it to "sound like" these albums, I've always tried not to re-tread old ground :)

At the moment, this campaign allows you to buy:

  • Love From Dust as a download or CD with download.
  • A track by track subscription as Love From Dust is being made
  • All of the above plus a thank you and acknowledgment as a financier on the CD
  • Megafriend Plus offers all of the above and an additional personal request
  • My time and 20 years of experience to get help with your projects
  • Equipment rental
  • Workshops


Examples

When I make ambient music, it sounds like this:


Or this:

Donnacha Costello - Colorseries Cocoa B

Or this:

Donnacha Costello - Drift Sketch


BUY LOVE FROM DUST NOW >


Meaning

As I've been seeing people's support rolling in over the course of this campaign, It's been a beautiful feeling to know that after 18 years of releasing records, there are still people out there who love and support my music. To know this, and to continue on our journey together, means a lot to me.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially to this campaign, I understand that. You could still help to make it successful by doing any of the following:

  • Tweet about Love From Dust with the hashtag #lovefromdust
  • Post a link to this campaign on Facebook
  • Email all your friends and tell them about Love From Dust
  • Interview me about Love From Dust for your mag/blog etc..
  • Send suggestions for additional perks via twitter: @lovefromdust
  • follow @lovefromdust on twitter
  • Do anything else you can think of

story:
The Lake Brantley Chorale is a community built and funded singing group composed of high school students, newly graduated alumni and many adults in the Central Florida area. Our mission is to provide outstanding choral performances that enrich the lives of our community through education in the arts and community outreach opportunities. We are on the verge of completing our second year as a powerful presence in our community, and we’ve had the honor of singing so many great pieces of music from Disney to Mozart to, most recently, the tremendous work of "Dido and Aeneas" by the English composer Henry Purcell which we will perform on Sunday, April 27th.

WE NEED YOUR HELP! To really be able to perform the tremendous opera "Dido and Aeneas" this spring, we need more than just our voices though: We need an orchestra! Specifically, we need to be able to pay for a couple of violinists, as well as viola, cello, bassoon and bass players. Truth be told, we want to be able to bring real art and music to the stage in a way that we know is not only possible, but also that inspires our audience to hear what can be done and performed in our very own community. 

This is a fantastic opportunity for us to share this vision with you and ask if you could help us, with any amount possible, make our musical dream come true. Please check out our numerous "Perks" for those wishing to give, especially our "Bella Notte" fundraiser event, taking place on March 30th. You'll enjoy an evening of live music from the Lake Brantley Chorale and LBC soloists, delicious spaghetti and the Disney classic movie – “Lady and the Tramp”!

Thank you!


Please Note:  Fundraiser Dinner event has passed! We still encourage contribution as we are still working to reach our goal!

story:
Hi!  I'm Jennet Ingle, and I've been a professional oboist for nearly 20 years. Being a classical musician in this 21st century has required me to become extremely entrepreneurial, in my approach to my own career and in my advocacy of classical music. 


Musicians for Michiana is a brand new chamber music series which partners local classical musicians with community organizations to the benefit of all.  Featuring today’s  composers alongside classic works from the past, MFM seeks to share our love and knowledge of music with a new audience while giving generously to those groups which make South Bend a vibrant place to live.

Chamber music is about connection.  The players, absent a conductor, must rely on each other for cues, tempos, and musical ideas.  The more complex the piece, the more deeply the two, or three, or six musicians must work together to understand and present the composer’s ideas to an audience.  It’s deeply fulfilling work, and when performed in a small venue for an interested group, can be intensely intimate, rewarding, and transforming.  With this project we seek to extend this sense of connection throughout the community.

Over the course of this first year, Musicians for Michiana will be partnering with four different non-profit organizations: Unity Gardens, Hannah and Friends, The Music Village, and Girls on the Run.  For each concert, the partner organization will assist us in promotion so that our audience consists partly of music lovers and partly of, say, gardeners who may not be as immersed in this classical world as we.  We will give a spectacular performance, with themed programming meaningful to the organization, and at the concert the non-profit will be given a platform to speak to the audience about its vision and needs.  The audience donates on a pay-what-you-like basis and all proceeds go directly to that organization.

What We Need:
Of course, professional musicians must be paid.  Audiences and musicians should be able to meet and chat and mingle afterwards, ideally while munching on delicious food provided by local restaurants. There must be programs, and publicity for these concerts so we’re not just playing for ourselves.  All of these things cost money.  Of course, this is where you come in.  

We have a budget of  $11,215.82.  Some has been offered to us as generous in-kind donations.  In partnership with The Music Village, we have applied for local grant funding.  Our goal with this campaign is to raise $5000.  Should we raise more, we can provide WINE at the receptions, or hold seed money for next year’s series.  If we should raise less, which would be very sad, we would trim our budget to the barest possible place and still work to make this exciting series a go. 


Impact:
Musicians for Michiana is good for classical music because it will introduce chamber music new and old to people who do not yet know that they love it.

Musicians for Michiana is good for musicians, who live to perform and will be remunerated for their time and work.

Musicians for Michiana is good for living composers who will have their works performed and exposed to new audiences.  

Musicians for Michiana is good for community-centered organizations - it benefits them directly and provides opportunities to get their message out to an audience.

Musicians for Michiana brings classical musicians out of the Morris and into the community, building connections with the groups we work with and the audiences we serve.

Musicians for Michiana is good for the audience.  We will be fun to listen to, you will engage with our music and with what we do, and you will be connected with organizations you may not have known about.


Other Ways You Can Help:
Maybe you don’t have even $10 to give to this cause.  Maybe you too are a classical musician, or worse, a contemporary composer.  You can still help with this exciting project! 

Please share this campaign!  Tell your friends and your rich friends. Let us know that you are enthusiastic! Write a testimonial about this exciting series, and how you plan to attend, and let us share it!

There are little teasers above of what to expect on the concert night; a thing to be released in the next year.... This is a chance to pre-purchase your ticket to the event too!

  • get a ticket to the show (your name will be on the guestlist)
  • free download of my debut EP “Caja sin oxígeno”
  • free download of project’s upcoming single

Sunday April 28th

story:
Short Summary

Dream Evil Pictures brings you KINGS OF SLEAZE: MENTORS ROCKUMENTARY.

Heavy metal band, Mentors (1977) were known for their offensive and perverse lyrics. They have changed the history of rock n roll and have shaped bands today.

SLAYED IN OREGON is a public access Heavy Metal TV series based in Portland, Oregon. We strive to promote underground and national touring bands in the great Pacific Northwest through interviews, short documentaries, music videos, live events and more!

THE MENTORS have made a huge dent in the history of rock 'n' roll. After the tragic death of singer/ drummer, El Duce, The Mentors are continuing to tour and record new music with singer/ drummer "Mad Dog".

This campaign will help finance equipment for Dream Evil Pictures and help finish its first full length documentary.

ABOUT ME

  • Hi, I'm April Jones, creator, producer, editor, artist and visionary of Slayed in Oregon, a heavy metal TV series.  I've been an artist for as long as I can remember. I fell in love with visual storytelling and pursued a degree in Video Production . My creativity has been recognized throughout the film industry, working as a scenic artist, art director, production designer, graphic designer, art assistant, set dresser and prop maker for large notable productions. (Portlandia, Cake, Intel, Roku, Mazda, Quango)
  • Your contribution will make a tremendous impact and help expose and enrich an authentic culture!

What We Need & What You Get

Equipment Break Down:

  • Equipment: camera, sound, lighting, tripod, light stands, editing software, SD cards, hard drives, batteries, website expenses, crew.
  • Some perks include personalized booklet of photos from the road, an autographed poster signed by the MENTORS, a chance to go "behind the scenes" of a SLAYED IN OREGON TV studio production and more!

Be a part of the story!

Follow me on this journey! Sign up for our newsletter! MentorsRockumentary@gmail.com

The Impact

This documentary will enrich and educate a general audience about the history of the MENTORS.

  • For the past 4 years SLAYED IN OREGON has been uniting a variety of "metal heads" in the Oregon area and striving to make a difference for underground and emerging artists.
  • SLAYED IN OREGON has been featured on Blabbermouth, Bravewords, Metal Rules, Riff Magazine, Wild Child Magazine, Planet Six String magazine, KOUV radio, Comcast TV channels and more!
  • This project is valuable to the contributors and to the world! This gives YOU a chance to be a part of this rockumentary!

Other way you can help!

  • Get the word out and make some noise!! \m/
  • Tell your friends!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Come to the fundraiser parties!!
story_txt:
Short Summary
Dream Evil Pictures brings you KINGS OF SLEAZE: MENTORS ROCKUMENTARY.Heavy metal band, Mentors (1977) were known for their offensive and perverse lyrics. They have changed the history of rock n roll and have shaped bands today.SLAYED IN OREGON is a public access Heavy Metal TV series based in Portland, Oregon.
 We strive to promote underground and national touring bands in 
the great Pacific Northwest through interviews, short documentaries, 
music videos, live events and more!THE MENTORS have made a huge dent in the history of rock 'n' roll. After the tragic death of singer/ drummer, El Duce, The Mentors are continuing to tour and record new music with singer/ drummer "Mad Dog".This campaign will help finance equipment for Dream Evil Pictures and help finish its first full length documentary. ABOUT ME
Hi, I'm April Jones, creator, producer, editor, artist and visionary of Slayed in Oregon, a heavy metal TV series.  I've been an artist for as long as I can remember. I fell in love with visual storytelling and 
pursued a degree in Video Production . My creativity has been recognized throughout the film industry, 
working as a scenic artist, art director, production designer, graphic 
designer, art assistant,  set dresser and prop maker for large notable productions. (Portlandia, Cake, Intel, Roku, Mazda, Quango)

Your contribution will make a tremendous impact and help expose and enrich an authentic culture!

What We Need & What You GetEquipment Break Down:
Equipment: camera, sound, lighting, tripod, light stands, editing software, SD cards, hard drives, batteries, website expenses, crew.

Some perks include personalized booklet of photos from the road, an autographed poster signed by the MENTORS, a chance to go "behind the scenes" of a SLAYED IN OREGON TV studio production and more!

Be a part of the story!Follow me on this journey! Sign up for our newsletter! MentorsRockumentary@gmail.comThe ImpactThis documentary will enrich and educate a general audience about the history of the MENTORS.
For the past 4 years SLAYED IN OREGON has been uniting a variety of "metal heads" in the Oregon area and striving to make a difference for underground and emerging artists.
SLAYED IN OREGON has been featured on Blabbermouth, Bravewords, 
Metal Rules, Riff Magazine, Wild Child Magazine, Planet Six String 
magazine, KOUV radio, Comcast TV channels and more!
This project is valuable to the contributors and to the world! This gives YOU a chance to be a part of this rockumentary!

Other way you can help!
Get the word out and make some noise!! \m/

Tell your friends! 

Use the Indiegogo share tools!
Come to the fundraiser parties!!

story:
WHO IS GALI?

Gali is know as one of Hampi's most remarkable figures. He is the music man of this wonderfull city, famous for recieving tourists and travellers with incomparable good vibrations, into jam sessions, soundhealing sessions or a nice cup of chai. 

 

He is know for making people play music, even if they are not musicians. He invites them into their shop. He shows him his guitars, drums and flutes. He makes people get to know each other through music, community healing and individual expression. 

 

Is there anything better to do??

 

WHAT IS WRONG? 

 

However, not all is easy in Gali's life. Besides having to pay the rent pf his shop, supporting his family (Gali is father of two kids, passionate for music and talented ones), he now faces the threats of demolition. 

Indian govenerment is about to pass a bill that will tear down many of Hampi's local dreams. Shops will be demolished and they will run out of business... so... no more music shop, no more music, no more projects for Gali.

 

THE PLAN 

 

In a near future, NEW HAMPI will be born, on the other side of the river where Gali's shop is. This will be the new touristic center of Happy Hampi, where most shops, hostels and restaurants will be. Gali's good vibe's will have to be there but, in order for that to happen. he needs to buy land. 

20.000 USD is what he needs to build is new place: NEW HAMPI MUSIC HEAVEN, where people will be able to continue jamming and meeting, getting to know the best of Hampi, wich is the warmth of it's people. 

This place will host concerts and artistic residencies, inviting professional and amateur musicians from all over the world.

 

 

YOUR REWARD

If you help Gali, with whatever amount, you will have the right to stay in NEW HAMPI MUSIC HEAVEN for 3 nights. Not a bad way to stay in Hampi, hum?

story:
Hello everyone!

My name's Armando. I am here to tell you a bit about myself and this project! I've always had an excessive addiction to music and asked for my first (acoustic) guitar when I was around 11 years old (thanks Mom). After plucking a few strings and tweaking the tuners for about two hours on Christmas morning, I realized I had no idea what I was doing. I tucked the guitar into my closet and spent the next year killing as many brain cells as I could on my Super Nintendo before I decided to give it another go. 

 

Apparently murdering brain cells with video games makes you a better guitar player because something clicked. I began teaching myself the classics (ACDC, Eagles, Led Zeppelin) and  eventually got decent enough to impress my Dad, who bought me my first electric guitar (thanks Dad, miss you).


Eventually I found Metal.

 

Fast forward fifteen years *swooshy time travel noise effects*

 

I got married, got a job that pays most of the bills, and got my own Netflix account… I officially became an adult. I had long since abandoned the dream of becoming a Rockstar and/or an Astronaut. Life was amazing, but something was still missing.

 

After some heavy soul searching and a chat with my barber, I realized that I was yearning to create some new music. My wife has this thing where every new year, she insists we make some serious resolution goals to work toward the next year. I decided 2020 was going to be the year I did something I always dreamt of… I was going to record an album!

 

Little did I know at the time that 2020 was also the year the world would end. Threats of war with North Korea, a global pandemic, mass looting, murder hornets (still kind of bummed that one didn’t really take off), toilet paper turning into a form of currency… All epic material for the new album! High five 2020!!!

 

I picked up my new 7 string guitar (purchased just in time for this album) and the songs just came oozing out!!! I scouted out other musicians from around the world using modern technology to send files and ideas back and forth, and the album quickly took shape!

 

This brings me to here and now.  THIS IS WHERE YOU COME IN! 

 

I have all the music, I have the website, I even have cool little stickers… 

 

I am here to ask for your help in raising the funds necessary to release it “into the wild.” I know a global recession is probably not the best time to ask for financial assistance… but here I am, doing exactly that.

 

I am trying to raise $3,000 for the purchase, production, and distribution of CD’s

 

Cost breakdown for the album:

  • Computer programs and hardware used to record the album (already invested): $3,360
  • Other musicians hired to perform on the album (already invested): $2,340
  • Production of lyric videos and promotional materials/logos (already invested): $1,100
  • Professional mixing/mastering (already invested): $2,000

Total: $8,800 (don’t tell my wife)

 

I have already invested a bunch of money into bringing this album to life. The official digital release date is already set at 10/10/2020 (just because it’s an awesome date). Now I need your help in putting music to vinyl (well, technically silicone)!

 

I don’t expect anyone to just dish over the cash without anything in return, so I’ve created this account in an effort to trade your hard-earned cash, for some awesome tunes and merchandise:

 

  • Digital downloads of the album (mp3 files available several weeks prior to official release date)
  • Physical copies of the album with the album artwork
  • “A Vicious End” merchandise like hats, shirts, and hoodies
  • Guitar/Bass tabs for the album’s tracks
  • Stickers!

 

I truly appreciate your support and I really hope you enjoy the music!

 

-Best wishes-

Armando Diaz

story:
Soul Patch is working on a brand new, full length, studio album and is asking for your help to make it happen.

Soul Patch’s rhythm section has held solid since a 2006 NYE party at a haunted inn on the Old Mission Peninsula.  With the 2012 addition of a powerful one man horn section they have been tightening their arrangements and writing conscious, organic grooves, for your mind and feet while helping people party with a purpose.  Anyone who has been to a Soul Patch show knows it is a chance to dance and get down to some positive energy.

Soul Patch shines at music festivals and venues all over the Midwest building a strong and loyal following of family.  You may have seen them at Shangri-La, Hoodilidoo, the Beaver Island Music Festival, Earthwork Harvest Gathering, Dunegrass, Hoxeyville, Farm Block Fest, FarmFest, the TC Film Festival, Meadowfest, or even on the banks of the Boardman river.

With a sound that has been described as a soulful mash up of reggae, funk, and jamgrass, these roots rockers have independently released two albums to date:  2007’s EP “Live @ Radius”  and 2012’s Full length studio effort “S.P.I.N.”  Now they are working on a new album for 2014 titled “Dirty Work”. Heavy on the dance vibe, reaching deep into reggae territory, and drawing lyrically from nearly a decade of band trials, triumphs and tribulations, "Dirty Work" will make you groove and sing along.

This is where Soul Patch needs YOU, family.  Please contribute to the Soul Patch IndieGoGo Campaign to help record, mix, and press to CD this new creative endeavor.  There are great incentives for contributing between $5 and $1,500 including: private shows, professionally cooked meals in your house, newly released live recordings from the Beaver Island Music Festival and Earthwork Harvest Gathering, limited edition artwork, and of course personal hugs from the band.

See you on the dance floor!

Soul Patch

(Wink, Animal, CB, Adam T. & Scuba)

 

Quite simply, we need your help to make this project happen. We don't make quite enough with our day jobs and playing gigs to afford the expenses of a new album. However, with your help, we will be able to record, produce, master, and print an entirely new album as well as get everyone that much needed Soul Patch shirt or sticker. We need your help. Otherwise, this album is simply just a dream. We are not looking for funds for anything except the new album and to print some new merchandise.  Once achieved, Soul Patch, history will be made!  Not to mention the AMAZING perks you get for donating! Check out the list and pick your prize. We will deliver as soon as it is ALL ready. Help spread a loving conscious message and get some great some sweet merchandise, good karma and great prizes!!!

This campaign is the first in our 10 year history. We are not planning on stopping making music and can't stress enough how much we appreciate you and your donation. We hope you'll take advantage of our PERKS!!! We will be working with clean/green companies and local businesses whenever possible. If you do not wish to use PayPal, don't have an account or are kind of "old fashion", PLEASE send a check or money order made out to: Chris Belanger - 3530 S. Lake Shore Dr. Lake Leelanau, MI 49653

In closing, if you can't donate monetarily, please share the link to our IndieGoGo campaign and help us spread the word to those who might be interested in donating to this amazing project. Thank you for helping us make the movement move!!!

story:
Short Summary

We are a three-piece indie rock band from London, called About:Blank. We've been gigging around London for the last few months and are trying to take our careers to the next level.

What We Need & What You Get

Our campaign is simple, we need to raise money to record a pro quality single. While our demos have served us well thus far, they can't take us where we want to go and studios are expensive! 

We've garnered some industry praise and attention, but we need recordings of a certain quality to be taken seriously and pitched to the right people.

In exchange for your support we're offering a number of perks, ranging from our eternal gratitude to actually playing on the record. We can't tell you how important this is to us, and any contribution is greatly appreciated.

Other Ways You Can Help

Times are tough, we get it. It's the whole reason we launched this campaign in the first place! Some of you just can’t afford to contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Share our campaign on Facebook or Twitter.
  • Like our Facebook page - www.facebook.com/officialaboutblank
  • Follow us on Twitter - @About_____Blank (5 underscores)
  • Follow us on SoundCloud - www.soundcloud.com/officialaboutblank
  • Tell your friends and family about us.
  • Come to a gig and check us out live.

Thanks for viewing our campaign.

Adam, Andrew & Benjamin - About:Blank

story:
Short Summary

"…When you are in the service of your fellow beings, you are only in the service of your God".

We are in need of your help!  We have a dream of completing our Debut Album "Shine Brightly". The writing, recording, and especially the production of our first Album have all come with enormous expense.  We pray you will find it in your heart to help us complete this project.  "When you are in the service of your fellow being, you are only in the service of your God".  We dedicate this album to YOU and to the Lord. We truly pray every day the we will create positive, uplifting, inspiring Music that will touch your heart and Change the World!

What We Need & What You Get

May the New Year 2014 "Shine Brightly" with our new Album!  In order to complete this project we need your Support!  Along with our tremendous gratitude and love, we will give you a GIFT for your donation. Each donation amount has a special gift attached!  As your donation amount increases, our gifts increase in value as well!  Thank you for all your love and support!

The Impact

You CAN make a difference!!!

To show their Community Support ... Mandee and the ABC girls will be giving 10% of your contributions to Southern Utah Songwriters Association!

We live in a day when we are in desperate need for positive young role models! Mandee and the ABC girls hope to inspire young and old alike to remember who they are!  They pray in some small or big way they can help stop the decay of morality, honesty, and integrity in the world.  Their goal is to build people up, spark a newness of hope, love and unity!  They pray their music will touch your heart and change the world!  They truly are a beacon of HOPE and LIGHT in this world!  They are a true testimony that Goodness, Love, Happiness  and Hope still exist and WE ALL can have these things in our lives!

Already, Mandee and the ABC Girls are blessing people and families with their sincere unconditional love and talent.  You will feel their true passion and uplifting message when you listen to their music, amazing vocals, and harmonies.

Mandee and the ABC girls give their time and talents to all those they come in contact with.  They sing and perform for anyone that requests with no expectations except the smiles on their faces…you'll find Mandee and the ABC girls all over Southern Utah performing and singing anywhere people will listen. They have sung for Weddings, Funerals, Graduations, Sport Events, Stores, Restaurants, Holiday Events, Hospitals, Care Centers, Churches, Homes, and More!  

You WILL make an impact with your donation.  You, together with Mandee and the ABC girls, can bless the world by making this Album possible!  Mandee and the ABC girls is a new fresh band of FOUR sisters.  They are a RARE and very "Gifted Young Group" that is certainly destined to bless the whole world with their positive music, amazing harmonies, and authentic love for people and the world.  Please become one of the first to REALLY support these wonderful girls and their mission.

You TRULY CAN make a difference!

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this on FaceBook, Twitter, My Space, & Tell everyone you know! :)

Even if you cannot donate at this time..please share this with all your friends and family!

Thank You Again for all your support! 

God Bless You and May ALL your dreams come true!


"BEST VALUE PACKAGE"

GOLD package gives you:

A custom "Shine Brightly" T-Shirt!

2 Shine Brightly Wrist Bands

2 Shine Brightly Guitar Picks! 

The Exclusive Autographed "Mandee and the ABC girls" POSTER....Only Available on this promotion.

ALSO! Receive an Autographed Copy of our "Shine Brightly" Album! with Your Name Placed in our CD Credits with a special "Thank You" for your support!

(add $10 for shipping outside North America)

story:
Updates


Thanks to you, the awesome friends and fans of SYSTEM SYN, we've reached the initial goal to make a music video! So that means, yes, it''s definitely happening. However, we're still hoping to raise as much as possible, becasue the more money we raise, the more music videos we can make, and the better they will be. 

Check out the "Updates" tab on this page to hear some song samples from the new album and leave a comment to let me know what you think.

If we hit the $4k mark, I'll throw in some extra items for EVERYONE that contributes, and for every $1k over that, I'll keep stacking up the bonus items you will receive. Also, Everytime we hit another $1k milestone, I'm posting a new song for you to check out.

Thank you all!

Best wishes,

Clint Carney

 

About

My name is Clint Carney. I'm the singer and song writer for the band SYSTEM SYN. My new album, "No Sky to Fall," will be coming out November 12th, 2013 on Metropolis Records. 

I am going to be filming one or more music videos to help promote the album, and enhance the experience of listening to these songs. Basically, I'm putting the money that I make from this into creating some really cool video content, to say thank you to all of my fans and friends who have supported me over the years.

With your help, we can make this goal a reality. 

Where the money is going:

The money raised from this campaign will go toward every aspect needed to make a great music video (or videos). This includes equipment purchase and rental, crew, talent, locations, etc.

The more money we raise, the better the video(s) can be, and the more videos we can make.

In exchange for your financial support, I'm offering some cool exclusive merch that you can't get anywhere else. And on top of that, you'll be featured in the credits for whichever video your money goes toward funding.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially but would still like to help out, please help spread the word about this campaign by posting a link to this page anywhere and everywhere you can. Indie Gogo has some built in "share tools" that you can use as well.

Thank you so much. I hope you enjoy "No Sky to Fall," and I look forward to making some crazy video content for you to enjoy along with the album.

Best wishes,

Clint Carney

story:
What

Musician Jonathan Weiss and filmmaker Jesse Carlson are teaming up to produce a music video for the song 'Frontier Boys' off Jonathan's new album

LISTEN: http://t0tesrept1l1an.bandcamp.com/track/frontier-boys

The song is about tragic young lovers in West Los Angeles and for the video we want to make a visual metaphor between the emotional distance of Los Angeles life and the physical desert on which this city is built. We want the video to be monumental but we can't do it without your help.

We hope to raise $1200 to make a video that can match the industry standard of professionalism and quality. With your contributions we will be able to bring our vision to life!

 

Here's a link to Jesse's film work: http://vimeo.com/user4709824

and Jonathan's full album: http://www.allwallsshattered.com/

so you can get a feel for the creatives involved in this project.

 

What your contributions will fund:

  • Steadicam + Operator
  • Portajib/Crane
  • Wardrobe
  • Permits
  • Set Design
  • Props
  • Transportation
  • Food

We are prepping for a three-day shoot on location in the Mojave Desert, at urban locations around LA, and on sets that will be constructed for the shoot. A crew of around 20 people will be enlisted to build sets, man cameras, act in the production, and edit the final product. Though Jesse can get some equiptment and assistance for free through his film school, we need a budget to provide for the other aspects of production listed above.

 

What you get in return:

We have an awesome line up of rewards for your pledges:

  • CD’s of the newly mixed and mastered ‘Perfect Storm,’
  • Posters of Anna Jackson’s intricate and intimate psychedelic album cover
  • Shirts of the AllWallsShattered logo (also designed by Anna)
  • Limited Edition Signed Vinyl of 'A Perfect Storm'
  • Trial Session of Jonathan’s ‘Post-Apocalyptic Boot Camp’ Workout
  • Professional Photo Shoots provided by Jesse
  • Private musical performances by Jonathan (solo)
  • AND a personal show for you and your friends by THE PELICAN FLAME

Why contribute?

  1. We all like bad ass music videos
  2. This is a chance for Jonathan and Jesse to pursue their passions in the professional arena. The funding from this campaign will raise the production value of this project to the level of quality you would expect from an upcoming artist/director.
  3. You’ll get some cool stuff out of it.
  4. You'll recieve updates on the filmmaking process and have access to behind the scenes exclusives.
  5. Feel great because you contributed to the creation of an epic video you can watch again and again (as a means of procrastination from your real life) !!!

 

This is cool and all, but I'm not giving you guys any money...

If you can’t contribute… that’s ok! Show your support by sharing this fundraiser on the internet and passing it along to friends and fam who might be interested. Maybe you've got a rich aunt who loves vinyl.

 

Thank you for visiting our IndieGogo site! Please spread the word and look out for updates on the evolution of this project!

 

Many thanks,

Jonathan and Jesse

story:
Nightwaves

We are an up and coming two man band originating from the North East of England and have been writing and creating songs since 2008. After a two year break due to band member family commitments, we are back and ready to create new music! We also hope to inspire everyone with our music and share our experiences with all our fans! We are very passionate about the music we create and accept all kinds of feedback, as we feel it is your voice which will help us to progress further.

 

We have created this campaign to help spread the word about Nightwaves, as well as raise some funds to help put our plans into action, such as completing all recordings for our debut album, and possibly help to buy equipment needed for gigs. This money could help give us that break we need to burst onto the music scene!

 

All contributions are welcome and are hugely appreciated! Also, to show how grateful we are, we will send you a song of your choice for free! So spread the word and help us to achieve our dreams.

story:
About Phillip Ramirez & "Dance Disco Heat"

Hello! My name is Phillip Ramirez, I was born in Newport Beach california. I come from a very musical family and learned at a young age the love and joy that comes from music. As a very young person, I was always creating and developing different musical groups both instrumental and vocal, which lead me into my professional music career that started back in 1988 after appearing at the "World famous Apollo Theatre" 3 consecutive times. I was then approached by the Washington D.C. production team 95 North. Our first dance club single release "See the Light" was a hit and catapulted my career overnight! Since then, I have been fortunate enough to travel the world performing as a Dance club recording artist with over 30 dance singles to date. I have since evolved into a professional acting career and have most recently produced, co-wrote and am the Principle lead in a musical play "Dance Disco Heat" a tribute to the Disco Icon "Sylvester." His music touched the world with such hits as "You make me feel Mighty real" and "Do you wanna funk." I have always been a huge fan of Sylvester, not only with his music but his pioneer mentality in paving the road and not allowing others to dictate how he lived his life. His music had such an impact on my own musical career that I felt compelled to tell his story and remind those young and old that love surpasses all predjudice. "Dance Disco Heat"  is a beautiful, glitzy, musical journey that takes you from his humble beginnings, to fame, meeting the love of his life and the AIDS epidemic all done in a grand musical story. From beginning to end, you will feel Sylvester's presence through the emulation and authentic renditions performed in the same fashion that Sylvester and his two tons of fun (backup duo) did back in the 70's, all done Via the mirrored character Octavius (Phillip Ramirez) and the Mega Girls! "Dance Disco Heat" made it's world debut in Richmond Virginia in July 2012 to rave reviews.  GAYRVA Link;          http://www.gayrva.com/arts-culture/theater-review-dance-disco-heat/   and on WTVR News Channel 6 Link: http://youtu.be/j7ix-Rggnu4    in addition to national mention by "Jeanie Tracy" (Recording Artist & former backup singer and dear friend to Sylvester) After watching an excerpt that I posted from "Dance Disco Heat" on you tube, Tracy commented: "WOW... it's EERIE... sounds so much like my brother and friend... You really capture the esence of Sylvester's sound and voice," she proceeded to repost the video on facebook, along with the message, "You have to check this out!"   In addition to a comment by the world famous Drag Icon "Lady Bunny" (Comedian, recording artist, public figure) who also posted the video on her facebook, saying, " A full recreation of Sylvester's eight minute version of  "You are my friend," written by Patti Labelle. Phillip Ramirez sounds just like Sylvester (which isn't easy) and if you know the original eight minute version, you will appreciate this."  "WERK!, you sound amazing!" She posted to Ramirez.

Because of your generous donations, we will be able to:

*Rent much needed rehearsal space before our west coast debut.

*Assist in the cost needed for transporting costumes, props, cast and crew for such a show as this.

*Attain the national interest needed to launch "Dance Disco Heat" across the country and internationally. 

 Don't worry! If you cannot donate, you can still help!

By liking our facebook page, watching our video's on you tube, linking us to your social networks or simply spreading the news about our exciting adventure and needs to all and everyone you can!

The more people that know about this Fabulous show and our efforts to take this all the way to the top the better!

A heartfelt thanks

I want to thank each and every one of you from the bottom of my heart for your wonderful comments, support, kind words, emotion, encouragement, love and compassion for this touching production. Your contributions are much appreciated and will be put to a good cause that holds a very bright future, and we will always be grateful to you!
