story:
Click here to listen to some music! - www.themusicofdanielkincaid.com

In 2004, Daniel first established a small business he affectionately called Mystic Productions.  This was created in order to provide an avenue to distribute music and art, initially his own, but his vision was to build a vehicle to bring beautiful and inspiring works of many other artists, across all genres, out into the world.  In its prior incarnation the company never found its wings and for the past few years has been in an inactive state, but today we believe the time has come to get Mystic Productions off the ground beginning right here with this grassroots campaign...and it can be done with your help!  Once we can get the company going, all monies taken in will be recycled into funding more art projects.  This is intended as a not for profit endeavor.  Instead of a company getting rich off the works of artists, collecting all the money and giving a criminally small percentage in return, we will be doing just the opposite.  We will be providing for artists while facilitating the creation and distribution of their art.  Our company is and will be an ever-growing cooperative network of artists.  The artists maintain rights and collect the appropriate benefits from their works.  The percentage they elect to give or donate back to the company will be entirely up to them and will then help provide the opportunity for the next art/artist...and so on.  There is always more art to create and bring out into the world to share together.  If we choose to allow for any additional use of funds we have certainly considered what we might be able to do if they were dedicated toward programs fostering the arts in communities worldwide and/or toward other charities, causes, organizations, etc. working to make the world a better place.  Presently we are focused upon the creation part and yet aspire toward the fullest of possibilities in this company's potential.  "The goal is in spreading this creative vision and passion across the globe for participating in the shaping of our world, in the evolution of human consciousness and in how we are creating our shared reality through cooperation, learning, growing and nurturing greater awareness, and all done in the spirit of this embracing engagement together with the way of the Mystic Artist alive in all of us."  Kincaid's inspired journey has been that of what one might call a modern mystic; deeply spiritual, of passionate dreams, traversing the outskirts of consciousness and possibility, yet complete with false starts, falls from grace, dark nights of soul and rises from the ashes in truly dazzling fashion.  Today, as he approaches the ever iconic 33rd year of life, he has come to what may finally be the moment of his emergence as an Artist and Visionary.  Daniel is a true force, a powerful spirit and a being of great heart...and his music embodies this as undeniably as he does.  

 

The Mystic Artist - Phase 1 

By Daniel Kincaid

                                                     Production Costs 

"Creating a cd is an expensive endeavor...let alone creating two!  The good news is that this is what we have to move forward with at the onset here - two full-length albums along with a fairly extensive back catalogue of music that I am bringing with me.  The pictures you see above are examples of this type of collaborative artistic work within the greater vision.  The paintings were inspired by the music, and the artistic relationship that formed between myself and the painter is one to carry into future productions.  Though the ultimate goal remains always in the multi-genre cross-collaborative artist production company, I am first a poet, songwriter, composer and musician.  So, you may not be surprised to find that this platform begins with a musical production.  As this company and its vision does originate with me, these outward movements with my artwork initially does simultaneously, and quite conveniently I'll admit, provide greater potential for the success of the business as a whole.  Moving forward, the greater the ability to gain a presence with my own work will only serve to help generate funding and opportunity for Mystic Productions.  As for this flagship/prototype process, so far I have been able to cover the initial expenses in tracking, mixing and mastering the audio, which is in fact the brunt of it.  However, now with the music ready to make its way out into the world, we (my small team of amazing people and I) are finding ourselves tapped out, completely spread thin...essentially...broke.  In order to help finance what we are doing presently which includes but is not limited to; the registering of domain names, hosting, licensing, disc manufacturing, materials, distribution, promotion, publishing, registration for royalties, etc. -  I/we need your help!!!  We need help with the duplication/replication expenses and the cost of materials for the first runs.  In the future we can eventually acquire our own printing press, but that is likely some time away yet.  We also need help in order to finance the online and physical distribution.  A BIG element is that we need to provide for promotion, marketing, and the costs for an outward presence, not only in the physical world, but also, perhaps primarily at the moment, the web presence.  It would also be great to be able to print up posters, t-shirts and other such elements/merchandise to accompany these musical/artistic works and their progress outward."

 

(Editors Note: If you go to the website found at the top of the page you will see that some of this is up and running, albeit in its infancy.  This is not quite the professional level web presence we aspire towards, but that is why we are here!  The Mystic Productions website is another matter for it is not up at the moment - we are working on it along with filing the appropriate forms to re-activate the business - which is also quite costly.  This campaign is in part to help us cover the expenses we are incurring in this phase of the process and to finance the elements discussed in the next sections that we cannot cover.  It is important to understand first that this is a great challenge to have, and we recognize that.  We need to raise money so that we can finance the creation and circulation of shared experiences in beautiful music and art throughout the world.  This endeavor is truly our very heart and soul.  We cherish this great opportunity to do this work, to grow and to take our vision to the next level.  We are and will be working hard to continually develop and maintain the web presence.  We see web domains as living relationships where we can have ever-evolving galleries - venues in the virtual world to share and engage with works of art.  In the physical world the next steps bring us into the realm of staging live events...but first we need some proper equipment.)


                                                 Live Productions

"I have the great fortune of having absolutely the most fantastic team of people surrounding this movement forward.  As part of the process into the next phase of things, I am relocating to California where I'll be joining some of this team out there, with others on the way.  Though we have these initial expenses for our physical locations and relocations covered as well...of course anything extra only helps us starving artists!  The basic plan with the remaining funds after the promotion, production and distribution costs is to channel funding directly into the next most pressing issues for our foundation: Staging and promoting live events and acquiring gear - Pedal Boards, Amplification, Mics, PA Speakers, Power Amps, and other such event production equipment.  This is not only connected with the promotion, marketing and distribution, it is vital within the holistic effort to establish everything we need in order to succeed in building an initial foundation to bring to life the music, to facilitate its outward momentum, and provide a vehicle for sharing it with the world/together "live".  First of all, this is something I am immensely passionate about and find deeply meaningful for the value of just that - sharing in music together.  This participation and what it means collectively for our human heart and spirit cannot be minimized, in fact I believe it primal, fundamental, vital, elemental, essential, tribal, biological, bio-spiritual, and absolutely woven into the fabric of our existence.  This most ancient and magical reality of sound, spirit and connection is always most intimately connected to the heart and soul of this endeavor and of me...and this reality remains always at the forefront among my highest motivations."

  

                                                  Studio Equipment

"Microphones, Outboard Gear, Effects and other such recording studio elements, as well as cameras, canvases, paint, supplies, lighting, etc.(you get the idea); all will help us build toward the ultimate goal of facilitating the birth of many works of art into our world.  This initial campaign will of course not be able to fund all of this.  While we are in "beta" mode with this first project, we are learning and will be coming forth next time around with a complete tested model and comprehensive business plan layout for the vision.  In the meantime, we would like to grow as much as possible.  For the moment it would be great to start by acquiring a couple more pieces for the next productions which will include music and sound but will also encompass other mediums such as video/film, dance, creative writing, visual arts...and so on.  My complete vision is of course more than a single music studio, but rather housing studio space for numerous mediums of art, with artists producing and collaborating among and across the multiple genres.  We commonly use the word entertainment for the industry where work of this nature takes place, but within that it is really the art that calls to us.  Beginning with the initial process here of laying the groundwork for future productions, we are setting course with an emphasis on taking the steps toward first providing the ability to generate fully professional quality audio, then in Phase 2 we will be building and expanding from there, and ultimately, in Phase 3 we will reach the level of multi-genre/medium/media production company. This is Phase 1."

 

                                              Regarding Artistic Vision

  "The Impact of art generally upon the world and within/among humanity is difficult to quantify.  The Mystic Artist engages this process of bringing forth works that move through the spirit in great heart and inspiration as participating in the evolution of human consciousness.  Therefore, in this work, the artist or creative visionary plays a part in shaping the world and in shaping our shared reality now and to come.  Here the artist can "create" toward the highest good for the future of our human family.  I am deeply grateful for the opportunity to participate and wish only to do so to my fullest in the time that I have here and now.   The chance to create, and in doing so, to reach whatever my potential may be in playing my part toward the highest good for all is the heart of the matter.  There is no hidden agenda for personal gain, rather where I and this music go out into the world and into our collective experience will be decided by you and us together.  Likewise, what we are able to do with this business, in fostering and generating artist's works for our shared world, will be determined "together" - A shared effort in this sacred work.

 

Team Closing: This campaign is called Phase 1 because it is the first of three where we are working to bring inspiring visions and life enriching works to the world through this grassroots effort.

We cherish any support and promise to honor the vision and the purpose that has been shared here each and every step of the way.  

This endeavor is truly a matter of the heart and to lead with/from the heart is truly a matter of great courage and faith.  It is our hope that you will now unite yours with ours in bringing to life such creations to be shared together now, and furthermore, as a form of contribution in our time here toward our global human family and the future of our beloved world yet to come.
story_txt:
Click here to listen to some music! - www.themusicofdanielkincaid.com
In 2004, Daniel first established a small business he affectionately called Mystic Productions.  This was created in order to provide an avenue to distribute music and art, initially his own, but his vision was to build a vehicle to bring beautiful and inspiring works of many other artists, across all genres, out into the world.  In its prior incarnation the company never found its wings and for the past few years has been in an inactive state, but today we believe the time has come to get Mystic Productions off the ground beginning right here with this grassroots campaign...and it can be done with your help!  Once we can get the company going, all monies taken in will be recycled into funding more art projects.  This is intended as a not for profit endeavor.  Instead of a company getting rich off the works of artists, collecting all the money and giving a criminally small percentage in return, we will be doing just the opposite.  We will be providing for artists while facilitating the creation and distribution of their art.  Our company is and will be an ever-growing cooperative network of artists.  The artists maintain rights and collect the appropriate benefits from their works.  The percentage they elect to give or donate back to the company will be entirely up to them and will then help provide the opportunity for the next art/artist...and so on.  There is always more art to create and bring out into the world to share together.  If we choose to allow for any additional use of funds we have certainly considered what we might be able to do if they were dedicated toward programs fostering the arts in communities worldwide and/or toward other charities, causes, organizations, etc. working to make the world a better place.  Presently we are focused upon the creation part and yet aspire toward the fullest of possibilities in this company's potential.  "The goal is in spreading this creative vision and passion across the globe for participating in the shaping of our world, in the evolution of human consciousness and in how we are creating our shared reality through cooperation, learning, growing and nurturing greater awareness, and all done in the spirit of this embracing engagement together with the way of the Mystic Artist alive in all of us."  Kincaid's inspired journey has been that of what one might call a modern mystic; deeply spiritual, of passionate dreams, traversing the outskirts of consciousness and possibility, yet complete with false starts, falls from grace, dark nights of soul and rises from the ashes in truly dazzling fashion.  Today, as he approaches the ever iconic 33rd year of life, he has come to what may finally be the moment of his emergence as an Artist and Visionary.  Daniel is a true force, a powerful spirit and a being of great heart...and his music embodies this as undeniably as he does.  
 
The Mystic Artist - Phase 1 
By Daniel Kincaid

                                                     Production Costs 
"Creating a cd is an expensive endeavor...let alone creating two!  The good news is that this is what we have to move forward with at the onset here - two full-length albums along with a fairly extensive back catalogue of music that I am bringing with me.  The pictures you see above are examples of this type of collaborative artistic work within the greater vision.  The paintings were inspired by the music, and the artistic relationship that formed between myself and the painter is one to carry into future productions.  Though the ultimate goal remains always in the multi-genre cross-collaborative artist production company, I am first a poet, songwriter, composer and musician.  So, you may not be surprised to find that this platform begins with a musical production.  As this company and its vision does originate with me, these outward movements with my artwork initially does simultaneously, and quite conveniently I'll admit, provide greater potential for the success of the business as a whole.  Moving forward, the greater the ability to gain a presence with my own work will only serve to help generate funding and opportunity for Mystic Productions.  As for this flagship/prototype process, so far I have been able to cover the initial expenses in tracking, mixing and mastering the audio, which is in fact the brunt of it.  However, now with the music ready to make its way out into the world, we (my small team of amazing people and I) are finding ourselves tapped out, completely spread thin...essentially...broke.  In order to help finance what we are doing presently which includes but is not limited to; the registering of domain names, hosting, licensing, disc manufacturing, materials, distribution, promotion, publishing, registration for royalties, etc. -  I/we need your help!!!  We need help with the duplication/replication expenses and the cost of materials for the first runs.  In the future we can eventually acquire our own printing press, but that is likely some time away yet.  We also need help in order to finance the online and physical distribution.  A BIG element is that we need to provide for promotion, marketing, and the costs for an outward presence, not only in the physical world, but also, perhaps primarily at the moment, the web presence.  It would also be great to be able to print up posters, t-shirts and other such elements/merchandise to accompany these musical/artistic works and their progress outward."
 

(Editors Note: If you go to the website found at the top of the page you will see that some of this is up and running, albeit in its infancy.  This is not quite the professional level web presence we aspire towards, but that is why we are here!  The Mystic Productions website is another matter for it is not up at the moment - we are working on it along with filing the appropriate forms to re-activate the business - which is also quite costly.  This campaign is in part to help us cover the expenses we are incurring in this phase of the process and to finance the elements discussed in the next sections that we cannot cover.  It is important to understand first that this is a great challenge to have, and we recognize that.  We need to raise money so that we can finance the creation and circulation of shared experiences in beautiful music and art throughout the world.  This endeavor is truly our very heart and soul.  We cherish this great opportunity to do this work, to grow and to take our vision to the next level.  We are and will be working hard to continually develop and maintain the web presence.  We see web domains as living relationships where we can have ever-evolving galleries - venues in the virtual world to share and engage with works of art.  In the physical world the next steps bring us into the realm of staging live events...but first we need some proper equipment.)


                                                 Live Productions
"I have the great fortune of having absolutely the most fantastic team of people surrounding this movement forward.  As part of the process into the next phase of things, I am relocating to California where I'll be joining some of this team out there, with others on the way.  Though we have these initial expenses for our physical locations and relocations covered as well...of course anything extra only helps us starving artists!  The basic plan with the remaining funds after the promotion, production and distribution costs is to channel funding directly into the next most pressing issues for our foundation: Staging and promoting live events and acquiring gear - Pedal Boards, Amplification, Mics, PA Speakers, Power Amps, and other such event production equipment.  This is not only connected with the promotion, marketing and distribution, it is vital within the holistic effort to establish everything we need in order to succeed in building an initial foundation to bring to life the music, to facilitate its outward momentum, and provide a vehicle for sharing it with the world/together "live".  First of all, this is something I am immensely passionate about and find deeply meaningful for the value of just that - sharing in music together.  This participation and what it means collectively for our human heart and spirit cannot be minimized, in fact I believe it primal, fundamental, vital, elemental, essential, tribal, biological, bio-spiritual, and absolutely woven into the fabric of our existence.  This most ancient and magical reality of sound, spirit and connection is always most intimately connected to the heart and soul of this endeavor and of me...and this reality remains always at the forefront among my highest motivations."
  

                                                  Studio Equipment
"Microphones, Outboard Gear, Effects and other such recording studio elements, as well as cameras, canvases, paint, supplies, lighting, etc.(you get the idea); all will help us build toward the ultimate goal of facilitating the birth of many works of art into our world.  This initial campaign will of course not be able to fund all of this.  While we are in "beta" mode with this first project, we are learning and will be coming forth next time around with a complete tested model and comprehensive business plan layout for the vision.  In the meantime, we would like to grow as much as possible.  For the moment it would be great to start by acquiring a couple more pieces for the next productions which will include music and sound but will also encompass other mediums such as video/film, dance, creative writing, visual arts...and so on.  My complete vision is of course more than a single music studio, but rather housing studio space for numerous mediums of art, with artists producing and collaborating among and across the multiple genres.  We commonly use the word entertainment for the industry where work of this nature takes place, but within that it is really the art that calls to us.  Beginning with the initial process here of laying the groundwork for future productions, we are setting course with an emphasis on taking the steps toward first providing the ability to generate fully professional quality audio, then in Phase 2 we will be building and expanding from there, and ultimately, in Phase 3 we will reach the level of multi-genre/medium/media production company. This is Phase 1."
 

                                              Regarding Artistic Vision




  "The Impact of art generally upon the world and within/among humanity is difficult to quantify.  The Mystic Artist engages this process of bringing forth works that move through the spirit in great heart and inspiration as participating in the evolution of human consciousness.  Therefore, in this work, the artist or creative visionary plays a part in shaping the world and in shaping our shared reality now and to come.  Here the artist can "create" toward the highest good for the future of our human family.  I am deeply grateful for the opportunity to participate and wish only to do so to my fullest in the time that I have here and now.   The chance to create, and in doing so, to reach whatever my potential may be in playing my part toward the highest good for all is the heart of the matter.  There is no hidden agenda for personal gain, rather where I and this music go out into the world and into our collective experience will be decided by you and us together.  Likewise, what we are able to do with this business, in fostering and generating artist's works for our shared world, will be determined "together" - A shared effort in this sacred work.

 

Team Closing: This campaign is called Phase 1 because it is the first of three where we are working to bring inspiring visions and life enriching works to the world through this grassroots effort. We cherish any support and promise to honor the vision and the purpose that has been shared here each and every step of the way.  This endeavor is truly a matter of the heart and to lead with/from the heart is truly a matter of great courage and faith.  It is our hope that you will now unite yours with ours in bringing to life such creations to be shared together now, and furthermore, as a form of contribution in our time here toward our global human family and the future of our beloved world yet to come.
campaign_city: Sewickley, Pa...soon to be LA, United States

story:
FUEL OUR JOURNEY

HELLO LOVELIES! We are The Bellows, an Indie Rock/R&B group from Minneapolis, MN. We are gearing up to record our first EP and are SO EXCITED.  The Bellows was founded by Kent Goodroad (piano) and Lou Schwitzer (vocals) a little over a year ago. We have been writing since day one and look forward to sharing a collection of songs with you through this EP.

Please partner with us as we work to achieve our funding goal of $9,000. Proceeds will go to pay for:

  • studio time at Hideaway Studios in NE MPLS
  • recording engineer, Joe Mabbott
  • recording, mixing, and mastering
  • compensation for our insanely talented musicians
  • EP artwork, packaging, and printing

It is imperative that we reach our $9,000 goal in order to make this dream a reality! If we do not reach our entire funding goal, we will have to greatly tailor our time spent in the studio as well as printing.

Why Contribute?

  • You can fuel our journey
  • Help us realize our dream
  • Because you like us.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you may not be able to contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help immensly!  

  • We need you to get the word out and make some noise about The Bellows campaign.  Tell your co-workers, friends, parents, siblings and lovers about who we are and how they can help fund our dream.
  • Feel free to share our indiegogo link by using the Indiegogo share tools!   

We love you and are so grateful for such a supportive community.

xo, The Bellows

story:
Who We Are

We are Jordan Pinkston and Shannon Powers from Mobile, Alabama. We are a Graduate (Jordan) and student ( Shannon) of the University of Mobile and worship leaders at Bay Community Church. We've been writing songs together for about a year and now we are excited to be recording our first full-length album as Jordan & Shannon!

Beginning in December 2013 we will start the recording process and we are so excited! But we can't make it happen without some financial help from all of you. Even the smallest amount will go far in helping us make our vision for this album a reality!

What We Need & What You Get

The minimum we need to fund this project is $4,000. That covers the cost of studio time, production, mixing, and studio musicians. But our goal is to even exceed that in order to cover the cost of CD duplication, digital distribution ( iTunes, Spotify, etc.), and tshirts! We can use any amount you can give!

For your contribution we have some pretty neat perks all the way from a digital download of our new album and a one of a kind tshirt to a full concert at the location of your choice! (Check out all of our giving incentives below.)

Even if we don't reach our goal, every penny we earn will go towards the recording cost of this album. No amount is too small!

The Impact

This full length album will contain 7 original songs by us that we think (and hope) you're going to love. We believe in the value of making great music that people actually want to listen to and that's just what we hope to do with these songs. We are building a project from the ground up that we can't wait for you to hear and be a special part of, whether that's by giving financially or just spreading the word so others can help.

Other Ways You Can Help

We're college-age adults and we get it: not everyone can afford to give. That doesn't mean you can't still help!

Help us get the word out about our campaign by sharing our Indie Gogo page on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram and don't forget to use Indiegogo's great share tools!

Click HERE to like us on Facebook!

Thanks so much for all your support!

story:
We are EGG3. 

This is about our present. Our future. And you. 

As individuals: (Vidar K. Schanche, Stale Birkeland, Inge W. Breistein) we’ve thrashed with all manner of formidable musicians in countless foreign lands. Our rebel-rousing solo pursuits have made us slick, mean, hungry and tough. Just look into our eyes…

As EGG3, we are one. Our musical universe melds the transcribed with the improvised, a tender touch with a hammer smash and the most beautiful nightmare we can daydream. Our jazz upbringing is transforming into a new, more aggressive sound, and in Spring 2014, EGG3 are slashing our way through Norway, Poland, Germany, Czech Republic and France. 

Our new album has been captured and we need you to set it loose. Printing, pressing, design and distribution are in our path, but you can help us smash through and share EGG3 with the world.

Give what you can and we will give all we have. EGG3 looks forward to entering your Universe.

story:
We are Two Peace.

A 2 man band out of Davenport, Iowa with a passion for life and music. We are in need of a van. We've been playing shows in the mid west since late 2011 and have built a solid following locally. At this time we feel it will be most beneficial to make a move and are planning a trip to California this May to further musical career.

We would like to give you the opportunity to assist us on our journey to purchase a reliable vehicle (specifically a van) to get us where we need to go.

Any money raised past our goal will go to merchandise, making/ producing our new cd, equipment (such as monitors) and our trip/tour costs in general.

 I can't emphasize enough how much this means to us, we are forever grateful for every little bit of help received along the way. Thank you!

Check out more about Two Peace music here:

www.reverbnation.com/twopeace

www.facebook.com/twopeacemusic

How We Roll

Nick Harksen - vocalist and keyboard player


We love to have fun and we love to share our music with the world. Part of that is playing music on the road and getting away from home. Reaching out to people is something we care deeply about and playing live music is the most effective way we can convey our message to any listener. This is why getting  a van is so important to us. We want the chance to meet new people, see new places and to share what we create with the world. Together we believe we can make a difference, no matter how big or small. If we can make someone's day, great, that is the best feeling for us.

 Jacob Hahn - Bassist

 

What You Get

For your incentive and to show our appreciation we've come up with some perks for you to claim if you choose to join our musical cause.

You have the chance to assist us in following our dreams and to receive any of the following -

 

  • Good vibes
  • Two Peace Mix Tape
  • Reserve a copy of our new cd
  • Two Peace T shirt

  • A postcard from us while we're on the road
  • Handwritten song lyrics to a song of your choice
  • Hangout/party with us and get to know us better
  • Get put on Two Peace's +1 list for life
  • Your own original Two Peace song
  • Two Peace will come play a show for you at your house!

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not able to contribute financially to our campaign we would greatly appreciate your help in spreading the word about what we are working towards.

Please take a moment to share our campaign on Twitter, facebook and any other social media platforms.

Thanks everyone!

email us at: twopeacemusic@gmail.com

story:
The Break Down

Sun-Dried Vibes is a reggae/rock trio from Rock Hill, SC that has been passionate about playing positive and conscious music while establishing a family of East Coast reggae/rock bands with similar goals since they formed 3 years ago. After releasing their debut album, "Give Thanks" in 2011, the group has been touring heavily across the East Coast, averaging 300 shows a year. The group has recently completed the recording, mixing, mastering and production of their sophomore album, "Back2Square1," and are now in need of your help to continue on their journey!!

SDV experienced such a wave of amazing reception from fans that we wanted to give you THE BEST ALBUM that we could physically make. The only problem is, it's a little expensive.... We have never slowed our touring or had any other job aside from playing music as a group in several years. We expanded our budget to great lengths on this up-coming album, and even with fundraising campaigns, we still spent thousands of dollars of our own personal money. We have driven our touring van to almost 300,000 miles in our time as a band. Our equipment has been brutally used and is in need of much love and repair!! 

So we are humbly asking for your help in getting were we need to be, back on the road traveling to get back to all the towns & cities where we are loved, wanted and needed with functioning equipment and tour van! Any help is much appreciated whatever the amount. So thanks for helping out SDV and hope to see you soon in city near your promoting our new album "Back2Square1."
.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are asking for $6,000 - Half for a van, Half for equipment!
  • Check out the list of perks! We are giving away everything that is SUN-DRIED!!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help financially, TRUST US... We know what it's like to be broke!! Here's a few other thoughts on how you can help us continue spreading the positive vibe:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!!! Use the Indiegogo Share Tools to share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter and more!!
  • Spread the word about our music! Our new album "Back2Square1" will be dropping on April 12th, 2014 and we will need this to get on the road and promote it's release!!!

story:
Greetings all.
My name is Collin Kidd, and I am a drum major for the Santa Clara Vanguard. The summer of 2014 will be my fourth with the Vanguard, and I am truly ecstatic for this upcoming season. However in order to march this summer, I need your help.

I am currently a seminarian for the Catholic Diocese of Fort Worth and as part of my training I am not allowed to seek employment. Without a job, raising $2,250 for my summer fees is challenging.

By donating to my campaign you can help me as a drum major to lead the Santa Clara Vanguard on an exhilarating tour across the United States rehearsing our program, competing against other world class drum and bugle corps, and learn about ourselves as people through life lessons of dedication, perseverance, team work, patience, and passion. My fellow drum major and I will be models of class, dignity, integrity, and excellence both on the field and off in our communities.

Thank you for your consideration!

Collin Kidd
2014 Santa Clara Vanguard Member

The summer of 2014 will be my fourth with the Vanguard, and I am truly ecstatic for this upcoming season. However in order to march this summer, I need your help. I am currently a seminarian for the Catholic Diocese of Fort Worth and as part of my training I am not allowed to seek employment. Without a job, raising $2,250 for my summer fees is challenging. By donating to my campaign you can help me as a drum major to lead the Santa Clara Vanguard on an exhilarating tour across the United States rehearsing our program, competing against other world class drum and bugle corps, and learn about ourselves as people through life lessons of dedication, perseverance, team work, patience, and passion. My fellow drum major and I will be models of class, dignity, integrity, and excellence both on the field and off in our communities. Thank you for your consideration!Collin Kidd2014 Santa Clara Vanguard Member

story:
We are The Hits an original all female rock band located in Denver, CO. We met through the workings of Craigslist just about a year ago and upon the intial meet we knew we would make history with our originality, our music and our fun loving way of life.

We are raising funds so we can take our careers to the next level, push our musical talents and creativity even further than we ever thought!! We have been saving every penny we receive from shows and have entered many contests to help us reach our goal, we are almost there and are in the home stretch!

With your financial support we will be able to achieve our goal and continue to push forward through the music industry. Our creative and accomplished production team lead by Director Edward Townsend of Laserhead Picutres and Producer Jimmy Drain from Ghostblade Productions, bring a creative edge to our playful, expressive vision and share the same passion for nothing less than excellence and professionalism. This project will be enjoyable for many and speak in a universal way that everyone can relate to!!

story:
Short Summary

This is a project to help support a dear friend in realizing a lifetime dream of seeing Rod Stewart.  Tickets have been purchased for her to see him in the United Kingdo this June, now we need to get her flown over and have a bit of pocket change. 

For those of you that know Heather Anne, you know that she would rather spend her days laughing and making other people laugh.  She never asks for anything in return, other than your smile.  Many people like this get over looked in the day to day, because they always choose to see the bright side of life and share it with others.  To everyone around them they always seem to have it together and not want for anything, well thaat my friends is called humility.

It is now time to recognize and thank this single mother of a wonderful, also very funny, young man.  She has been a dedicated worker her entire life and has and undying love for her child.  Being a single mother can be tough, but she wakes up every morning and does the best that she can to be the best she can.

Since I have known this lady, she has had an unusually strong love for Rod Stewart.  Asd I woke up this morning I saw that it was her birthday and knew that he was going to be in concert in the U.K during May.  The little voices in my head told me to buy her a ticket to go.  I did.  Help me celebrate the appreciation for a spirit that gives light and humor everyday of her life and lets get her air fair and pocket money paid for.  A trip like this and an opportunity to see her "love" is a once in a lifetime chance and a way we all, as friends and recognizers of all the good things she does, can say "Hey, Heather Ann, thank you for being you and go take a much needed vacation and realize a dream!"

story:
Kem Secksdiin - All This Pain

Kem Secksdiin was a member of the live Celldweller crew in 2005-2006 and has also toured as a member of Crossbreed. Additionally, Kem released a single as Subculture on FiXT in 2007, with a FiXT Remix compilation following in 2008.

Kem utilizes an insightful interpretation of underground club music with his metal upbringing to showcase the raw essence and power.

Now after long silence Kem become member of Venator Music and ready to bring his brand new single to the world!

As many of you knows the last full-length album by Kem was pretty awesome but sounds it really bad. So ALL collected money will be spent not only for recording in fully equiped studio with professional sound engineer Matt  Dalton (who also worked with such band as (HED)pe ), but also for mixing and mastering it with all world standarts of quality. Also we planning a huge PR compain with FiXT Publicity and a bunch of merchandise (and of course all contributors get all this stuff for free).

Now we want to let each fan of Kem to support him and Venator Music in this campaign.


P.S.

  • Every person will be updated about recording process
  • The best contributors get special prizes from Kem and Venator Music

story:
Hello, my name is Paul Hutchinson. I'm an Instrumental Keyboardist who writes and performs all of my own original music with a few cover songs thrown in for good measure. About two or three years ago, my friend Alex Castro and I purchased some lighting effects, small lasers and a basic 300 watt sound system. We began performing in small, private shows with my music synced up with the lasers and lights. Our audiences and crowd reviews have been amazingly positive. It's often suggest by our fans how huge our show could be with a better sound system and professional lasers. We are at the point where we need to upgrade some of our gear to take our show to the next level. My goal is to upgrade our sound system and add two professional laser projectors. I'm launching this campaign to be able to purchase a professional set of line array speaker systems from "Seismic Audio" and two "Avant" laser projector systems from "Pangolin" with all the hardware and gear to run it. We want our audiences to have a sensory overload experience through a powerful sound and laser light show. We want them to remember the total satisfaction they felt while being visually fascinated and bouncing to the beat of my music. Now with Indiegogo and the power of social media, We have the ability to see our vision become reality. Check out our project budget below and have a look at the cool stuff we're giving to our sponsors. THANK YOU for taking the time to check out our campaign.

Project Goal Budget= $14,000 USD

2- "Pangolin" CLUBMAX 3000 by"Avant" laser projectors with "Quick Show" program disc. 2 x $3,510.00 = $7,020.00 USD

2- "Seismic Audio" Line Array speaker systems. 2 x $1,999.99 = $3,999.98 USD

1- "Seismic Audio" Magnitude 2400 Power Amplifier. = $499.99 USD

1- "Seismic Audio" Magnitude 3600 Power Amplifier = $649.99 USD

1- Six space rack case. $139.99 USD

Total = $12,309.95 USD

Balance left over = $1,690.05 USD - Remaining balance will be utilized for  additional hardware, cords and cables to run new gear.  Indiegogo fees. Any other unforeseen expenses we may encounter to get our project up and running.

story:
JC Gonzalez

Singer, Rapper, Actor, & Humanitarian

When I was born in Bogotá Colombia

I grew up as a kid loving Cumbia, Reggaeton, & Salsa

When I immigrated to the United States

I instantly fell in love with American Hip-Hop, R&B, Rock, and Pop music 

 2MooNS EP

  is an English & Spanish FUSION of Hip-Hop, R&B, Latin rock pop, Reggaeton, & Salsa Infused into one rocket ship Album EP ready to blast off into the airwaves!

     My musical style & Lyrics are for EVERYONE.

Michael J Gonzalez

Film Composer, Pianist, Producer & Actor

Side-by-side with the musical Master Michael J. Gonzales, we have finished recording my EP 2moonS! It took over a year, tons of sweat, tears, blood and a whole lot of musical inspiration for Michael and I to create something we are truly proud to LAUNCH into the hearts and minds of the world.

  • OUR Dream is to get the attention of some of the Music Industry's most talented producers, Artist, and music managers, in the hopes to help our music and Message PLAY worldwide!
  • Where are we NOW? The music is produced, the vocals recorded, and we have gotten the attention of a few of the industry's most powerful music engineers working with artists like J Lo, Lil Wayne, Ricky Martin & Marc Anthony (just to name a few)
  •   WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP. These top Notch professionals can take our finished EP to:

  a WHOLE NEW LEVEL

                                   WHOLE NEW SOUND

                                                  BUT... a WHOLE NEW PRICE TAG $$$!

 
  • Problem is:  I sleep in my car , and NO... I do not wake up in a new Bugatti. I have given up virtually every modern comfort imaginable to have money and time available to produce this dream of mine. We do not have $5000 to give a top notch musical engineer. Right now my backseat is my living room, and I shower at the local GYM.  #theStruggleIsREAL

What PERKS can you get in return?

I am committed to spreading my music and message to my fans and to the world! Apart from downloading my music you can earn prizes like:

    • 2moonS EP ALbum  Download to your Music Library!

    • JC music Logo T-shirt 

    • JC Logo Ball CAP

    • Deluxe album with singles Equation of Love, Quiet Game, & Fly 
    • Personal thank you to your Facebook, twitter, vine, or any social media of your choosing!

    • Autographed 2MooNS poster!

    • Instant access to me & my music via Skype!

    • Cover Video of your Choice! Yeah...  i said it

    • Live Show for you and Your Friends!

What your Help will go Towards?

All the money will go to producing the best album possible!

  1. Mixing by an engineer you hear everytime you Turn on the Radio!
  2. Mastering the final album buy one of the industries greatest!
  3.  Equipment to play live What good is having an album if I can't Play live? 
  4. Awesome music video, what good is an album without one kick ass music video? 10 million views? I believe we can!
  5.  Licensing Costs of releasing and licensing through ASCAP, iTunes, Spotify Pandora!
  6.  If we surpass our goal: the money will go towards music video extras like dancers, CGI, locations, and props! The more the merrier!

As of Now...

We don't have a Pepsi endorsement deal.

        We don't have a tequila bottle with my name on it.

              We don't have supermodels waiting for me at my mansion.


But We DO HAVE YOU!

My Fans, Family, and Supporters, and really...that's all we NEED to LAUNCH MY MUSIC into the Air WAVES!

story:
Who is Trapped On Earth? 

      This group of eclectic 20 somethings began their journey together at Belmont University in the Spring of 2015. Even though they are new as unit, they are certainly not new to the stage or the music industry. All of the members have been performing live for most of their lives and it was only a matter of time before these aspiring musicians crossed paths. What better place than Music City, USA?
    Before they got together though, the kids had played with many different bands. Many of the members struggled for a long time to find people they could click with --  at the end of the day, that is more important than anything else in an artist's eyes. You can have a fantastic group of musicians that are technically skilled and know every note in the book, but if a group doesn't vibe well or have a good amount of chemistry, then what's the point? Sure, you can make money, but when it comes to the creative mindset you need people you can relate to. You need people who can ride on your wavelength and also have fun with. And that's what happened when Trapped On Earth came together. 
They found that undeniable chemistry and energy that only great music groups have. Bands like Chicago, Electric Light Orchestra, Blood Sweat & Tears, and so on. When people come to a Trapped On Earth show, it's more than just a bunch of kids playing MoTown -- it's an experience. The presence they omit to their audience is chart topping and people leave feeling all of the emotions the band projected on them with their music. Trapped On Earth wants to leave their mark on society. They want to put an older sound into a millennial spotlight. They want to put the fun back into funk and the move back into groove. 

Here is the Deal

The Goal is $5,500. This will help the band record their debut album. It will go toward everything; renting the studio, tracking the songs, mixing, mastering, and even manufacturing physical copies of the album! It will also go towards making all of the fun prizes and perks that the band has in store for all of the fantastic fans. Everyone who donates will receive a quirky gifts and a hard copy of the album in some form or another. (Wristbands, Buttons, Stickers, Photos, CDs, Vinyls, etc.) Some of you may even get a meet and greet with the band! 

The Mission 

By helping these kids, you will be helping launch their careers. This debut album is the start to building a platform for the band and what they are about. By supporting them, you are helping build their fan base. Not only is their goal to make music their full time job, but they want to create something memorable. They want to give something to everyone; they want the dancers to jive, the poets to ponder, and the musicians to appreciate. They want to bring old sounds into their new music and ideas to create a completely new wave of music. They want to bring horn driven music back into the forefront and into the view of the general public again. By donating, you will join the journey and help Trapped On Earth into their ascending orbit. 

The Struggle Is Real 

We all know that college is not cheap. These young students thank their parents over and over again that they even considered letting them pursue their crazy dreams of going to such a highly acclaimed music school. Belmont is one of the top private schools for music and music business and the bill is right at the top there with the ranking. So many of the kids have student loans, and jobs while going to school full time just to keep the interest down. Not to mention that they have other daily expenses like rent, gas, utilities, etc. So its hard to figure in anything else-especially a project like this. With your help though, these kids will have the kickstart they need to pursue their dreams. 

Now it might be a little difficult along the way. If the project gets funded, there is a whole new set of obstacles - teamwork will need to be a HUGE part of the project. Even though the group is on the same wavelength most of the time, it's hard getting eight people together and to agree on the same ideas. There will be creative disagreements about certain aspects of the album and there will be times when they will have to work out their differences, but in the end they will always solve their conflicts because they want Trapped on Earth to work. Every member has the same end goal and they will settle any dispute for the music and for the friendship they've gained with the ensemble. 

Too Broke To Donate? 

If you don't have any spare cash to give away, that's okay! You can help by just spreading the word around about the group and all the goals they hope to achieve with their project! You'd be surprised by how much impact one share or one pass along can do. So tell your friends and family! Tell people you like or people you don't like! It doesn't matter as long as you tell everyone about it! Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

The Perennial Millennial is, in essence, an experimental folk and concept album about the plight of the Millennial generation. An oft derided age group, dog piled upon, thanks to the age of technology where every baby boomer with a keyboard can write a scathing attack about how Millennials killed the auto industry, McDonalds, their dog, etc. etc. We also come from an age where we remember when phones were connected to the wall, and we had to wait for our favorite show to come on. Nurtured in an older time, but growing up in a rapidly advancing world; the old versus the new. 

I've had the idea for a while of writing something like this, and in an extremely prolific couple of months for me, I churned out some of my most personal, political, and dense tracks. These tracks all connect and run through the theme of feeling disenfranchised and lost in a culture that does not reflect how the younger generation feels. 

The songs cover many topics

  • Social justice and reform
  • Old media versus new media
  • Feelings of inadequacy in different contexts
  • Love and heartbreak
  • Being a millennial

The album takes place on a city sidewalk, and documents a young man coming into his own. I hope when you listen to the final product, you enjoy it, despair with it,  and find yourself reflected in the music. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

All funds for this campaign go to production, mixing, and mastering as well as promotional material; for this we need roughly $3000. 
If you decide to support this endeavor beyond the lowest donation tier, you have the option to receive... 

  • Exclusive one-of-a-kind acoustic vinyl
  • Personalized Poem
  • Personalized art copy of "the New Times"
  • Link to a demos and B-side album on Bandcamp
  • Personalized Birthday songs
  • A DARE!!!! 

Risks & Challenges

The number one worry for this campaign you should be aware of, is that recording might become more taxing than imagined. While I'm very prepared to go in with everything from instrumental choice, BPM, and effects I want, in all likelihood, certain songs might take more time. Some songs might not sound right and need whole days to complete. While every dollar will go to the creation of this album. It's also possible that the set budget might not be enough. 

However I can assure that myself and my collaborators are prepared and ready to churn out a good and non-rushed project for you. 

Other Ways You Can Help

While anything from 5 bucks to a million dollars will help, I understand if you cannot help. 
If that is the case, you can help in other ways! 

  • Sharing with your friends the project, the previous EP, the teaser tracks. Any help in sharing this campaign is a good step! 
  • Come out to one of the many shows I will do in promotion for the album. Whether its a tour or you too are based in New York City. Coming to a show is an amazing help to independent music. 
  • If you are an artist yourself, come out to a music video shoot, or give me a message to collaborate! Any and all creatives are welcome to the process.
story_txt:
Short Summary
The Perennial Millennial is, in essence, an experimental folk and concept album about the plight of the Millennial generation. An oft derided age group, dog piled upon, thanks to the age of technology where every baby boomer with a keyboard can write a scathing attack about how Millennials killed the auto industry, McDonalds, their dog, etc. etc. We also come from an age where we remember when phones were connected to the wall, and we had to wait for our favorite show to come on. Nurtured in an older time, but growing up in a rapidly advancing world; the old versus the new. 
I've had the idea for a while of writing something like this, and in an extremely prolific couple of months for me, I churned out some of my most personal, political, and dense tracks. These tracks all connect and run through the theme of feeling disenfranchised and lost in a culture that does not reflect how the younger generation feels. 
The songs cover many topics

Social justice and reform
Old media versus new media
Feelings of inadequacy in different contexts
Love and heartbreak
Being a millennial

The album takes place on a city sidewalk, and documents a young man coming into his own. I hope when you listen to the final product, you enjoy it, despair with it,  and find yourself reflected in the music. 
 

What We Need & What You Get
All funds for this campaign go to production, mixing, and mastering as well as promotional material; for this we need roughly $3000. If you decide to support this endeavor beyond the lowest donation tier, you have the option to receive... 

Exclusive one-of-a-kind acoustic vinyl
Personalized Poem
Personalized art copy of "the New Times"
Link to a demos and B-side album on Bandcamp
Personalized Birthday songs
A DARE!!!! 


Risks & Challenges
The number one worry for this campaign you should be aware of, is that recording might become more taxing than imagined. While I'm very prepared to go in with everything from instrumental choice, BPM, and effects I want, in all likelihood, certain songs might take more time. Some songs might not sound right and need whole days to complete. While every dollar will go to the creation of this album. It's also possible that the set budget might not be enough. 
However I can assure that myself and my collaborators are prepared and ready to churn out a good and non-rushed project for you. 

Other Ways You Can Help
While anything from 5 bucks to a million dollars will help, I understand if you cannot help. If that is the case, you can help in other ways! 

Sharing with your friends the project, the previous EP, the teaser tracks. Any help in sharing this campaign is a good step! 
Come out to one of the many shows I will do in promotion for the album. Whether its a tour or you too are based in New York City. Coming to a show is an amazing help to independent music. 
If you are an artist yourself, come out to a music video shoot, or give me a message to collaborate! Any and all creatives are welcome to the process.

story:
Our Story


Having just announced several official SXSW showcases and an American mini-tour, The Brute Chorus are ready to take to the stage for their first American shows. The band cut their teeth with a residency at Camden's infamous Hawley Arms, a watering hole popular at the time with the likes of Amy Winehouse and Kate Moss. Championed at a very early stage by The BBC and NME Magazine The Brute Chorus' wild blend of garage rock, blues, and folk music with lyrics populated with characters from Greek mythology and Grimm's fairytales, quickly broke the indie guitar band mould. Their accessible sound has so far managed to escape any generalized genre pigeon-holing as they have gone on to carve out their own genuine, word-of-mouth buzz from their frenzied live shows.


And what shows! The band have taken it to the people gig by gig across Britain and Europe and have surely proved they can keep up with the big boys through their many support shows for acts as diverse as  ART BRUT, IDA MARIA, THE WOODENTOPS, MARTHA WAINWRIGHT, and THE RUMBLESTRIPS. Their live rep has seen them stand out among the crowd at almost every British music festival of the last three years and they even recorded their debut album LIVE, in one take at London's prestigious Roundhouse venue.


At the end of 2010 the band had released their sophomore album, How the Caged Bird Sings, to further critical acclaim from the likes of NME, Drowned in Sound, Clash Magazine, Artrocker, The Fly, Zane Lowe, Marc Riley and Steve Lamacq among others. The band's popularity on radio was boosted when they became Artists in Residence on John Kennedy's XFM show for a whole week at the start of 2011 where the famed DJ played live session tracks alongside album cuts, highlighting the standard of the band's live performance and raw rock n' roll spirit. They've also performed live sessions for Radio1 and Radio 6 whilst on TV Channel 4 screened a mini-doc on the band featuring clips of them playing live in Glasgow. Videos for the likes of 'Birdman' (Single of the Week on Kerrang! Radio and Q Radio) received heavy rotations on blogs around the globe as well as being aired on MTV Iggy here in the US. Everyone certainly wants a piece of THE BRUTE CHORUS, and now it's time to get yours.


The Impact

The chance to play SXSW (South by South West) and America is an amazing opportunity for any band and we're totally blown away to have been invited to play at this year's festival!


We've always felt an affinity with american music and this trip to Austin, Texas gives us our first chance to play in the US and we'd love to make the most of it - by covering as much of the US as we can before our visa's expire!


Although getting the four of us there will not be a cheap enterprise, we've already committed to making it happen and begged, borrowed and bankrupted ourselves!


This is where you can help with any donations to help us show the world...what we can do!


What We Need & What You Get

$485 for petrol to get from New York City to Austin, Texas and back

$2,400 for return flights to New York City from London

$615 for Visa Interviews at the American Embassy in London

$2,550 for Visa petition to USCIS

$350 for getting our guitars and instruments through customs!!

$1000 for van hire for March 5th to March 24th

$600 for guitar and bass amp hire and drum hire


For a grand total of $8000


We are selling everything we own (aside from our guitars!) to make this happen. We spent every penny we have on the flights already, so need your help to get across the country!! Help us - we don't want to cross the Atlantic just to spend three weeks in La Guardia airport busking to commuters! So close and yet so far...


Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us spread the word by sharing this link with other friends and potential fans - and don't forget to "like" it on Facebook! Also visit our Facebook for details and updates on what's going on with the band and give us your email details so we can stay in touch - http://www.facebook.com/The-Brute-Chorus

story:
Short Summary

We are thrilled to be back in the studio and working to bring a new CD out to the world. We came into music, writing and performing, late in life and if you told us back in 2010 that in 8 years we would have enough original songs for 5 CDs, we would have told you that you were nuts :)  We love performing and connecting with people through our musical stories. With a song you only have 3-4 minutes to pull people into your story and have them feel strongly enough about it to want to take it home with them. We believe that we do that with our songs, which is the main reason we want to keep recording. Through this campaign, we are asking you to help us to bring this project to completion by pre-ordering your CD.

What We Need & What You Get

We are trying to raise $5000. This is a portion of what it will take to complete this CD. We are doing as many of the tasks associated with creating a CD as we possibly can; we have created our own home studio, so we are able to record and mix ourselves. Also we will do all of the graphic design for our CD packaging, except for the cover art. This will save us a ton of money without sacrificing quality. Here is the breakdown of where your contributions will go:

  • CD Mastering - $1000
  • CD Duplication and distribution - $2300
  • DJ promotion - $2000
  • New promo pictures - $300
  • CD cover art - $350
  • Additional PR - $1000-$2000

Our stretch goal is an additional $1000 to create a music video. We have plenty of live concert videos so that we can showcase some of our songs but we would like to get a concept, multi camera video.

Now for what you can get as a perk - of course, the new CD itself, but we also have a bunch of other incentives for you:

    T-shirts, hand written lyrics, a song written just for you, lunch on us, house concerts, workshops, record your own 3 song demo, to name a few.

The Impact

Music brings people together and we need this now more than ever. We put our heart and soul into every song and every performance. Our songs are lyric driven and range from stories based on historical events, to every day life events, to call to action songs. Our hope is that when you listen to our music that you are not only entertained, but that the music touches your soul. Through music we are all connected and we thrive on this feeling of community.

We were very happy with the success of our last CD, This Old Town. With the DJ promotion, we were #11 on the Folk DJ charts. We are hoping that this new CD can break the top 10!

We have been hesitant in the past about asking our family, friends, neighbors, and fans to help us fund our projects, but we do need your help this time. We do not take this lightly and are working very hard to create a project that you will be proud to say that you were a part of.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We have perks at many price points, but we realize that you may not be financially able to support us. If that is the case, there are other ways that you can help. Please share this campaign with your friends, family, neighbors, etc. Put it on Facebook, Tweet about it, talk it up everywhere that you can. Word of mouth is huge so letting people know about this project will help us immensely. If you haven't already done so, please follow us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and subscribe to us on Youtube.  Interacting with us on these social media platforms by liking, commenting and sharing posts also help bring awareness to our music.

story:
The Story

   I'm a film and television music composer and a Berklee College of Music graduate currently living in Hollywood, California. I've written music for over two dozen network television shows but currently working towards my goal of composing music for major feature films and trailers, primetime TV and HBO/Showtime series like Spartacus, Game of Thrones, and similar shows. Essentially I want to be the next Hans Zimmer, James Horner, and John Williams. To learn more about me you can visit my website at www.mattbaamonde.com or check out my IMDb at http://www.imdb.com/name/nm3495343/

So to pursue that, I've completed composing a 6 song album of cinematic orchestral music that I will record with a live string orchestra! I've composed all the music, arranged all the parts and will conduct the orchestra myself when we record in the studio on August 27th. I will also be playing guitar and bass on these tracks as well.

The album is called "To The Ends of the Earth" and is a thematic series of tracks inspired by an Alien Earth full of magical forests, haunting evils, and beautiful landscapes. Each track is based on a different aspect of this mysterious planet.

The album will be fully mixed and mastered and when it's completed it will be marketed to trailer houses, movie studios and music supervisors.

We will also be filming the session and will include it on the DVD companion to the CD or digital download. (Possibly even a music video!)

You can listen to all the demos right here (and these are just MIDI demos!) 

The Core:
http://soundcloud.com/baazar/the-core

The Breach:
http://soundcloud.com/baazar/the-breach

The Sky:
http://soundcloud.com/baazar/the-sky

To The Ends of the Earth: (title track)
http://soundcloud.com/baazar/to-the-ends-of-the...

The Underworld:

http://soundcloud.com/baazar/the-underworld


The Forest:

http://soundcloud.com/baazar/the-forest


What We Need

At the moment I am paying out of pocket $250 for the recording studio and the players are doing this for FREE, out of the goodness of their heart and because they believe in the music. 


This is entirely for the generous violin, viola, cello, and bass players who are performing on the CD for free, and to cover the studio costs.

They deserve to be paid and if we can raise $1000 for them I can at least pay them each between $40-$55 for the session. (The final recording will between 18 and 25 players)

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word and the music!

story:
Short Summary

We are a rock band from Manchester-by-the-Sea, Massachusetts. We've been a band since 2009, and have been playing music together in various forms since middle school in 2004. Since we started, we've been putting everything into this band. Thanks to all your support, we've made it to the finals of the historic Rock N' Roll Rumble - recorded and released two EP's, a single for the Boston Music Award's 617 Sessions, and caught the attention of WGBH, The Boston Globe, and The Improper Bostonian - all in the past year alone. Since the beginning of February, we've been hard at work making a full length album of what we consider to be our strongest material to date. In order to achieve our full vision, including many studio hours, guest musicians, and the promotion/videos that will follow - we sincerely ask for any help you can give us. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our campaign is $5000, and can broken down into the following:

Recording = $2500

Mixing = $500

Mastering = $1000

CD Pressing/Promotion/Videos = $1000

We've offered a diverse selection of incentives to reach this goal, and in the instance that we happen to surpass our goal, all additional funding will go towards a vinyl release of the record and recording more music. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you cannot make a contribution, but any way you can spread the word is greatly appreciated!

story:
Short Summary

A Hundred Years is a badlands rock and roll trio from Edmonton. We are fortunate to be doing what we love to do. Here's a chance for us to use our music for a great cause. I have adopted two cats from the Human Society that have been the best animal friends I could ever ask for. We love animals and this is a cause close to our hearts. Let's work together to raise some money for the animals at the Edmonton Humane Society!


What We Need & What You Get

We need your money! Check out our perks to get some great deals on rare merch with all profit going to the Edmonton Humane Society. Or throw us a few bones and make $1 contributions. Every dollar helps!

The Impact

A Hundred Years has had the privilege of being part of many charities including March for Dimes, Chive On, and many other personal fundraisers. We're dong this campaign to help our animal friends out in the Edmonton area. 

Risks & Challenges

The Edmonton Humane Society always needs as much help as possible. There are many obstacles that they face sheltering animals and this should help them be the best they can be. All we need is your generosity to make this a success.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can share this campaign with your friends and family it would be tremendous help!
