story:
Hey everyone out there in Indiegogoland! Thanks for stopping by and checking out my music project. So, if you’re like me, you’re a total music lover, passionate about all types of music and someone that connects deeply to melodic, harmonic sounds of all types. Music folks are some of my favorite people…whether you’re a songwriter, a musician, a producer, a concert goer or all of the above; you do it, because you love it. Not for money, acclaim, or anything else. And your love of music and sharing your music with others is simply one of the greatest gifts we have in this world.

So, I’ve been writing songs for 11 years. I’m one of those creative guys who hears melodies in his head all the time. But I've always written songs with the intention that other people would sing them...not me. You can hear a few of my songs here (and 3 from the new album): http://www.reverbnation.com/jonathanwuebben

Now, its MY time to shine and finally take center stage, by writing, arranging, singing and performing my own material! I've gone through all 300 of my songs and selected the 12 very best tunes for this album.

On the record, there will be 4 up tempo songs, 4 ballads and 4 mid-tempo tunes. Melody will be front and center as will complex chord structures/harmony throughout. Certain songs on this album are the result of years of effort, fine tuning every part of them and making them as beautiful and deep as I possibly could. 

I'm working with Grammy award winning Producer, Doug Grean, on the album as well as a few of the best session musicians in the LA area. I’m thrilled to have the chance to work with these incredible music talents. As I’m a perfectionist with my music, I had to find a team of dedicated folks that were up to the challenge.

We have big plans for the album and promotion. I'm very confident that we have at least 2, perhaps 3 songs that will do very well in the charts. We'll also be creating music videos for every song on the album. We'll do a massive push of the album through social media and other online channels. (Im also a best selling online marketing author and software creator) This is your chance to get in on an exciting pop music project at the very beginning. 

My two major musical influences are Brian Wilson of the Beach Boys and David Gilmour of Pink Floyd. Pet Sounds is my favorite album of all time and some of the songs on my album we’ll be very similar to these gems. (I hope) I also love Dan Fogelberg, Cat Stevens, David Gates from the 70s band Bread, John Lennon, Todd Rundgren and Bob Marley. And if you picked up a copy of David Gilmour's solo album in 2006, you'll see a couple of my tunes on this album will be similar sounding. (Vocally, I can sometimes sound like Dave..though he is way better of course!)

In terms of modern day influences, they would be Greg Laswell, Ben Folds, Pugwash, Aqualung, JellyFish, Bill Ricchini, Brent Cash, Eric Hutchinson, June & the Exit Wounds, Linus of Hollywood, The Nines, The Pearlfishers, Rufus Wainwright and Ray LaMontagne.

On a personal note, I never had music lessons when I was a kid, as my parents couldn’t afford it. I learned everything I know about writing songs on my own. As a result, I have spent hundreds, if not thousands of hours, studying the songs of all the greats, analyzing their melodies, picking apart their harmonics and trying to understand how and why certain sounds go well with other sounds. It’s been one of the greatest thrills of my life. Most nights, around 10 or 11pm, you’ll find me sitting at my piano, a slave to the muse, writing another tune. I totally love it. ;)

I’ve put together some great rewards packages and I hope you’ll consider joining me in the making of this record. I can tell you, you’ll be a part of something truly great. This will be a total and complete labor of love to the music. These wont just be another batch of songs that sound like everything else out there; we intend to make some late 60's-early 70;s (with a slice of "Hall n Oates-esque" 80s) pop masterpieces. ;)

And with a little luck, we’ll get a couple songs on the charts. Or interest from other artists who may want to record a song or two.

Thanks again, so much, for your interest. I really appreciate it. To the music!
story_txt: Hey everyone out there in Indiegogoland! Thanks for stopping by and checking out my music project. So, if you’re like me, you’re a total music lover, passionate about all types of music and someone that connects deeply to melodic, harmonic sounds of all types. Music folks are some of my favorite people…whether you’re a songwriter, a musician, a producer, a concert goer or all of the above; you do it, because you love it. Not for money, acclaim, or anything else. And your love of music and sharing your music with others is simply one of the greatest gifts we have in this world.So, I’ve been writing songs for 11 years. I’m one of those creative guys who hears melodies in his head all the time. But I've always written songs with the intention that other people would sing them...not me. You can hear a few of my songs here (and 3 from the new album): http://www.reverbnation.com/jonathanwuebbenNow, its MY time to shine and finally take center stage, by writing, arranging, singing and performing my own material! I've gone through all 300 of my songs and selected the 12 very best tunes for this album.On the record, there will be 4 up tempo songs, 4 ballads and 4 mid-tempo tunes. Melody will be front and center as will complex chord structures/harmony throughout. Certain songs on this album are the result of years of effort, fine tuning every part of them and making them as beautiful and deep as I possibly could. I'm working with Grammy award winning Producer, Doug Grean, on the album as well as a few of the best session musicians in the LA area. I’m thrilled to have the chance to work with these incredible music talents. As I’m a perfectionist with my music, I had to find a team of dedicated folks that were up to the challenge.We have big plans for the album and promotion. I'm very confident that we have at least 2, perhaps 3 songs that will do very well in the charts. We'll also be creating music videos for every song on the album. We'll do a massive push of the album through social media and other online channels. (Im also a best selling online marketing author and software creator) This is your chance to get in on an exciting pop music project at the very beginning. My two major musical influences are Brian Wilson of the Beach Boys and David Gilmour of Pink Floyd. Pet Sounds is my favorite album of all time and some of the songs on my album we’ll be very similar to these gems. (I hope) I also love Dan Fogelberg, Cat Stevens, David Gates from the 70s band Bread, John Lennon, Todd Rundgren and Bob Marley. And if you picked up a copy of David Gilmour's solo album in 2006, you'll see a couple of my tunes on this album will be similar sounding. (Vocally, I can sometimes sound like Dave..though he is way better of course!)In terms of modern day influences, they would be Greg Laswell, Ben Folds, Pugwash, Aqualung, JellyFish, Bill Ricchini, Brent Cash, Eric Hutchinson, June & the Exit Wounds, Linus of Hollywood, The Nines, The Pearlfishers, Rufus Wainwright and Ray LaMontagne.On a personal note, I never had music lessons when I was a kid, as my parents couldn’t afford it. I learned everything I know about writing songs on my own. As a result, I have spent hundreds, if not thousands of hours, studying the songs of all the greats, analyzing their melodies, picking apart their harmonics and trying to understand how and why certain sounds go well with other sounds. It’s been one of the greatest thrills of my life. Most nights, around 10 or 11pm, you’ll find me sitting at my piano, a slave to the muse, writing another tune. I totally love it. ;)I’ve put together some great rewards packages and I hope you’ll consider joining me in the making of this record. I can tell you, you’ll be a part of something truly great. This will be a total and complete labor of love to the music. These wont just be another batch of songs that sound like everything else out there; we intend to make some late 60's-early 70;s (with a slice of "Hall n Oates-esque" 80s) pop masterpieces. ;)And with a little luck, we’ll get a couple songs on the charts. Or interest from other artists who may want to record a song or two.Thanks again, so much, for your interest. I really appreciate it. To the music!

story:
UPDATE!!!!! 4/4/16
The EP is almost complete!!! All songs have been recorded, album artwork is currently being designed and we are doing final edits on the remaining two out of seven tracks! I can't wait to share the hard work that has been put into this project! God is Good! :)

My journey and my dream...

Throughout my life music has always been my passion! I have embraced it with all my heart and have recently discovered its not just a passion but pretty big part of my identity. God has blessed me with this musical talent and I will forever be grateful for His gift! 

I've dedicated much of my life to developing as an artist spiritually, through relationships,  and musically. I believe He has always stood by me, guiding me in a direction to give my talent a purpose in this world through bringing joy, hope, or encouragement to others.
I've been blessed with the opportunity to dedicate much of my life to developing as an artist spiritually, in relationships and musically. I'll never forget my time at the Manhattan School of Music or the many amazing experiences I have gotten to share on stages throughout New York and the world! I remembering singing at Nassau Colosseum, Key-span Stadium for the Brooklyn Cyclones, the Marriott Marques in NYC, and an annual program for the NAACP!



As exciting as performing and writing music have been, I still carry a deep desire to leave a physical, timeless legacy that can be passed down and shared even in my absence... an album. How awesome would it be to allow anyone to experience the love of Jesus and be reminded of their worth just by pressing play?!

As an artist I can't wait to enter the studio and create a soundscape that represents the melodies, harmonies, and textures I hear in my head as I sing. It's such a privilege to be able to create a recording that can give you a glimpse of the beauty I hear and feel inside! 

So what's stopping me you ask?!   I'm glad you did!  Keep reading!

The Numbers!

We've set to the goal to the minimum of $5,000, but I don't plan to stop there!

Here's the breakdown!

  • $5,000 will go to the studio for production, recording, mixing ad mastering services.


Your impact goes way beyond my small world :)

I have talked quite a bit on how much your support would mean to me, but I want to also emphasize the bigger picture, your support will  undoubtedly change the lives of others!

My music is not particularly mainstream. It has a message saturated with hope, encouragement, and the love of God through Jesus! I know from experience that we often carry a longing to fill a God-shaped hole that nothing in this world can fill. I also know from experience that God can use music to break through the fog of pain, hopelessness, and fear!

By being a part of this project, you are helping to add one more positive work of art into a world saturated with negativity. We have all been there. We have all lost ourselves in the hurt of life.  So often it is music that works as the perfect reminder that we are not alone.



    Risks & Challenges 

    I believe that I am being led by more than  just my feelings. I have seen so many doors opened, and have received so much support that I have no doubts that this is just the beginning of something great. However, I understand that there are risks and challenges with any project of this magnitude.

    The biggest risk for you is a delay in completion of the EP. I don't believe that is necessarily a bad thing; sometimes waiting can bring about better opportunities. However I wouldn't be 100% honest if I said it wasn't a possibility.

    I want to assure you that I take your interest and contributions very seriously and have every intention of fulfilling all of my promises. Should any delays or concerns occur you will be the first to know.  I will strive to communicate all developments with transparency and timeliness.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Don't worry. Just because you can't contribute financially doesn't mean you can't help!

    • Share this with anyone you know who wants to be a part of spreading hope and encouragement. The world needs so much of it right now!
    • Support me by using the IndieGogo share tools to tell the world what we are working on.  (Custom Widgets, Facebook / Twitter, Auto Email Invite for gmail, yahoo and hotmail)

story:
What is it about?

The Professor Raps,  (Vol. II) is a collaboration between  English professor (Eartha Holley) and his former student (the artist, B.K.J). This unlikely duo finds a common interest in hip-hop, and they bring their skills together on this album.  The songs chronicle their friendship and the struggles between the professor and his protege who finishes college and goes on to postgraduate school in the medical profession. The music is raucous, purposeful and just plain fun. 




What will your contribution do?

All funds raised from this campaign will go toward recording and production costs, as well as publicity and distribution. There are many levels of support so that just about anybody can participate. And we'd love to share this project with as many of you as possible. The music itself has already been written and the funds are needed to complete the project and to get the music into the ears of our supporters. Even if you don't typically like rap music, this album might be the one for you.


Other Ways You Can Help

Help us spread the word by sharing the campaign, and following our update. Remind any friends or family you know who like Hip-Hop. Stay in contact with us through email or social media.

story:
My birth name is Kevin Gift. My twin brother's birth name was Wendel Patrick. He did not survive the birth. I never knew him, and yet I always knew I was a twin, and actually asked my parents about it before they told me.

Wendel Patrick is the name I use for all things Hip Hop and Electronica. As Wendel Patrick I've released two critically acclaimed albums that have been featured by VIBE Magazine, XLR8R Magazine, RE:UP Magazine, URB Magazine and other numerous publications. Kevin Gift is the name I use for all things piano related...usually classical and jazz, but not always. I have fans of each that don't know the other one exists. As a musician I have been fortunate to travel and perform all over the world as a classical, hip hop and jazz musician.

Three of the four albums in this project, "Travel", "Passage", and "JDWP" are Wendel Patrick releases. "20.TEN." is a Kevin Gift release of solo piano works. Working on all four of these albums simultaneously over the last year has been exhausting, but simultaneously the most rewarding thing I've ever done both artistically and musically. All four albums are very different. "Passage" plays along the lines of an acoustic album by The Roots, or something akin to "The Philadelphia Experiment" released in 2001. Every track on "Travel" was either written or conceived in a different city while on tour. "JDWP" is a J Dilla tribute project featuring my own arrangements of several of my favorite J Dilla sample based tunes, recreated without any sampling. All proceeds from "JDWP" will go to the J Dilla Foundation, who's mission is to help fund inner-city music programs and provide scholarships to students attending schools that have progressive music curricula.

This is the best music I've ever recorded. I want the world to hear it, and this campaign will help raise the funds needed to mix and master the albums as well as pay for manufacturing costs, publicity campaigns in publications such as FADER Magazine, Rolling Stone Magazine, Blender, VIBE Magazine, XLR8R and URB, time needed to record, travel expenses for collaborating artists, and if enough money is raised, the ability to bring all of this music to a city near you in a live format. 

What's Needed.

There is a lot that goes into making a recording, both during the recording process and after, and much of it can be costly. As an independent artist I make my own decisions about the music I want to record without having criteria dictated to me by a label. There is nothing requiring me to make something "catchy" at the expense of the music I wish to create. I see this as an ideal situation. Reaching the broader public with music in such an environment can be challenging however, which is where adequate publicity and marketing becomes a major factor. A half page ad in a magazine such as FADER can run into the thousands but can have a sizeable impact on spreading the word about a particular album, let alone four. $8000 dollars has been budgeted for publicity and marketing. Physical printing of CD's are usually done by the thousand and cost $1100 per CD or $4400 for all four. If enough money is raised, I will be printing physical copies of all four albums. Vynil pressings will take place as well, and the cost for a run of 800 is $1200. Mixing and mastering of the album has been budgeted at $2500. Travel expenses for collaborating artists has been budgeted at $1500, and mixing and mastering has been budgeted at $1500. Digital distribution for all four albums will cost approximately $300.

 

The Perks!

There are numerous perks that you will get as a supporter of this project ranging all the way from pre-ordering the albums at a discount up to Wendel Patrick music production for an album of your own. There are also opportunities to receive other large perks such as music production from Wendel Patrick for an individual track or an EP, album covers on beautifully wrapped gallery canvas for your walls, or individual production tutuorials via Skype from Wendel Patrick. Be sure to scroll through them all and find what you like!

  

Other Ways You Can Help!

If you are unable to contribute don't worry! you can still help a lot simply by passing around the Indiegogo video for this campaign via social media and letting as many people as possible people know about it in any way you can. Thank you, thank you, thank you....Here's to a music filled January 1st, 2014.

story:
Summary

  • Live on Washington is a teen-led program at the Neutral Zone teen center in Ann Arbor, Michigan.
  • Live on Washington teens will curate this free and open to the public arts and music festival.
  • We need your help to pay for the stage, the lighting, the sound equipment and the licenses that are all necessary for this festival.  Help fund it and bring the teens' vision to life.

What We Need & What You Get

  • In total we will need about $25,000 to fund the stage, sound, street permits, staffing, and helping us bring Mayer Hawthorne & The County. This campaign will be for $10,000 to help us get there.
  • You could get the opportunity to meet Mayer Hawthorne, and/or get cool exclusive Mayer and NZ merchandise.
  • Get the satisfaction of knowing you are helping to empower local teens, give them leadership skills and experience and put on an awesome event for the community.

The Impact

  • Live On Washington (and the Neutral Zone in general) empowers teens through our  youth-driven practices.  Much of the decision making and planning is placed in the hand of the youth. The day will also be filled extremely talented teen visual artists and musicians from all genres.
  • This is the 2nd year of Live On Washington but the 10th year the teens have curated a large scale concert.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Even if you can't donate please help us spread the word! Share this link and let people know about Live On Washington.

Summary
Live on Washington is a teen-led program at the Neutral Zone teen center in Ann Arbor, Michigan.
Live on Washington teens will curate this free and open to the public arts and music festival.
We need your help to pay for the stage, the lighting, the sound equipment and the licenses that are all necessary for this festival.  Help fund it and bring the teens' vision to life.
What We Need & What You Get
In total we will need about $25,000 to fund the stage, sound, street permits, staffing, and helping us bring Mayer Hawthorne & The County. This campaign will be for $10,000 to help us get there.
You could get the opportunity to meet Mayer Hawthorne, and/or get cool exclusive Mayer and NZ merchandise.

Get the satisfaction of knowing you are helping to empower local teens, give them leadership skills and experience and put on an awesome event for the community.
The Impact
Live On Washington (and the Neutral Zone in general) empowers teens through our  youth-driven practices.  Much of the decision making and planning is placed in the hand of the youth. The day will also be filled extremely talented teen visual artists and musicians from all genres.
This is the 2nd year of Live On Washington but the 10th year the teens have curated a large scale concert.
Other Ways You Can HelpEven if you can't donate please help us spread the word! Share this link and let people know about Live On Washington.

story:
Restart On Love begins now:

Hi, my name is Kingsley Charles, most people call me Kingsley, and my dad named me Kase at age 11. I grew up on an island chain called The Berry Islands situated within the beautiful sun shinning archipelago known as The Bahamas, the place where my first love began. 

It all started back as an island boy who only knew melodies, watching the King of Pop, Queen, The Police, and falling in love with the likes of Frank Sinatra, Nat King Cole and trying to imitate James Brown and Elvis. Lost in the world of music yet my options were limited, I either could become a doctor, lawyer, a police, or a pastor but not a musician. I was told it was a poor man's dream. Next thing I knew this island boy ended up in the precious state of Virginia on U.S. soil where I started a band called "The Kase Project" and within months we became one of the few respected acts in the east coast region. Quickly rising fast. After our time together had ended I saw an opportunity in Nashville as I was determined to not give up on my dream. The funny thing was, in thinking out loud I was like "what's an island boy doing in the world of country territory". 

Restart On Love means begin again, redemption, born again, and living out your life while you still have breath. Time, is what Restart On Love means to me. I thought I lost it back in Nashville where my heart was broken into pieces, where my world tumbled down and where I lost all trust in humanity. My time in Nashville didn't last too long, I ended up coming back home. I wanted it so badly, felt it so much and desired to create something bigger that can be enjoyed across multiple countries, cultures, generations, and airwaves beyond where my limbs can take me.

Until I realized something, after experiencing the pain in having loved and lost and hoping to die alone in belief that no one loved me, I saw opportunity. Yes, it took many bumps and bruises for the idea and thought to finally hit me. When you do what you're not meant to do your own mind faults you. So why give up? Its never too late to be what you were meant to be while you still have life, while you still breath, and while your passion for people pushes you forward, hoping in return that they will support this lifestyle, passion, cause, and projection, for all future generations to come. 

With your help we can impact the world together, heal broken hearts, break down walls and barriers that's keeping my words, and songs from your hearts. Let's do this for freedom, for love, for peace, harmony, and let's do this by spreading the word around the world about this project to all of your friends, family, and their friends and family and when we succeed, we will touch the world together.

Your contribution to this project would allow me to reach people across the world in high school, colleges and universities, political arenas, and more than three continents. After this book and album release I plan to create a Restart On Love Tour platform with other artists sharing the same vision and inviting them along for this ride. Your contribution will help me fund the cost of publishing my book and recording my album along with three music videos, pay for marketing, and to purchase a new acoustic guitar. 

Below is a detail description of how the funds will be used:

1. Book publishing break down:

  • Developmental edit $1,000
  • Copy editing $800
  • Cover Design $300
  • Book formatting and layout $300
  • Printing – free (Print on demand only)
  • ISBN – $100
  • Author photo – $300
  • Kirkus Review – $425
  • Google Adwords – $500
  • Facebook Ads – $500
  • Print advertising – $1,200
  • Marketing collateral – $1,000
  • Marketing consultant / PR  – $2,000
  • Events / launch party – $1,000
  • Website – $100 (For custom WordPress theme)
Album release break down:
  • Record cost: $5,000 per song but will get it done for $1,000.00 (mastering not included)
  • Total Mastering: $5,000.00 (11 songs)
  • Album cover: $300.00
  • Website: $300.00
  • There are a few unmentioned items for which I will be taking on the cost.
  • In-Kind donations for any of the above listed expenditures are also welcomed. To do this you may contact me via email at info@kaselightcreations.com.
One of the biggest challenges I have on this journey is that in The Bahamas we are still developing a much stronger environment of music as we do in culture (Junkanoo). We don't have a competitive music industry, mostly due to regulation. So many people are willing to support you for traditional professions such as becoming a teacher, banker, lawyer, or a doctor but not as an artist. Some say you shouldn't write a book until you've gotten a Phd or have accomplished the world. These setbacks can be a magnitude of noise. So I invented a solution. Create your own video of what Restart On Love means to you then challenge your closest friends, celebrity, sister, brother, lover, teacher, pastor and everyone you know to do the same. You can share your video on www.facebook.com/kingsleykase all you have to do is click "Like". If each of you donate your time and spread the word for this journey, once the goal is reached, I will donate my time with a free concert at a local charity in your honor as well as make a special thank you video with the footage from this event for everyone who supports this.  
If the goal is not reached I hope to utilize the funds to at least accomplish the part of the goal in getting started, no matter the wait. I would just focus on packaging this journey so lives can be impacted in a creative and strategic way.
Furthermore, there are many other ways you can help. 
1. Spread the word to everyone you know and tell them to spread the word to everyone they know.
2. Share this campaign on your Facebook pages, Twitter, Youtube, cafe's, and restaurants near you.
3. Find out where I'm performing in future and choose to become a street team member.
4. Join my Facebook page and become apart of this journey by liking videos, sharing videos, and following me on social media wherever I go.
5. I ask that you learn the songs, sing them, make as many Youtube videos performing my songs and watch me rise. 
This message is more powerful than money but honestly sometimes you need people with wealthy hearts who believe in you, and I truly need more of this. I need your support to help make all these dreams come true. Words of affirmation and quality time are my love languages and so these two things are major motivators in times of doubt.
So please make a lot of noise every where you go and use the fancy indiegogo share tools to help make this journey a reality and that's all to this. I hope we meet in future, so that I can say 'thank you' for your support, and by the looks of it I'm never going to stop saying thank you.
Much Love,
Kingsley
story_txt:
Restart On Love begins now: Hi, my name is Kingsley Charles, most people call me Kingsley, and my dad named me Kase at age 11. I grew up on an island chain called The Berry Islands situated within the beautiful sun shinning archipelago known as The Bahamas, the place where my first love began. 
It all started back as an island boy who only knew melodies, watching the King of Pop, Queen, The Police, and falling in love with the likes of Frank Sinatra, Nat King Cole and trying to imitate James Brown and Elvis. Lost in the world of music yet my options were limited, I either could become a doctor, lawyer, a police, or a pastor but not a musician. I was told it was a poor man's dream. Next thing I knew this island boy ended up in the precious state of Virginia on U.S. soil where I started a band called "The Kase Project" and within months we became one of the few respected acts in the east coast region. Quickly rising fast. After our time together had ended I saw an opportunity in Nashville as I was determined to not give up on my dream. The funny thing was, in thinking out loud I was like "what's an island boy doing in the world of country territory". 
Restart On Love means begin again, redemption, born again, and living out your life while you still have breath. Time, is what Restart On Love means to me. I thought I lost it back in Nashville where my heart was broken into pieces, where my world tumbled down and where I lost all trust in humanity. My time in Nashville didn't last too long, I ended up coming back home. I wanted it so badly, felt it so much and desired to create something bigger that can be enjoyed across multiple countries, cultures, generations, and airwaves beyond where my limbs can take me.
Until I realized something, after experiencing the pain in having loved and lost and hoping to die alone in belief that no one loved me, I saw opportunity. Yes, it took many bumps and bruises for the idea and thought to finally hit me. When you do what you're not meant to do your own mind faults you. So why give up? Its never too late to be what you were meant to be while you still have life, while you still breath, and while your passion for people pushes you forward, hoping in return that they will support this lifestyle, passion, cause, and projection, for all future generations to come. 
With your help we can impact the world together, heal broken hearts, break down walls and barriers that's keeping my words, and songs from your hearts. Let's do this for freedom, for love, for peace, harmony, and let's do this by spreading the word around the world about this project to all of your friends, family, and their friends and family and when we succeed, we will touch the world together.
Your contribution to this project would allow me to reach people across the world in high school, colleges and universities, political arenas, and more than three continents. After this book and album release I plan to create a Restart On Love Tour platform with other artists sharing the same vision and inviting them along for this ride. Your contribution will help me fund the cost of publishing my book and recording my album along with three music videos, pay for marketing, and to purchase a new acoustic guitar. 
Below is a detail description of how the funds will be used:
1. Book publishing break down:


Developmental edit $1,000
Copy editing $800
Cover Design $300
Book formatting and layout $300
Printing – free (Print on demand only)
ISBN – $100
Author photo – $300
Kirkus Review – $425
Google Adwords – $500
Facebook Ads – $500
Print advertising – $1,200
Marketing collateral – $1,000
Marketing consultant / PR  – $2,000
Events / launch party – $1,000
Website – $100 (For custom WordPress theme)
Album release break down:


Record cost: $5,000 per song but will get it done for $1,000.00 (mastering not included)
Total Mastering: $5,000.00 (11 songs)
Album cover: $300.00
Website: $300.00
There are a few unmentioned items for which I will be taking on the cost.
In-Kind donations for any of the above listed expenditures are also welcomed. To do this you may contact me via email at info@kaselightcreations.com.


One of the biggest challenges I have on this journey is that in The Bahamas we are still developing a much stronger environment of music as we do in culture (Junkanoo). We don't have a competitive music industry, mostly due to regulation. So many people are willing to support you for traditional professions such as becoming a teacher, banker, lawyer, or a doctor but not as an artist. Some say you shouldn't write a book until you've gotten a Phd or have accomplished the world. These setbacks can be a magnitude of noise. So I invented a solution. Create your own video of what Restart On Love means to you then challenge your closest friends, celebrity, sister, brother, lover, teacher, pastor and everyone you know to do the same. You can share your video on www.facebook.com/kingsleykase all you have to do is click "Like". If each of you donate your time and spread the word for this journey, once the goal is reached, I will donate my time with a free concert at a local charity in your honor as well as make a special thank you video with the footage from this event for everyone who supports this.  
If the goal is not reached I hope to utilize the funds to at least accomplish the part of the goal in getting started, no matter the wait. I would just focus on packaging this journey so lives can be impacted in a creative and strategic way.
Furthermore, there are many other ways you can help. 
1. Spread the word to everyone you know and tell them to spread the word to everyone they know.
2. Share this campaign on your Facebook pages, Twitter, Youtube, cafe's, and restaurants near you.
3. Find out where I'm performing in future and choose to become a street team member.
4. Join my Facebook page and become apart of this journey by liking videos, sharing videos, and following me on social media wherever I go.
5. I ask that you learn the songs, sing them, make as many Youtube videos performing my songs and watch me rise. 

This message is more powerful than money but honestly sometimes you need people with wealthy hearts who believe in you, and I truly need more of this. I need your support to help make all these dreams come true. Words of affirmation and quality time are my love languages and so these two things are major motivators in times of doubt.
So please make a lot of noise every where you go and use the fancy indiegogo share tools to help make this journey a reality and that's all to this. I hope we meet in future, so that I can say 'thank you' for your support, and by the looks of it I'm never going to stop saying thank you.
Much Love,
Kingsley

story:
GOZU is set to embark on their first ever European tour. The tour is entering the final planning stages. We are 99% of the way there. Just over two weeks’ worth of shows in April have been secured. Scheduled shows in The Netherlands, Italy, Germany and Slovenia are bookended with appearances at two major festivals; Roadburn NL April 12th and Desertfest Berlin April 25th. This tour is a huge opportunity to gain exposure for the band, and we are dedicated to playing all of these shows with the passion and energy you’ve come to expect from a GOZU performance. That being said, we are reaching out to all our fans, old and new, to help us make the tour as successful as we know it can be.

To be clear, this tour does not live or die by this fundraising campaign…we are going regardless. The goal, with the help of our amazing fan base (which is the reason why we play in the first place) is to try and cover some of the known costs we have already incurred, and to set us up with a small purse of cash for the unforeseen incidentals that will undoubtedly arise while in Europe.

As you may or may not know, there are many costs tied to a venture like this. Transportation, instrument rentals, and housing accommodations are the obvious ones. But…

  • Did you know it costs about $100 dollars a day to feed the band and crew?
  • Or that baggage fees for checking our instruments onto the plane can cost anywhere from $200-$500 dollars on top of the ticket prices?
  • Fuel is expensive, taxes on just about everything we’ll need while we are there are also expensive.

These are just a few of the types of costs that are quickly adding up as we enter the final stages of preparation for the tour. Our plan was to use merchandise sales to pay for all of these related expenses, but that is a variable, so we hope you can help us out. Each dollar raised will make a huge difference for us while on the road.

The band came up with some really cool and unique incentives to thank those of you who choose to donate to our campaign. Beyond the usual tunes, t-shirts and posters, we decided we wanted to include some exclusive music and special personalized incentives that will allow us to connect with fans in some cool ways. So please take a look, and as always we thank you for your continuing support.

Love,

GOZU

Marc, Joe, Doug & Mike


GOZU Facebook Page

Small Stone Recordings GOZU Page

Roadburn Festival

Desertfest Berlin

story:
Hi there! We are a group of people called Psalmodia (latin core part of the Christian Liturgy of the Hours). We are a Polish academic Choir from Cracow, based at the Pontifical University of John Paul II.

Currently there are around 60 persons who actively participate in the rehearsals. Despite the "academic" aspect, many of us have stayed here much longer than just during our studying time. We love music, singing, the wonderful atmosphere, our magnificent conductor and, last but not least, we love each other. So much that we simply cannot say "bye" to the choir. At least, not when the proper time comes. Visit us at our website (www.psalmodia.pl) or on You Tube channels: the old one (http://www.youtube.com/user/puericapsalmodienses) and the new one (http://www.youtube.com/user/ChorPsalmodia/videos?flow=grid&view=0).

Allegedly, we are the best academic choir in Cracow (it's a wonderful historic city in Southern Poland - the cradle of Polish identity, culture, art and music). Some people say even that we sound like  a professional choir, which we are often too shy to agree. We only do our job. Wait! It's not a job - almost none of us are musicians - there are, however, many other professionals: pharmacists, linguists, lawyers, doctors, engineers, mathematicians etc. And students, of course :) It's our passion, our "life after life".

We give concerts (mainly in the neighbourhood of Cracow), we cooperate with other choirs and orchestras (Polish Radio Choir, Cracow Philharmonics, Cracow Opera, Capella Cracoviensis, Howard Shore, Tan Dun, Joe Hisaishi, Krzysztof Penderecki) we travel (we've visited so far Italy, Spain, Hungary, Sweden... and we want more!), we enter competitions (majority of which, we actually win :)) and at times we also record CDs.

In February 2011, we recorded our first CD with Polish choral music. We had an idea that nobody has had so far - we want to create a sort of anthology of great Polish compositions for choir, both a capella (without instruments) and with accompaniment. So, the first CD comprised works of the most renowned Polish contemporary composer - the late Henryk Mikołaj Górecki (we probably don't need to tell you how magnificent he was, the whole world has been amazed with his orchestra and choral pieces. If, by any chance, someone has never heard of the guy - http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/G%C3%B3recki). The a capella album was a great challenge and achievement - we had even a phonographic world premiere!

The second CD in the cycle (which is Psalmodia's third album in general) was recorded this year - in March. It is fully devoted to Stanisław Moniuszko - a great Polish composer, initiator of the Polish national opera and the creator of the Polish artistic song (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stanis%C5%82aw_Moniuszko).

Due to funds raised by the PassionArt Artistic Association (established by members of the choir) we were able to record the Latin Mass in D-flat Major, 3 motets and 2 organ preludes. That is not, however, or at least shouldn't be, the end of the work.

We need to find money to release the recorded material. Since our University is not a big entity, and the Association has already done what they could, we need to turn to other people who would be able to help.

The whole cycle, so the CD we are trying to publish as well, is aimed at popularizing and spreading Polish music and Polish composers, and believe me - they are truly magnificent. Although the works are often performed live, they have never been recorded - it would be a pity if the world does not hear about our national pride! :) We want to make a change.

story:
In this season of giving, we reflect giving thanks for the good fortune and sustenance bestowed upon us. It is through this reflective moment, we see more clearly the misfortune of others.  


Other Ways You Can Help

We realize that many people aren't capable of contributing. However, there is still something you can do. Spread the word to others. Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

story:
**Update 1/1/14.  Happy New Year!  Thanks to everyone who helped out with our Indiegogo Fundraiser!  It was a huge success!  If you contributed, we will be contacting you in the next couple of days about your Patron Rewards.  Thank you so much for helping us out in our quest to spread Molasses Creek music around the world!

**


WHO IS . . . 

***PROJECT UPDATE! AS OF 12/20/13 THE NEW ALBUM, SOMETHING WORTH HAVING WENT TO PRESS.  HERE IS A PICTURE OF THE COVER!  HOPE YOU WILL JOIN US IN FUNDING THE NEW NATIONAL PROMOTION.  CLICK HERE TO GO TO THE MOLASSES CREEK HOME PAGE FOR A LISTENING SAMPLE!

**

We are Molasses Creek band out of Ocracoke Island, NC.  The band began in 1993 when Gary Mitchell and his wife lured Fiddler Dave to the remote island of Ocracoke (23 miles off the coast of North Carolina) with the promise of beautiful bikini clad women and all the fig preserves he could eat.  Over the last 20 years, Molasses Creek has created wonderfully original contemporary folk music, holding court on Ocracoke Island during the summers at our very own Deepwater Theater, and touring all around the United States. 

Our accolades are plentiful, including awards on Garrison Keillor's A Prairie Home Companion, #4 Album on the National Folk Radio DJ Stations (the last album, "An Island Out of Time"), and top band on the European Country Music Charts. Molasses Creek’s roster includes Gary Mitchell (guitar/vocals), Fiddler Dave Tweedie (fiddle/vocals), Lou Castro (dobro/bass/vocals), Marcy Brenner (mandolin/banjolin/bass/vocals), and Gerald Hampton (mandolin/upright bass).

Feel free to email us at info@molassescreek.com if you have any questions about this Campaign or the Patron Rewards.  Thanks!


WHAT ARE WE UP TO NOW?

In the spring of 2013 Molasses Creek worked feverishly on an album of new material for local release at the Ocrafolk Festival in June. We were very excited about new songs such as Marcy's "Joe Bell Flowers" and "Five Minutes", Fiddler Dave's "Death My Friend", new instrumentals "Tico Creeko" and Gerald's "Ehringhaus Blues", Louie's take on "Galway Girl" and "My Window Faces the South", Phil Kelly's great new song "Something Worth Having", and a fresh remake of Gary's classic "The Waterman".

Working with Nashville producer Kari Estrin on the international release of this album, we were motivated to revisit all of the songs and tweak, fine tune, remix and re-record tracks as needed until we were all thrilled with the result! We even added a new-old song that we've been having a lot of fun with which we call "The Yazoo Choo Choo".

The resulting recording, "Something Worth Having", was just mastered by Grammy-winning engineer Charlie Pilzer at Airshow Mastering and is now off to the duplicators! Our international promotion of the new CD will launch in February of 2014.  Working with Kari Estrin, we will be sending the album to over 500 radio stations across the US, Canada, and Europe, hoping to beat our last record of #4 on the Folk Radio DJ Charts.

WHY ARE WE DOING SUCH A SILLY THING?

(Fiddler Dave sensed that being a street musician didn't earn what it used to . . .)

Our fans might have noticed that we have significantly stepped up our touring over the past 3 years.  With a new band van and even more get-up-n-go we want to take our performances to larger concert halls and more places.  The first thing the owners of the venues ask when we contact them is . . .  “Do you have an audience around here who has heard of you and will beat down the doors?”  National promotion of our latest recording is a critical part of the puzzle.

In addition to this radio push, we are planning to attend the Folk Alliance International Conference in Kansas City, MO in February to spread the word about the band and hobnob with presenters from all across the continent.  It is going to take a lot of fig preserves and Joe Bell seeds to get their attention!

WHAT WE NEED

  All of these dreams cost a good deal of money.  After spending $10-15,000 just to make a recording it will take another $10-15,000 to do the promotional plan.  While we certainly wouldn’t ask our fans to foot the whole enchilada, we are hoping that everyone pulling together can raise about $10,000 for this campaign.  If you are interested in the details of what each part of the project costs here is more info.  We ought to know what we are doing by now since this is album #13!

  • Album recording & mastering ~ $9400
  • Album layout & design ~ $800
  • Album mechanical licenses  (2000 CDs) ~ $1640
  • Physical duplication ~ (2000 CDs) ~ $3000
  • Radio Promotion Fees ~ $4800
  • Radio Promotion Materials Design and Printing ~ $800
  • Radio Promotion Mailing Costs ~ $850
  • Folk Alliance International (FAI) Conference Registration ~ $1600
  • FAI Advertising ~ $900
  • FAI Room & Board~ $1800
  • FAI Travel ~ $514
  • TOTALLING OVER $26,000!

WHAT YOU GET . . .

FABULOUS PLEDGE PRIZES ABOUND!

No nutrias were harmed in the making of these pledge prizes, or this picture.

We know our fans love Molasses Creek & Ocracoke Island, and we love you!  So we have found some really cool ways that you can get fabulous prizes this holiday season.  Some of the best ones (like a week’s stay on Ocracoke Island + Molasses Creek makes you dinner) are limited offers, so snap em up quick!  There should be something affordable for everybody on your fan list.

THE IMPACT OF OUR CAMPAIGN

In 2012, Molasses Creek embarked upon a similar campaign working with Kari Estrin Management to promote our release "An Island Out of Time." Our #4 chart success during the first campaign resulted in Molasses Creek exposure across the folk music world, invitations to major venues like the LEAF festival (Lake Eden Arts Festival), Floydfest, the legendary Caffé Lena concert hall in Saratoga Springs, NY, an official showcase at the Northeast Regional Folk Alliance Conference, and an appearance on the nationally syndicated Woodsongs Old Time Radio Hour out of Lexington, KY.

We need to remind the Folk Music World that we are still here and much more than a flash in the pan.  We eagerly anticipate that this next national promotion will result in Molasses Creek’s music spreading even further, more concerts in more places to a greater number of fans!

WHAT HAPPENS IF WE DON’T REACH OUR GOAL?

Molasses Creek chose Indiegogo crowd fundraising for two main reasons.  (1) Unlike Kickstarter, Indiegogo takes credit cards even if you don’t have a PayPal account, and (2) Indiegogo offers campaigns with flexible funding which means that we keep the funds we raise even if we don’t reach our goal (and YOU GET TO KEEP YOUR HOLIDAY PLEDGE PRIZES FROM THE MOMENT YOU CONTRIBUTE!).  If we make our goal Indiegogo charges 4% fee, if we don’t then they charge 9% fee.  Big incentive to go out and shake the trees!  If we don’t raise our complete goal we may have to tailor our plans for the Folk Alliance International conference, so we will keep our fingers crossed.  If we raise more than our goal than it means that we can spend more time making great music and less time running fundraisers!

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

We have tried to make sure that everyone can have the opportunity to jump in and join the fun.  EVEN A SMALL CONTRIBUTIONS FROM FOLKS CAN MAKE A BIG DIFFERENCE.  HELP SPREAD THE WORD AMONGST YOUR FRIENDS AND NEIGHBORS, ON FACEBOOK, THE WEB, AND BY TALKING IT UP.  LET’S TAKE FLIGHT!

TOTALLING OVER $26,000!

WHAT YOU GET . . . 
FABULOUS PLEDGE PRIZES ABOUND!
No nutrias were harmed in the making of these pledge prizes, or this picture.We know our fans love Molasses Creek & Ocracoke Island,
and we love you!  So we have found
some really cool ways that you can get fabulous prizes this holiday
season.  Some of the best ones (like
a week’s stay on Ocracoke Island + Molasses Creek makes you dinner) are
limited offers, so snap em up quick! 
There should be something affordable for everybody on your fan list.THE IMPACT OF OUR CAMPAIGN
In 2012, Molasses Creek embarked
upon a similar campaign working with Kari Estrin Management to promote our
release "An Island Out of Time." Our #4 chart success during the first
campaign resulted in Molasses Creek exposure across the folk music world,
invitations to major venues like the LEAF festival (Lake Eden Arts
Festival), Floydfest, the legendary Caffé Lena concert hall in Saratoga Springs,
NY, an official showcase at the Northeast Regional Folk Alliance Conference, and an
appearance on the nationally syndicated Woodsongs Old Time Radio Hour out of
Lexington, KY.
We
need to remind the Folk Music World that we are still here and much more than a flash in the pan.  We eagerly anticipate that this next national promotion will result in Molasses
Creek’s music spreading even further, more concerts in more places to a greater
number of fans! WHAT HAPPENS IF WE DON’T REACH OUR GOAL?

Molasses Creek chose Indiegogo crowd fundraising for two
main reasons.  (1) Unlike
Kickstarter, Indiegogo takes credit cards even if you don’t have a PayPal
account, and (2) Indiegogo offers campaigns with flexible funding which means
that we keep the funds we raise even if we don’t reach our goal (and YOU GET TO KEEP YOUR HOLIDAY PLEDGE PRIZES FROM THE MOMENT YOU CONTRIBUTE!).  If we make
our goal Indiegogo charges 4% fee, if we don’t then they charge 9% fee.  Big incentive to go out and shake the trees!  If we don’t raise our
complete goal we may have to tailor our plans for the Folk Alliance
International conference, so we will keep our fingers crossed.  If we raise more than our goal than it
means that we can spend more time making great music and less time running
fundraisers!
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
We have tried to make sure
that everyone can have the opportunity to jump in and join the fun.  EVEN A SMALL CONTRIBUTIONS FROM FOLKS CAN MAKE A BIG DIFFERENCE.  HELP SPREAD THE WORD AMONGST YOUR FRIENDS AND NEIGHBORS, ON FACEBOOK, THE WEB, AND BY TALKING IT UP. 
LET’S TAKE FLIGHT!

story:
Cherae Leri is an upcoming star out of Houston, Texas. She is on the verge of actually accomplishing her dreams with patience, hardwork, and dedication. But everyone needs help sometimes and right now alot of things are happening for her faster than she can speak. Anything at this moment is appreciated to do things the right way and the professional way. She is in the process of doing her first visual and it will cost but it will be worth every penny. Thankfully the videographer is investing in Cherae and willing to give her a low discounted rate. He is not profiting any of  the cost only paying his guys for their time & editing. 
Thank You again and let's get our star to the Top. 

Check out The New Single. 

www.CheraeLeri.com
-Thank You

story:
About Dulcinea Detwah and dancers

I am a female emcee and electronic music producer originally from Detroit now living in Brooklyn. In 2011, I released my first EP, Cool Kid and I've been creating music, collaborating and performing live ever since. Dancers aka DeJaye and Craig are fabulous movers who don pumps and stilettos at every Dulcinea Detwah show. 
Why we need your help
Within the past four years I have been working tirelessly as an emerging artist in the music industry. In Detroit not only do we receive overwhelming support from family and friends but from the local community as well. This year we were invited to be featured performers at the Sidewalk Festival for the Performing Arts (an outdoor celebration of site-specific performance and installation art, in the heart of Detroit’s Old Redford/Brightmoor Neighborhoods). With your help we will strengthen our connection to our followers in Detroit, broaden our visibility and help support a great new festival. 

LINK TO SIDEWALK FESTIVAL FOR THE PERFORMING ARTS SITE 
http://www.sidewalkdetroit.com/index.php?link=ect

We Only Need $800 and this is what your donation finances: 

  • Travel: rental car, ground transportation
  • Costumes
  • Dancer fees/per diem

    Risks & Challenges

    We understand that it is a difficult time for everyone financially; that is why we set our fundraising goal at a reasonable/attainable level. However we also understand that without your support we can't continue to create artistically rich and challenging music projects and programs. If we do not reach our fundraising goal we will continue to reach out to local businesses for sponsorship. 

      Other Ways You Can Help

      We know that some of you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help. If you cannot support monetarily we ask that you please share this campaign with friends and/or blogs. 

      Thank you from Dulcinea, DeJaye and Craig!

story:
Short Summary

Hello, my name is Kristin Murray and I am twenty eight years old with a passion for human betterment and have had this passion since I was five years old, when I had tried to send an envelope filled with cheezles to the starving Bangladeshi children that I had seen on the television. 
I have travelled extensively throughout the world and have seen the extreme poverty and what those less off than I have to endure daily, and like the young girl with the cheezles that I once was- I still very much want to help these people in need. 
On my travels I have had the opportunity to be involved in and learn from many not for profit organisations whom work with peoples in developing countries, such as restaurants whom employ street children in the Vietnam, a workshop which employs women that come from a community that lives on a rubbish dump in Nicaragua, massage parlours that train and employ blind people in Vietnam, a restaurant that employs people with down syndrome in Indonesia and so on. 
From these experiences I have been able to build upon my own ideas of how I would like to help improve the lives of those less fortunate than myself and have come up with the Mum's Off The Streets foundation.  
Mums Off The Streets' main focus will be housing and feeding homeless mothers and their children in Bangladesh, which will progress to training in the workforce and schooling for their children.
The foundation is a minimum three month program that will house, feed, tend to the health needs of and train the women in the workforce, giving them skills so that they can find a job. If, at the end of the program any of the women are not yet ready to leave the house, they will be welcomed to stay until they are. No mothers will be put back onto the streets. 
Depending on how successful the foundation becomes will determine how many mothers will be off the streets and in our care. This may mean that I will in future need to purchase/rent another living space for more mothers and children.
The plan: 
I will purchase a large house in Bangladesh and hire two women trained in arts and craft to teach eight women (four women each) to begin with, how to make arts and crafts, which I will be able to sell online as well as in Australia to pay for the foundation's expenses. 
All of the training, cooking, eating and sleeping will be onsite in a safe location and I will hire two mums to care for the duties of cooking and cleaning, with their payment being food and board. 

The house that I will purchase will require a large room that I will use as the workshop for the women, along with garage which I will turn into a classroom for volunteers to teach the children of the mothers whilst the mums are working or learning arts and crafts skills which will empower them for life.

This is your chance to be part of something that will help the world change for the better, no matter how small your contribution is, it will be appreciated with the same amount of gratitude as the next contribution. 

Breakdown of costs:

To start this foundation I have estimated the cost to be $150, 000 dollars. 

The houses that I have looked at online that are big enough to create a living space for maximum twenty four women and children start at around $100,000, leaving $50,000.

The minimum wage in Bangladesh is $30 dollars a month, and I would like to pay above this to the women who will be training the mothers. This means for the first year of the foundation the cost of wages will be at the minimum $720, leaving approximately $49,000.

The cost of food for one person per year is at a maximum of $340, meaning that to feed 24 people for the first year of the foundation would come to $8,160, and although the foundation would by that stage be self sufficient, I would like to budget for this just incase. 

This would leave approximately $40,000 to buy the materials for the arts and crafts, to pay for water, electricity and land rates.

What you get!

To raise money for this foundation I am making and selling jewellery, much like the jewellery that the mothers will be taught to make. I am also in the process of writing childrens books as well as a biography on my travels to raise funds for the foundation, however the books are still in the making. 

The unique, handmade jewellery on the other hand, is now very readily available and depending on what you can afford you can buy for yourself, your partners and even for your entire family! And you can do so knowing that not only are you helping me to live my dream, but you will be saving mothers and their children from living impoverished lives on the streets with the constant worry of where they will sleep and where they get their next meal from.

If it happens that I do not reach my initial goal of $150,000 dollars, the foundation will be going ahead all the same. I am dedicated for life to this goal, it has been a long time in the making and I have never given up. I know that it will happen, one way or another. The experience that I have had in other organisations such as the one that I am starting assure me of this.

If I don't have enough money to start the foundation the way that I have described above, I will be doing so in an alternate way, for example I could buy a smaller house, buy land and build a house on it, or even rent a place for the women and children to live. 

If you don't have the money to spare but feel moved to help homeless mothers and children, you can help just by forwarding my message and goal, as you can connect to people that I may not be able to, meaning that whatever they can donate is because of you. 

You can spread the word of my campaign by finding me at: https://www.facebook.com/FoundationForAFoundation, 

or by using the indiegogo sharetool. 

Thank you so much for reading this and I hope to hear from you soon! 

Kristin.

story: I've been playing drums for almost 8 years and I want to do something with it now. I'm trying to raise money to get good recording and editing software as well as new drum hardware, drum heads, cymbals, a GoPro camera, and anything else that I might need. I want the videos to be the best quality that I can make. I play a lot of pop/punk and indie rock. I hope to spread the name of some great and somewhat unheard of bands by doing this.

story:
**UPDATE** Donate at the $50 level or higher, receive a one-of-a-kind, original bird drawing by Jose Delgado-Guevara!


*MONSTER WOW UPDATE!* Anyone contributing $100 or more will receive an invite to the exclusive post-festival feast by Chef Wayne Kitchen on the evening of June 7th! This is a one-of-a-kind opportunity to dine on delicious food, made with largely locally-sourced ingredients, by top flight local culinary talent, with a group of incredible musicians! Subject to Seating Availability, so donate to sign up now now now now! 
*SAD UPDATE* Due to unforeseen and unavoidable funding issues, Donato Mancini will not be joining us as Poet In Residence. The author of the festival chapbook remains to be seen. Our apologies to those who have contributed.

Now heading into its third year, Casse-Tête: A Festival of Experimental Music needs your support. 

We want to continue to offer Prince George audiences music they would never otherwise get to hear, performed by musicians from around Canada and beyond, and including some of Prince George’s own most radical artists. Let’s keep up the momentum and broaden the festival’s outreach to the community!

How we started

In 2013, Prince George witnessed the birth of Casse-Tête: A Festival of Experimental Music, conceived as a festival of challenging music from a wide range of traditions and practices with a local core supplemented by visiting artists. Over two days at The Exploration Place Museum and Science Centre in Fort George Park, around 100 people heard incredible music that had never been given a remotely comparable platform in the region before. The festival was an artistic, financial, and social success, prompting the decision to continue.

How we kept it going

2014’s festival was a much larger affair than 2013’s, beginning with the spectacular Piano Drop from the roof of the museum, continuing into a panel discussion, followed by two more days of music at TEP, now utilizing both the Kordyban Learning Centre and the beautiful atrium. Artists came from much farther afield than the first year, exposing local musicians to unique playing opportunities and local audiences to unbelievable listening opportunities. Including the Piano Drop, attendance at the festival topped 300 people, and fundraising efforts were rewarded by a vastly larger production, which was also more fairly remunerative to the participants.

Where we are now

2015’s festival is growing again, and continues to experiment with its own structure and possibilities. To increase the capacity of the festival, a society has been created to deliver it: the Casse-Tête Festival Society. This society’s mission and mandate extend beyond the festival itself, but the festival is the most important activity in its present conception. Important to note is that anyone who buys a festival pass is eligible for a membership, and anyone who buys a membership gets a festival pass!

This year’s event features outstanding local, regional, and visiting artists, including Costa Rican composer Susan Campos Fonseca, Rodney Sharman, Adrian Verdejo, Jonathon Wilcke, locals Christians, Jose Delgado-Guevara, Cathy Lewis, Dave Chokroun, Shane Krause, Darren Williams, Stanley Zappa, The Phobic Trust, Blocktreat, Rebecca Bruton, Peter Stevenson, Alexandra Spence, Poet-in-Residence Donato Mancini, and so many more. Like last year, we are relying on donations and sponsorships as well as ticket sales to cover the expenses related to such an undertaking, most of which are artists’ fees. Again, the budget has increased a great deal to reflect the increase in artists’ travel costs, since we are bringing so many from so far afield.

Like last year, sponsors like The Exploration Place have been immensely generous and supportive; the festival’s budget is very lean and carefully planned; and almost all of our costs are artists’ fees, and yet the artists almost all shoulder a share of their own costs to perform here because they simply care that much. We need your help in welcoming them as warmly, and supporting them as thoroughly as we can.

The producer

I’m Jeremy Stewart, Casse-Tête’s Festival Producer. I’m an arts professional as well as an artist, with over 15 years of experience producing concerts, as well as working for years in the non-profit sector, including work for Theatre North West, Island Mountain Arts (where I was ArtsWells Festival Coordinator), and the Community Development Institute. I created Casse-Tête because I wanted to share the music I love with my community, and because I wanted to share my community with the music I love. I also like to play the guitar and write poems. I grew up right here in Prince George and I love to see the city flourish.

How we will thank our supporters

The incentives to donate consist of some very special, top-quality handmade commemorative and documentary items, along with utterly unique physical artifacts of the triumph of last year’s Piano Drop.

Everyone who donates will be recognized in the program. You deserved to be recognized as contributors to the good of this community.

Depending on the level of your contribution, you can receive everything from an exclusive, hand-bound chapbook by the Casse-Tête Poet Laureate inspired by the festival, to an exclusive CD library of recordings of festival performances; to an exclusive commemorative photo book. Each of these items will be produced by artists with the greatest care and be of high quality. Your generosity really, really matters to us, and we want you to know it!

We also have options for interested businesses inclined to support Prince George’s development in this way; these are sponsorships, and thus the associated benefits are promotional in nature.

Help us make a great city even better

Let me ask you this: what kind of city do we want to have? What kind of dreams do we want to dream here, and do we think they can come true or don’t we? It’s not just about the future; it’s about the present. Supporting Casse-Tête is something you can do right now to help make Prince George the place we’re dreaming of. Of course, this is also an investment in the city’s future, giving our community access to art that is otherwise not available here, whether that’s the incredible visiting artists coming from all over Canada and beyond, or our own, brilliant local talent who otherwise would not have access to this kind of showcase. Casse-Tête brings Prince George to the world, and it brings the world to Prince George in a fresh, beautiful way.

If you can't afford to donate, I understand! I thank you in advance, however, for sharing this campaign as widely as possible, and of course, do pick up your festival pass or evening performance tickets  from Books & Company, available now, or order your pass from www.cassetetefestival.com.

story:
Three friends got together years ago to sing sinister nursery rhymes and play tiny instruments, eventually growing into a six piece writing and improvising our own tunes. We're finally putting together an EP of original songs you might like. If you've had the chance to hear us live, this will be better than that. Having put a fair amount of thought and effort into Igor Dean, we hope to share some of the labor of our odd fruits. So please consider helping us cover the costs of production – professional recording, mixing, and mastering, on the cheap. Consider getting us back for that beer we bought you that one time. Yes you. And thanks.

*PLEASE NOTE* Due to unforeseen costs we are now aiming for $800 rather than $660. These include an extra mixing fee, printing, postage and the percentage indiegogo keeps. Therefore, if we've met our $660 goal and you'd still like to donate, that would be enormously appreciated. Thanks again!

story:
Hello all you music lovers out there! 

I am Andrew Ulle - some of you know me as one of the organizers of the East Shore Park Club's  Summer Concert Series in the beautiful North Collinwood neighborhood of Cleveland, Ohio. 

RED ALERT:  The COVID-19 pandemic has forced the closure of so many of our sponsors' businesses that we have lost the largest segment of our basic operational funding. 

For over 15 years now, the ESPC has presented FREE summer concerts to residents, their friends, and visitors from all over northeast Ohio.  Our annual concert series predates Summer at Sims, Euclid Beach & Edgewater Live, The Grove, and Mentor Rocks - all of which are great venues.  The difference is that all these other concert series receive government funding and financial support from very large corporations.  The East Shore Park Club does not have such deep-pocketed benefactors.  But we have always been able to fund the concerts through the generous support of local small businesses and individual donations from club members and concert-goers.  And we believe we have delivered the most bang for the buck on a shoestring budget.  Please visit our Facebook pages to see photos of past shows of recent years featuring local act as well as bands and musicians from Pittsburgh, Buffalo, Austin, Ann Arbor, Grand Rapids, and Montreal.  This year we have a Rockabilly group coming from Switzerland!

http://www.facebook.com/ESPCmusic/

https://www.facebook.com/eastshore/

For the 2020 concert series, the ESPC has booked nine concerts for the summer.  The total budget for these events is over $11,000 just to pay the musicians, sound crew, and printing costs - no club members are paid for their many hours of work. 

We are hoping that by our first concert on June 4th, Clevelanders will finally be allowed to gather for outdoor events, but we cannot wait until then to raise funds - the printing of banners, flyers, and programs must be initiated by May 15, so we need cash in hand by then to place those orders and guarantee funds are available to pay our contracted expenses.

By contributing generously to this fundraiser, you can help us bring great music to a quarantine-weary population, one that will be severely in need of these popular FREE events.  You will also be helping many musicians and production techs whose incomes have been lost due to all venues being closed for 8 weeks or more.  And of course, you will have our undying gratitude for enabling us to go forward with the ESPC 2020 concert season.

story:
Short Summary

New York Chamber Musicians is a non-profit organization dedicated to offering the very best of classical, contemporary, and world chamber music in intimate settings performed by world class chamber musicians. What makes NYCM different from other concert series’ is our goal of honoring compassionate organizations that are dedicated to easing the suffering of children. NYCM and its artists are committed to help.

NYCM’s programs are designed to provide a wide-range of repertoire, offering both classic masterpieces as well as contemporary compositions. NYCM brings today’s American composers to the forefront, inviting them to discuss their works in our concerts and allowing our audiences to gain insight and perspective on these new masterpieces.

Gilbert Kalish, Philip Setzer, and Alan Kay, all world renowned musicians, are our invited featured performers for the inaugural season. They are amongst the apex of the chamber music world and we appreciate their artistic contribution. Appearing along with these legendary giants are our resident artists who represent the best of a new generation of chamber musicians, all extremely accomplished in their own right.

Be sure to visit our website for a message from our Artistic Director, details about our upcoming concerts, artists, and more: http://nychambermusicians.com

What We Need & What You Get

Frankly, putting on concerts takes money. We are looking to raise $20,000 from this campaign to help.

While ticket sales will ultimately cover our costs, we do need to pay numerous upfront expenses prior to each concert such as the venue and seating, printing the programs, ticket sales promotions, etc. All these items do add up. Every dollar we receive will help to defray these expenses.

In return, first of all, you get our undying gratitude. We will always appreciate the help you give us.

Secondly, we will recognize you as a Founding Sponsor in this year's concert programs.

And of course, we are happy to provide the “perks” listed to the right for your contribution.

Special thanks to Sheila Silver for donating her music and her time to help us.

Our concerts this season are scheduled for October 27, December 15, April 6, and May 11.  Visit our website at nychambermusicians.com for details.

Can’t make a complimentary concert this season? Don’t worry about it... as a Founding Sponsor we will make sure to accommodate your needs with a regular season performance next year. Or let us know, and we will dedicate your ticket to a promising chamber music student.

The regular ticket price to our concerts is $120 per seat.

We encourage you to donate via Paypal if you can!  Your donation is provided to us in a more timely fashion this way.  But of course any donation in any manner is greatly appreciated.

Rather contribute by check?  Our mailing address is: New York Chamber Musicians, Inc., PO Box 263, Paoli, PA 19301-0263

Note: NYCM is a non-profit organization that has applied for 501(c)(3) tax-exempt status from the IRS. While exempt status is not assured until formal notice is received from the IRS, we do anticipate receiving such approval. We have been advised that if and when exempt status is awarded us all contributions to NYCM since our inception will be tax deductible to the contributor (subject to the usual limitations). We encourage you to contact your own tax adviser in this regard.

Our application for 501(c)(3) tax-exempt status is available for examination upon request.

Founding Sponsor - Symphony Perk Details

$10,000 - Eight complimentary tickets to your choice of any of our inaugural season concerts. In addition, Sheila Silver, one of our featured composers, is currently working on a Songbook, Beauty Intolerable, based on the poetry of Edna St. Vincent Millay.  This collection of 15-18 songs will be premiered in May by soprano Christine Goerke and mezzo-soprano, Deanne Meek.  For $10,000 one may choose a poem from Millay's works, in consultation with the composer, and the finished composition of that chosen poem, which will be part of the total collection, will bear a dedication to whomever the patron wishes.  The patron will also receive two tickets to the premiere of Beauty Intolerable.

$12,000 - Eight complimentary tickets to your choice of any of our inaugural season concerts. In addition, Sheila Silver, one of our featured composers, will be commissioned to compose a 5-7 minute piece for a small chamber ensemble, that will bear a dedication to whomever the patron wishes. It will be performed and recorded at a future NYCM concert (which the patron will receive an additional two tickets to attend).  The piece will be based on music that Sheila will be composing for her new opera, A Thousand Splendid Suns, from the internationally best-selling novel by Khaled Hosseini. 

The Impact

Your contributions will help us create and sustain a music series that delivers only excellence, allowing us to present and promote the best of chamber music.

Perhaps more importantly, your contributions will allow us to honor compassionate organizations serving the needs of children, raising awareness of their goals and needs, especially in these days of difficult economic times.

If we meet our targets this first year we anticipate driving donations of more than $100,000 to these charities. That's a fivefold increase from this campaign's goal.

Other Ways You Can Help

You may not be able to support us financially, but this doesn't mean you can't help. Please spread the word by sharing our campaign on your Facebook page or twitter feed or via any other social media or even by sending an email to friends of yours who might be interested and able to contribute.

Also, you can use the Indiegogo share tools to share the campaign with more people.

Thank you very much!
