story:
Our Story

CRTVTR is a band of the European DIY network. We come from Genoa. During these years we have travelled through our country and our continent including countries like Czech Republic, England, France, Germany, Slovakia, Spain and Norway. Then suddenly we started thinking about China.

In our resume we have an EP called “We need time” featuring Mike Watt (Minuteman) on vocals in the title-track. We also did a split with Common Deflection Problems  called "Never Use Records As Fris-bees". You can listen to our first brand-new LP on www.crtvtrgotochina.com, featuring Mike Watt on vocals and bass. The record is called "Here it comes, Tramontane!" and will be available after our return from our tour in China.

China is not nearby. We can’t get there with our van, that by the way is named Flauto, and when you do get there it would be worth to come back with something more than just a great personal experience. That’s why we decided to film a documentary of our trip possibly with the best means possible to accomplish this.

It’s not going to be a documentary about us as much as about the DIY scene in China from our point of view and about our experiences. A way to shine new light on things and inspire reflection through an open dialogue.  Also a way to show how we relate to our environment as well as how our Chinese friends relate to theirs. 

What We Need & What You Get

This project is meant to widen the production of our documentary and its distribution. Basically it’s possible to support our project by buying a copy of our documentary ahead of time or several copies if you intend to distribute it.

Hopefully this will supply us with cash we will need to travel through the stages of our tour and to improve the production of the documentary.

For us it will be a challenge and we would like to share it with all the individuals or crews who are interested in the concept of self-production and in the world of underground music and documentaries. Also with anyone who is interested in  getting a first hand inside look into the culture of the Chinese new generations and into the world of Chinese contemporary underground music.

The Impact

Alone we are not worth much: a video, some pictures and something to tell our grandchildren, things that are limited to the private life. Together we can do something more, we can open a line of communication between the European underground scene and the Chinese: the world’s most populous country.

If you think you might buy our cd someday, do it now and you will help with our trip.

If you think you might be interested in our documentary or in distributing it, help us now with the resources we need to film it and elaborate it.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you think that this project is worth your support share this letter on your social networks, blogs, newsletters, mailing lists and tell your friends.

We now have a website on this project: www.crtvtrgotochina.com. Follow us on the Blog and post your messages on the site.

There is a space for groups or individuals that might be interested in supporting our project and if you have any ideas on how to help us please let us know and help in our quest!

Important advise: you can donate via Paypal or via credit card. if you have a Paypal account, donate via Paypal: it is easier and more direct :)

story:
What?

Since early 2011, I have had it in my head that I wanted to make a concept album based on the works of H. P. Lovecraft. After some initial sessions in the Spring of 2011, I had a solid concept for an album entitled "Strange Aeons", but the music had not gestated quite long enough to mature, and my ideal packaging based on my concept was financially unsound even with help. In keeping with the storyline I developed, I wanted to include the album in an old fashioned journal, complete with handwritten entries from a character who is slowly losing his mind. I shelved the project in June of 2011, disappointed but knowing it was the right thing to do at the time.

In August of 2012, I completed and released another record, and knew as I finished that Strange Aeons would have to be the next project on my docket. I'm finally rounding the corner, and with some assistance I have figured out a plan to handmake every single package and handwrite every word in the 12-page liner notes/journal.

Why?

The catch of course is that art supplies are not cheap. Each copy consists of faux leather, suede lining, suede rope, thick canvas paper, book binding glue, a cd sleeve, and a professionally replicated cd. This is disregarding things like thread, ink, and above all, time. The funding for this will partially pay for the supplies to make this album as I've seen it in my head a reality; I'm actually taking a financial hit even with the goal in mind, multiple times over with time considered.

If this project surpasses the goal, it will fund further supplies for any paid for copies and online promotion of the digital copy of the album.

Note: If demand is overwhelming, delivery dates may slip by 2-3 weeks. 

What again?

Strange Aeons is a ten-song concept album that takes place within the world of H. P. Lovecraft's fiction. The storyline is new, but is inspired by and directly affected by several characters and stories from within Lovecraft's mythos. The sound is primarily electronic, but there are plenty of "acoustic" (meaning non-electronic) elements as well. The genre ranges from Industrial Rock to Pop.

To hear samples of older material by The Difference Engine, please visit Bandcamp. Tracks from Strange Aeons will be surfacing online in the not-too-distant future and will be announced here. The release of the album is slated for August 17, 2013.

Shipping costs are included for lower 48 states. For Alaska and Hawaii, add an additional $10 to the prices. Sorry, no international shipping.

story:
Hey kind friends,

We are The Neckbeard Boys, a San Francisco based bluegrass group. Like Dylan said, we want to make our first full length album. We have six members: Dylan, Thom, Karuna, Aaron, Evan and Tim. As you may know, the music industry is changing, and because so much music is accessible on the internet, large record labels are becoming a thing of the past. These days money is all in live performances, but the question is "How the heck can a band afford to make a record?!?" San Francisco has branded a new sound of bluegrass that is emerging and shaping the live music scene. Maybe people are fed up with the droning beat of a computer and are looking for that irreplaceable organic sound of wood and steel? Who knows, but ya'll-ternative is NOT dead. In fact, quite the opposite. 

The Neckbeard Boys have been together for just over three years. We've played venues all over the city including the corner of Haight and Ashbury, Amnesia, The Rickshaw Stop, The Boom Boom Room, Brick and Mortar Music Hall, and much more. Now it's time for us to record an album. 

Our songs are dialed, and we want to share them with you, our fans, and the world. We want to bring you the best quality recording we can. We've locked down the time and place and have reserved the best producers and engineers...we just want to make sure we're not writing checks we can't cash.

Why donate? Well in addition to becoming a part of The Neckbeard Family we have a bunch of awesome incetives. The perks have been carefully chosen by the boys, and are made up of limited Neckbeard Boys merchandise that shows our love for you all. They are great for gifts, or just for you. 

Your funding will help us pay for studio time, recording engineers, and post-production. The band will be traveling to New Orleans to make the album to ensure that we get the most authentic sound. Our sound engineers are talented at capturing the beauty and warmth of stringed instruments, a skill that is harder to come by these days. More than this, your money will help a local group continue to make music that moves you and will also help keep west coast bluegrass alive and well.

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Ask friends and family to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign
  • Use social media to share this link!

Thank you for your time! We love each and every one of you and can't wait to see you at the next show.

-The Neckbeard Boys


*Please add $5 to your donation for shipping items inside the US - and note perks may not be shipped until summer 2014

Use social media to share this link!


Thank you for your time! We love each and every one of you and can't wait to see you at the next show.
-The Neckbeard Boys

*Please add $5 to your donation for shipping items inside the US - and note perks may not be shipped until summer 2014

story:
Short Summary

We are Black & Broke, an underground Alternative Hip-Hop band from Cleveland, OH. We are trying to raise enough money to get back into the studio to record our first full length album. We have been writing new material for the last 18 months or so and have an amazing collection of about 14 songs that we think the world NEEDS to hear. But we only want to do it if we can do it the right way. That means getting the proper funding.

What We Need & What You Get

We are going to need about $6500 which roughly breaks down to this:

  • $3500 for tracking, mixing, and mastering
  • $2300 for duplication and packaging
  • $700 for perks and shipping,
If we don't end up reaching our entire goal, whatever money we do raise will go toward the tracking, mixing, and mastering of the album.

For those generous enough to donate to our campaign, we've got some awesome perks for you. Digital downloads, stickers, posters, physical albums, and a 3 course dinner for up to four people.

The Impact

We have been growing so much as songwriters and musicians over the last 10 years. We think that this collection of songs will showcase the growth and we are extremely excited to be able to bring them to you.
As with our previous releases you will be able to expect high quality, fun music, and hot jams for the people to dance to.

Other Ways You Can Help

While we would be eternally thankful if you decide to donate, we understand that money might very well be as tight for you as it is for us.  If that is the case, we kindly ask that you help us get the word out - share with your email contact list, Facebook, Twitter, Linkedin, Blogger, Tumblr, etc. 

Any and all exposure received will undoubtedly funnel more and more people to this page, eventually helping us attain our goal.

Thank you for whatever contribution you ultimately decide upon.  It means a lot.  Truly.

story:
*UPDATE*

Hard to believe we're talking about a 'stretch goal' already, but thanks to you, we are! 

If you know anything about the music business, you know that $5,000 is a pretty 'economical' budget for an album release. If we receive any contributions above that total, we'll put it into promoting the release once it's finished. PR and Radio campaigns have everything to do with how successful a CD is . You can have a great product, but if no one hears it, it's like yelling in the forest. Not much point. So, if you contribute above and beyond what we've asked for, rest assured that that money will be used to further the album's reach. 

Thank you, again, to those of you who have so generously donated and have helped us spread the word. It's because of you that we're staring that finish line in the face, and may just surpass it. 

Who I Am

My name is Dara Tucker. I'm a jazz singer based in Nashville, TN. I'm working on my 3rd studio CD project, and this will be my most personal project to date. I have a stockpile of original songs that have never made their way to one of my albums -- until now. 

We'll be assembling some of of the country's finest musicians to bring life to these songs, and create a musical presentation that stimulates, inspires and reaches the heart. We might get down a little, too.

What We Need & What You Get

We're looking to raise at least $5,000 (more, if possible) to record the album. We'll handle the pressing, & the radio and publicity costs ourselves (unless you're feeling particularly generous). 

In return, we've set up a few perks for you.

The Impact

We're really interested in making a project that represents where we are creatively RIGHT NOW. We'll be incorporating 80% original music, with a couple of choice covers. This is really where jazz is going -- less reliance on the music of the past, and more dependence on your own creative voice -- and we have a lot to say. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you have a Facebook, a Twitter, Pinterest, Instagram, or whatever -- you can help us by spreading the word about this project. The more people that contribute -- even $5 -- the closer we'll be to meeting (or surpassing) our goal!

story:
C A B A L L O


I was nine years old when it all began. Caballo (horse) was the first Spanish word I was taught, going through my horse-girl phase that some may say I've never gotten out of. I attended an after school program in my elementary school that was to promote foreign language interest in children. I was instantly hooked with curiosity by worry dolls and the linguistic qualities. I continued my education and passion for Spanish for 15 years, now graduated from Columbia College Chicago with a BA in Photography and Minor in Latino/Hispanic Studies. However, I have yet to travel to a Spanish speaking country in the Souther Hemisphere to put what I have learned to use.

 This opportunity will support the knowledge that I cannot find in a book, teacher, or program. What I am looking for is the knowledge that can only be gained by living and encountering first hand experiences.

This will also be the first time I can properly combine what is most important to me: art, South America, women's sustainability.  Growth in women’s income, education levels, and labor participation rates make them essential participants in the global economy, and engagement with women and girls increasingly critical to sustainable growth for every industry.   Your support will help me achieve this living experience. The experience will be reflected by a few forms of art-making. This can then be shared to you and many many more on South American art, culture, history, and the struggle for women's sustainability.

 MAIN PHOTOGRAPHIC FOCUS: Documentary on women's sustainability in South America. Most of this will be researched out before my trip, where I will then visit these organizations and interview/photograph the working women there. A collection of photographs taken accompanied by text from interviews will be compiled into a book that can be later purchased or free if you contribute for that perk!  A great organization for example is: Manos del Uruguay (a non-profit social organization which, since 1968, has provided jobs for craftswomen living in Uruguay rural areas). Their objective of which is to generate work for rural women, allowing them to stay in their towns, earn their living and develop themselves as human beings. Accepted as a member of the World Fair Trade Organization (WFTO), Manos del Uruguay is 100% committed to Fair Trade. Their achivement acknowledges a mission of eradicating poverty through sustainable economic growth.
Manos del Uruguay is an organization made up of Cooperatives of craft manufacturing and a Service Center, and its the main objectives are:
    •    To generate and develop work sources for women in the interior of the country
    •    Provide economic, social and cultural opportunities to all its members.
    •    Value handicrafts and the work of artisans. 
         (source:http://www.manos.com.uy/sobreManos/quienessomos...)
 
Manos del Uruguay is run by a Managing Committee made up of representatives of the Cooperatives.
 *PERK ALERT* - you can find some of their great yarns knitted into lovely scarves in the perk section!
 
SECONDARY ART FOCUS: Research, Research, Research! Currently I am working on more installation art and video performances that interpret the concepts from sun rituals performed by indigenous peoples of Peru in terms of summer/winter solstices. Documenting the landscape, sun behavior, and artifacts of the past from historic sites by photography will allow me to create more expansive mirror installations. These mirror installations are to be placed in spaces where there is variable sun, in an instance that a viewer can enjoy a design out of the sun's rays. The installation will be available as a limited perk to limited contributors. Also to be used for future submissions to Public Art in Chicago, Art Residencies, and selected Chicago Galleries.

How Will I Get There? Your Support!

There are three countries I will be visiting over the course of 30 days: Argentina, Chile, and Peru. This allows approximately 10 days per country. The breakdown of my funding need is as follows:


    1.    TRANSPORTATION - Bus fair from each major city to the next
                     (Buenos Aires-Santiago-Cuzco)
    2.    LODGING - Estimated nightly charge $50.00/camping is a cheaper option
                      in only more rural areas.
    3.    FILM! - I shoot with a medium format Bronica, that is 6x4.5 (allows me more 
                    frames per 120 roll. 15 shots opposed to 12) Kodak T-MAX 100 120 film
                    is $25.00 per pack of 5.  Leaves me only 75 images per pack, will need
                    tons more of that. I will also be shooting 35mm film, color and BW. Why
                    no digital? I can only use what resources I have available to me, film
                    cameras are all I have ever invested in. I simply believe in the discipline
                    of the photographic processes, not to mention you'll get a better perk in
                    the end!
    4.    FOOD - Since I will be nonstop traveling for a month, stocking up on food
                    when possible will be necessary, especially in some areas that may be
                    more remote than others.


There are a lot of unique and special perks that you can get through your support! All are art friendly and South American themed created by yours truly. Look to see what you can get from a variety of contributions from $6.00 to $500.00. All the way from Friendship bracelets  to a 5ft x 5ft art installation in your apartment/home!

If I unfortunately do not achieve my goal, the funds will primarily go to transportation/lodging. The biggest cut will have to be the film which means, less art for me AND you! </3



Why Should You Care?

We are all part of a world, living inside of some spectrum of humanity, where unfortunately that spectrum has been stretched too far from nothingness to totality. There is something to be valued in "the other". It may be easier to forget about this spectrum of humanity when you are living in the positive polar opposite, but impossible to forget when you are living under the negative polar opposite. This is why I care. I care because I have made the decision to live a life through differences to better enrich who I am as a person and to enrich others. I made this decision when I was 9 years old to learn a different language, to feel how it is to struggle to communicate. I made this decision when I was 18 years old to be a photographer, to feel how it is to struggle to communicate yet again, but visually. The feeling of experiencing what it is like to be outside of familiarity has opened my eyes to cultures, histories, art, and people that I would have otherwise been blind to.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute, but still want to help out, I understand! There is yet three other ways you can help me and I would be forever appreciative!

    1.    SPREAD THE WORD! Tell all your friends, family, coworkers, artists, Spanish classmates-teachers, everyone and anyone!

    2.    Have any MIRRORS, BROKEN? Big or Small? Even if they aren't broken just old and in the way, I'll gladly take them off your hands as a donation towards some installations upon my return!

    3.    HAVE YOU TURNED DIGITAL? Have any old darkroom equipment? Have any old film laying around? Even if it's expired I'll gladly use that for you! No reason in letting old film go to waste, contact me and I can give you the address to send it to!

*All mirror/photograhic donors can expect a life-long friendship bracelet and thank you post card! 

 


gracias por su tiempo y consideración / thank you for your time and consideration

story:
As seen at: 

Artshound.com      Zvents.com        Chron.com                      

Houston.CultureMap.com

    


This campaign is about creating a model and format that will enlarge our classical music concerts!  We want to create the transformative experience we often associate with theater, using outstanding music for woodwind quintet as the focus with staging, lighting, props and poetry.  It is about creating a performance experience that draws you in and is relevant and interesting in today's world. 


What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking funding to launch our Elemental Forces concert series.  The five concerts in this series will each explore a physical element through music and other art forms.  These concerts will be fully integrated multi-media, multi-genre experiences.  

To do this we will need:

         a professional theater 

         technical equipment  

         theatrical lighting

         a lighting designer

        back stage crew

        a poet

        props -- these are going to be pretty fun!

        high powered video projector

        insurance (boring, but necessary!)

We hope you understand how grateful we will be for any help you can give.  We're preparing some nice perks for our donors (in the side bar), but think that the best perk isn't anything we can mail.  We hope you will be able to share the joy of music with us for years to come! 

As a 501(c)3 non-profit organization, any donation you make to Scirocco is tax deductible to the extent allowed by law.  You should be aware that the monatary value of any perks you receive are not tax deductible, but don't worry we'll work to keep those costs down!


Summary

Scirocco Winds is a professional wind quintet founded in 2008.  Individually we are highly trained musicians; we have performance credits with dozens of performing ensembles in the USA and internationally.  As a group we are dedicated to performing high quality music from all eras, but have a special interest in modern music by American composers.  We have sought opportunities to showcase new compositions for our ensemble and perform little known gems, as well as classic standard repertoire.  We have been proud to premier several works by local Texas composers and are awaiting the completion of a commissioned work this spring.  

Our programming is often interactive and includes other art forms.  We regularly design and perform programs for general audiences, elementary and secondary schools.  As guest performers at the National Flute Association convention in 2010, we were pleased to present a Latin American program which has become very popular with our audiences.  Our “Sound FX” educational program uses music from many eras and genres.  We introduce kids to the basic elements of music with skits, dance, staging and props.  Both students and teachers love the program.



The Impact

This campaign can have a huge impact on Scirocco Winds and our followers.  You will help Scirocco reach a new level of performance.  We have rehearsed, refined, honed and performed many times.  We know the wonder, awe, excitement, and power of a great performance.  We have a vision of a beautiful performance, but we need your help to bring that to you! 

We are confident that our new concert series will be "a hit", but we need an extra push to get started.   Just like a mustard seed, we have great potential here, but need proper water and sunshine to flourish. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We certainly hope you can help with a donation today, but there are other ways you can help us also.  Sharing our campaign with your friends would be a great help.  If you "like" us on Facebook you will get up to date info about what we're doing and how the campaign is going.  If you are in the Houston area and would like to volunteer some time, please email us at info@sciroccowinds.com, we can always use help with office work or at performances.

at performances.

story:
Short Summary

Soundwave is San Francisco’s acclaimed biennial of innovative sound, art and music. Every two years, Soundwave immerses the Bay Area in a summer-long, multi-venue and multi-date experiential event series all over San Francisco. 

Soundwave is produced by MEDIATE Art Group is a 501(c)(3) non-profit arts organization that creates innovative art and music experiences through the activation of people, places and environments.

Working at the center of art and innovation, MEDIATE develops exhibitions and  live events that challenge perspectives and inspire unique experiences; present diverse artists to exchange ideas and collaborate; connect new and diverse audiences to experimental arts and visions; provide an innovative forum for progressive ideas to be seen, heard, and explored; and showcase emerging and established local and international artists to bring groundbreaking ideas and perspectives to the San Francisco Bay Area. Since its founding in 1998, MEDIATE has produced five seasons of the acclaimed Soundwave Biennial, which evolved into the largest and most-anticipated multidisciplinary sound art festival in the Bay Area. Over the years, Soundwave has exposed new, contemporary, and experimental work of more than 350 artists and has taken over 30,000 people on immersive sonic adventures in WWII bunkers, moving buses, churches, city streets & parks, and museums & galleries.


We need your help fund this current season of Soundwave and have this festival continue next season. It takes over 100 people's time, energy and creativity for the past 12 months to make Soundwave a reality, most of which volunteer or severely underpaid. We need to support these people that make it happen in order to continue to produce many more seasons of Soundwave.

What We Need & What You Get

We need a minimum of $10,000 to support the production of the festival, mainly the work of our artists, the festival staff as well as our year-round staff that help plan and produce each season. Perks for supporting us include discounts to tickets for the amazing Soundwave ((6)) Water; drink vouchers for use throughout the festival; all-access Festival Passes; Soundwave t-shirts, and more! If you become a "Soundwave for Life" donor, you get to go to all our events for forever!

The Impact

We want to continue to be able to showcase the incredible work of our artists and provide free and low-cost awe-inspiring experiences for all people to participate, engage, and enjoy. Your support will directly support artists in the creation and dissemination of new work and the dedicated people that help organize and manage this huge undertaking of a festival.

Thank you for helping to keep Soundwave alive and well!
story_txt:
Short SummarySoundwave is San Francisco’s acclaimed biennial of innovative sound, art
 and music. Every two years, Soundwave immerses the Bay Area in a summer-long, 
multi-venue and multi-date experiential event series all over San 
Francisco. Soundwave is produced by MEDIATE Art Group is a 501(c)(3) non-profit arts organization that creates innovative art and music experiences through the activation of people, places and environments. Working at the center of art and innovation, MEDIATE develops exhibitions and  live events that challenge perspectives and inspire unique experiences; present diverse artists to exchange ideas and collaborate; connect new and diverse audiences to experimental arts and visions; provide an innovative forum for progressive ideas to be seen, heard, and explored; and showcase emerging and established local and international artists to bring groundbreaking ideas and perspectives to the San Francisco Bay Area. Since its founding in 1998, MEDIATE has produced five seasons of the acclaimed Soundwave Biennial, which evolved into the largest and most-anticipated multidisciplinary sound art festival in the Bay Area. Over the years, Soundwave has exposed new, contemporary, and experimental work of more than 350 artists and has taken over 30,000 people on immersive sonic adventures in WWII bunkers, moving buses, churches, city streets & parks, and museums & galleries.We need your help fund this current season of Soundwave and have this festival continue next season. It takes over 100 people's time, energy and creativity for the past 12 months to make Soundwave a reality, most of which volunteer or severely underpaid. We need to support these people that make it happen in order to continue to produce many more seasons of Soundwave.What We Need & What You GetWe need a minimum of $10,000 to support the production of the festival, mainly the work of our artists, the festival staff as well as our year-round staff that help plan and produce each season. Perks for supporting us include discounts to tickets for the amazing Soundwave ((6)) Water; drink vouchers for use throughout the festival; all-access Festival Passes; Soundwave t-shirts, and more! If you become a "Soundwave for Life" donor, you get to go to all our events for forever! The ImpactWe want to continue to be able to showcase the incredible work of our artists and provide free and low-cost awe-inspiring experiences for all people to participate, engage, and enjoy. Your support will directly support artists in the creation and dissemination of new work and the dedicated people that help organize and manage this huge undertaking of a festival.Thank you for helping to keep Soundwave alive and well!

story: All six of us have spent hours working towards our dream of being in a professional band. This moment will be one we will never forget, one that will make our dream a reality. While in California we will be playing in a private studio for a certain amount of record labels, then on May 17th we will be having our showcase with Skid Row! Which will also be played in front of those same record labels. We couldn't be any more thankful for all our fans, friends, and family. So we came up with some pretty nice perks for you all, thanks guys!!

story:
Short Summary

We live in a city full of talent. Whether it be music, business management, makeup, or film, we have some talented people in the city of Chicago and all we need is that one chance to show what we can do. I have gathered the best people I can find and now we just need your help to make our dreams a reality. Can you help us make our dreams tangible? 


Hello my name is Charles H Wonsey and I am a recent film graduate and a Navy veteran.I have been apart of various shoots. I was also an intern for WWE NXT. I have produced 1 short film and Co- Produced another. You can find the trailers for both films by clinking the links.  Escape Genesis https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WHSl_yX5FjU

Colt Love https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lHCcnAMeVuY&feature=youtu.be

Producing is a very tedious job but I don't mind doing it because its fun and I love what all goes into it.

The campaign itself is a big one. We want to shoot a professionally made video for the new song by HottCelleb called Splurge featuring Matti Baybee. The song is great and now I want to have the chance to put visuals to it.

This project is important to me because I want to be a producer. Whether is for film, TV, or music is all up for grabs. I want to bring together the best crew and talent to make this something that we all can be proud of to help us all move up on the ladder to be one prong closer to achieving something great. I believe my time and effort is worth it for this project. I loose sleep over it. This is important to not just me but everyone involved. 


All of you who contribute will help us reach a new height in our careers. You will also be apart of our failures and apart of our successes. You will ultimately help us have the money for great equipment, locations, and the people that we need in the video. Mostly everybody on this project is working for free and they will work hard as if they are getting paid and as the producer I want to pay them for their hard work and effort that they put into this. Your donations will help us exponentially.   


A little Bit about HottCelleb


Christopher Brock also known as HottCelleb is 22 years of age. HottCelleb was born and raised on the south side of Chicago. HottCelleb has been doing music since the age of 10. Smokey Robinson, Bow Wow, Fabulous, and Kid Ink is people that have inspired him over the years. HottCelleb's goal is to rise to the level of super star and not settle for being mediocre in the rap game.


A little bit about HottCellebs Manager Peter Brock 

Peter Brock is  25 years of age. He was born and raised on the South Side of Chicago. Peter is married and has a one year old Son. He's  been managing HottCelleb  for 2 years now. His main goal is to make sure his brother reaches super star status as a artist.


What We Need & What You Get

Putting together a budget for a project is time consuming. Especially when you realize after you are done how much said project cost compared to not having those funds. The funds you donate will go towards feeding the crew. ( We do need to eat) Buying Camera equipment and support equipment for the camera. Camera lenses . Lighting always makes a video stand out so we need that too. insurance for the equipment and for the production if possible. ( in case someone gets hurt. ) I would also like to get this on Television. BET, Revolt, MTVU, just to name a few and it cost to submit to these stations.

The song is about Splurging so we have to have things in the video that people would Splurge on.  So we need car rentals. we want to rent some exotic cars either the Lamborghini Spyder or the Porsche Boxster. and possible rent other designer items that people would want to splurge on if they had the money. 


The talent that we want to use in the video charge some steep fees but we need them for the video to be successful. 


We have some awesome perks that include signed posters, custom HottCelleb shirts, tickets to his mix-tape release party ( if you are in the Chicago area) Also you could have a chance to meet HottCelleb and Matti Baybee on the set of the music video. we also have other perks as well that are worth the donation.

If we don't reach our goal of 4500 then what ever is raised will go to the sole production of the video. I'd be unable to pay the crew. and they do have families to feed. We will do the best we can with what you give us if we don't reach our goal.

The Impact

This project is a valuable piece of work and you will be apart of our team. Its important that this video is made to the best that it can be so when the world views it ( and when you view it as someone that contributed to its making) you can say that was an awesome video and I helped make the video possible for a team of talented individuals. If this is done well enough we want to get it on TV. But for that the quality has to be tv worthy. You would be helping us do that. 

For the film I produced i was able to raise 300 dollars to put towards the making of it. The film I co-produced we raised 3600 dollars. We put all those funds to good use.

Sometimes the impossible can be done if you just believe that anything is possible. I believe that this Music Video will be great. I believe that it will take us to a new level. Now I need you to believe so I don't have to let people down. I'll put all my effort into this. We need and want this. So with your help the word impossible is no longer needed because you made this possible for us.

Other Ways You Can Help


Other ways you can help if you can't contribute is tell your friends. share our campaign on your social Media sights. Create a Buzz for us. Tell strangers on your block. If you have contacts that would be interested in something like this let them know what we are trying to accomplish. 

Don't forget to use the Share tools found on this website. I'm counting on you to Help us. You see this face. Its my daughter. and I want her to be proud of me. ( sniffling) Don't say no to this face.

story:
This is our dream.

This is all we've ever known and all we've ever wanted to do. You can hear the passion behind the music we make. You can feel it in our lyrics and melodies.

What we're heading to record is the best music we've made yet. And we are eager to get it out to you. Our mission is to make people feel something. To feel connection. To feel emotion. To feel like moving. 

With your help we will be able to work with some of the best producers and engineers in the music capital of the world. We will release our first single in June 2019, followed by giving you a new single every 30-60 days thereafter. We will distribute our music on every streaming platform. Our music will be heard. Your contribution guarantees this.

We need $17,200.

For:

$1000 equipment rental

$1000 horns & strings (studio musicians)

$8000 recording

$5000 mixing

$1300 mastering

$900 distribution

***If you wish to provide an interest-free loan WE ARE INTERESTED TOO (email liptruce@gmail.com)***

There is value in the arts.

We need good music. It is what connects us. LIPTRUCE means:

"To come together with LOVE in a time of torment and war"

the SIR band made a great record. That one was for us. LIPTRUCE is for you. This time we put all of our energy into making music with the thought "Let's make music that our fans will want to listen to forever". And it was a challenge. It was exciting. We grew as songwriters. 

We gained over 4,000 new listeners and followers releasing the album "So Cold". We expect to quadruple that number with the new music we're creating.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Get the word out! Make some noise about LIPTRUCE. Share this campaign and our other music videos!
  • Follow LIPTRUCE on instagram, youtube, twitter, facebook, soundcloud and spotify

WHAT YOU GET WHEN YOU CONTRIBUTE:

$5000 - A house concert, an online shoutout and live video performance, a copy of the album, a permanent guest list spot at every LIPTRUCE show for 1 whole year, and a song written just for you

$2500 - An online shoutout and live video, a house concert, a copy of the album, and a song written just for you

$1000 - A copy of the album, a song written just for you and an online shoutout

$500 - An online shoutout and a copy of the album

story:
Hello there.

I'm Laura Tsaggaris (sah-GAIR-iss), and I'm a guitarist, singer and touring songwriter based out of Washington, D.C.  I have independently released two full-length records, completed two U.S. tours, garnered equipment sponsorships and played with lots of great musicians over the past 10 years.  More recently, I've written and begun recording my latest album, to be titled Everyman.

I've put in a lot of money and elbow grease to get to this point, and I can't wait for you to hear the results! As an independent artist, however, I don't have a record label or financial backer fronting me the money I need to finish up this album and get it to you.  So, I’m here to ask for some help! 

You may not know this, but records cost a lot of money to make.  Mixing and mastering are essential steps to getting an album ready to be played on anything from Pandora to commercial radio, and they come at a high price.  Add to that manufacturing a physical product, and you've got a hefty bill to pay.  This could be incredibly overwhelming if I really thought about it...  but, I'd rather not.  I'm just going to make the art and work to raise some money!

To that end, I've come up with some pretty fun packages to offer in return for your generous contributions to make Everyman a reality.  I've set my 30-day goal here at $10,000.  This would give me the final push to get everything mixed, mastered and packaged up for you to hear.  Along with being totally appreciated and awesome, anything more would help me be able to afford any extra musicans the project might need (think pedal steel guitar or horns), get a few professional videos done and hire a radio promoter to spread the word about this album.

You might have a couple of questions at this point...  so, here are some answers!

Can you tell me a little bit about Everyman to help me decide whether I should  support it?
Sure!  So, this is an exciting project for me.  I’ll be heading to Los Angeles for the month of May to team up with a producer who has worked with Ryan Adams, REM, Luscious Jackson, Ed Kowalczyk (of Live) and many others.  Last month, I flew out to meet with him (www.jamiecandiloro.com) and see if we'd be a good fit to work together.  Turns out we are!  We got a ton of work done in a few days, and I found that getting out of my comfort zone here in D.C. really allowed me to focus on a few songs that needed some finishing touches.  It's been great to have a different perspective on my new work, which strikes a balance between the simpler elements of my first album, Proof, and the more complex structures of my last release, Keep Talking.  The focus will really be on my voice and acoustic guitar playing with this one, so, I'll be getting back to my roots a bit! 
I think Everyman will really connect with a lot of you.  It's a broader art project that places a magnifying glass on the paradox of human existence and the questions it presents — the everyday, seemingly ordinary struggles to conquer fear, insecurity, frustration, judgment and loss through the very human, yet extraordinary, engines of courage, confidence, perseverance, empathy and love.  No matter our sex, gender, race, sexual orientation, socioeconomic status or profession, we are all Everyman.

What is the timing? When will I get my CD??? 
All recording will be done at the end of May.  Having to account for mixing, mastering, and manufacturing, the finished product should be to you by September 1st.  I will keep you updated on this timeline!

What is this about tax deductible donations?
I'm thrilled that this project has been sponsored by Fractured Atlas, a 501(c)(3) national non-profit artist service organization.  This means that A PORTION OF YOUR CONTRIBUTION IS ELIGIBLE FOR TAX DEDUCTION!  You automatically receive a receipt upon contributing that can be submitted with your tax return.

If you have any questions about the campaign, including how to maximize your tax-deductible portion, please contact me at laura@lauratsaggaris.com and I'll be happy to provide answers!

I am really excited to have Fractured Atlas' support and I can't wait to get this album to you.  I am incredibly grateful to you for supporting my music to this point and helping me bring this album to life.  Thank you all for being a part of Everyman.

Laura

story:
Aloha friends,

my name is Bettina Maureenji and I am so happy to be starting this campaign. It is a real inspiration for my friend Nick Barber and my self to invite you all to support the production of a new Music Album. Some of you might know the album "Lullabies for the Soul" which we created together in 2011. So here we are years later diving into a birthing of the new production called 'JOURNEY BEYOND'. Please visit my website www.bettinamaureenji.com to learn more about my work and music. Or follow me on youtube.

Here is a little information about amazing Nick Barber https://nickbarbermusic.uk/about. He also created the sound track of the wonderful documentary TAWAI produced by my friend Bruce Parry https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4ZJEMYjsPqI. Also here you can see Nick playing for Ram Dass https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=S1Cfy45upfA

The music that continues to come forth is always an expression of what is happening and evolving within and seen without. In this times on the planet I feel it is utterly important to find a place of peace, balance and stillness within. Yet the willingness to open, to be free and contribute to live for the well being of all is strongly present as well. 

This new music is again midwifing us into different states of consciousness or vibration that is ever present and wants to be explored. I do know that these songs can open realms into the unknown and the unseen where transformation can happen.

You will contribute to something that is contributing to raising awareness within which will effect the evolution of consciousness of the collective. This is my passion in this life time. Your support of the production will help Nick and my self to express love through vibration and to spread it around the globe.

We do not need a lot of funding yet some basic production costs need to be covered. Nick and I do not count in the time for composing, rehearsing, the time in the studio or the time of life we devoted through music. Here is what we need to cover:

- costs for production/ mastering CD

- costs for graphic design/ photos CD cover

- costs for print CD

- costs for marketing/ promotion

We have created all kinds of wonderful perks for you to receive for your donation. 

We feel that music is magic and magic is what we all need to remember how precious life is. We wish you will enjoy The Journey Beyond bathing in love and beauty while surrendering into the unknown.

Even if you can not donate monetary, you can always donate a loving thought towards this production or share the campaign so others can donate.

Thank you so much for being part of this.

Bettina Maureenji & Nick Barber

In this times on the planet I feel it is utterly important to find a place of peace, balance and stillness within. Yet the willingness to open, to be free and contribute to live for the well being of all is strongly present as well. 
This new music is again midwifing us into different states of consciousness or vibration that is ever present and wants to be explored. I do know that these songs can open realms into the unknown and the unseen where transformation can happen.
You will contribute to something that is contributing to raising awareness within which will effect the evolution of consciousness of the collective. This is my passion in this life time. Your support of the production will help Nick and my self to express love through vibration and to spread it around the globe.
We do not need a lot of funding yet some basic production costs need to be covered. Nick and I do not count in the time for composing, rehearsing, the time in the studio or the time of life we devoted through music. Here is what we need to cover:
- costs for production/ mastering CD
- costs for graphic design/ photos CD cover
- costs for print CD
- costs for marketing/ promotion
We have created all kinds of wonderful perks for you to receive for your donation. 
We feel that music is magic and magic is what we all need to remember how precious life is. We wish you will enjoy The Journey Beyond bathing in love and beauty while surrendering into the unknown.
Even if you can not donate monetary, you can always donate a loving thought towards this production or share the campaign so others can donate.
Thank you so much for being part of this.
Bettina Maureenji & Nick Barber

story:
Overview

The Logan Quintet is proud to announce our long-anticipated Christmas Album! The Quintet has a full track listing of original arrangements, but we need your help to secure the funding for recording costs. Please help us to bring these inspiring new arrangements into homes everywhere by making a contribution today!

The Story of the Logan Quintet

Quintet members Brynn Vance (violin), McKenzie Clawson (violin), Rebecca Ostermiller (violin), Ryn Haubner-Sheridan (viola), Stephen Mitton (cellist/arranger), and Sara Mitton (piano), first met in Logan, Utah while pursuing performance degrees at Utah State University. Over the next couple of years, Stephen began writing a host of arrangements to play with his wife, Sara, in church and in their home on Sunday evenings. It wasn't long before they began including their old friends in that tradition, and the Logan Quintet was born.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $1,000 to go toward covering studio costs for recording, mixing, and mastering. We also need funds for the creation and duplication of CDs for distribution.

Our donors will receive excellent perks, including digital sheet music downloads, signed CDs, and much more. We want to show you how much your support means to us!

The Impact

Good music has the power to build faith and provide inspiration for our lives, especially during difficult times. Playing and listening to these arrangements brings a beautiful spirit, and for that reason we want to share them with the world. With your help, we can achieve the recording quality that they truly deserve, and bring them to as many people as possible.

Please help us spread the word about this project! Even if you are only able to contribute a very small amount, sharing this project with even a few people will ensure that we reach our goal. Everyone knows a music-lover. Send the link to this project to the music-lovers in your life!

story:
Short Summary

We, The Bemsha Swing, are a beat combo from Auckland, New Zealand.
Our days and nights are spent in dedication, in meditation, searching for the One Beat
that will bring truth and beauty together in a steaming, furious collision; we pray daily we never find it.
We hunt for freedom in feedback, drenching crass cut illumination in a wail of dripping, white hot noise.
We plow the fertile fields of the Anti-Bop; straight eight rhythms machine drummed 'til they are machine gunned into the great subconscious.
Our tools sit in direct opposition to the Beats and Boppers quarter of a century past; our aims remain apposite.
Enlightenment//Freedom//Expression
Help us drag these ideals kicking and squealing into the light they themselves bring.
Let them become superterranean.

What We Need & What You Get

We're looking to raise the scratch to cover the cost of mastering and pressing our album "Against Friends and Lovers".

We have a number of donation based rewards:

  • Everyone who donates will be emailed their own Bemsha 2012 wristband.
  • Everyone who donates $5 or more will be thanked on an insert included with every single copy of the album
  • A limited number of donators will receive a 7" record, check perks for details
  • Everyone who donates $25 or more will receive a copy of the album with a personalised, signed thank you note
  • Everyone who donates $60 or more will receive the above plus a limited edition t shirt which will only be given to these individuals.This design will never have a general release.
  • The first ten people to donate $300 or more will receive the above plus an ORIGINAL painting from the series the album cover is taken from, with certificate of authenticity! 

The Impact

Your help with this will allow us to build a new, better distribution method for music, free from corporate interference and with total artistic integrity and responsibility.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Anything and everything you can do to help is appreciated!

story:
We live in a world with a lot of newly formed ways to communicate.
I have been struggling finding my place In these streams of communication and lack of real contact. Words found other meanings. Out of urgency I have been researching the rich world hidden behind the words.
Singing has been my own way of reaching this place for years now and I know it’s one of these universal means, used all over the world in different ways, to connect.
It can connect us in a deep way with ourselves and with others. It brings us so much reflection and connection. Something this world could maybe use a little bit more.
For this performance I will research 6 universal characteristics connected to singing and vocals. How does the sound of our voice reflect with our surroundings? How can we connect ritual singing with the performic way we use in the West? How can we form and stay close to our own inner voice with all the streams of information and opinions coming our way? How do we listen? Really listen?
How can the singing reconnect us with our bodies?

Singing has always been my safe haven. And it still is today. With this piece I hope I can make it yours too.

I will work with Valgeir Sigurdsson (Björk, Feist, Bonnie Prince Billy) for the arrangements and Nederlands Kamerkoor Nxt.

This contribution is very much needed to cover costs in the research during the Oerol Theaterfestival where we will perform 17 try outs/work in progress to be able to really work with depth and growth.

story:
This is who they are, their dream, and what is going to happen!


 

My brother Chuck and his son (my nephew), CJ , are The French Connection,  located in Knoxville, Tennessee.  They play all of your favorite classic, alternative, and southern rock music.  They both play guitar, percussion, miscellaneous accompaniments, and perform vocals. (www.thefrenchconnectionband.com)

With a playlist covering over 200 well known songs, mixed with a handful of original music or interpreted cover versions, they offer a versatile mix of music that can be tailored for many different types of occasions.  From the Allman Brothers to ZZ Top, Jimmy Buffet to Jack Johnson, and everyone in between, they deliver the songs you want to hear, sing, and dance to. And they sure do get you dancing!

They book out either as a two person gig, with bongos and small percussion for smaller engagements, or full drum kit for larger ones.  For larger engagements, they can round out to a four piece ensemble, adding a full time drummer/vocalist and a female bassist/vocalist. 

The French Connection has appeared most frequently at The Irish Times in Turkey Creek, The SkyBox at the Sunsphere, and at Willie's Bar and Grill at Choto Marina during summer days and evenings.. They have performed at numerous public and private events from New York to New Orleans to California, including birthdays, engagements, holidays, weddings, sporting events, tailgaters, or just plain old good time parties.

They are capable of providing all equipment, including PA, amplifiers, percussion, drum kit, etc.



The Impact

Chuck and CJ literally have music in their hearts and souls. From their roots in Louisiana, East to West coast , and regular gigs throughout Tennessee, they bring their gift of passion and song to thousands. They are a father and son. They inspire through their great American southern rock style and their close family bonds. They have written and composed, serenaded and proposed. Help me help them keep this great American dream alive by letting the French Connection play on, helping people to sing and dance, cheer and tap their toes. Music inspires and I want   to keep that passion and spirit alive and producing!

What We Need & What You Get

We would love to send my bro and nephew into the studio to record their second original hit, "A Country State of Mind".

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share! Post our request on you Facebook page, your Twitter, your company bulletin board! Get the word out so the music can play on... Go to www.thefrenchconnectionband.com and spread the word!

story:
Our Story

Hi, 

I'm Jef Neve, a musician living in Belgium, travelling all over the globe. I'm composing a new repertoire for my trio: Sons of the New World. This time I want to add 5 horn players. The idea of the 'Sons of the New World' is to create a new world together with artists from other disciplines: dance, painting, video, ... We want to make a video clip where we express the idea of our world becoming a small village. We're gonna shoot the video in Brussels, in the city streets, to make the story real. We plan to do this next summer (2012). 


The Impact

I hope that this video is going to be a source of inspiration for other artists all over the globe. We're talking about at least 60 people doing everything they can to make this project happen. It would be wonderful to spread this 'sign of hope' around.

What We Need & What You Get

We need a lot of money to realise this project. We're talking about 5 people working out the idea technically, we need a professional camera, a lightengineer, spots, we need a good editor to finalise the pictures and give it a good editing, we need security people taking care for all the belongings of the production company, we need transport for the dancers and actors, we don't want to starve that day, so we need a bit of food and drinks too:-)


Other Ways You Can Help

Shout it out loud! Spread the news, share it on your FB or Twitter, email this to all of your friends, call you grandmother in Canada....

story:
Your PEI Symphony Needs You Now

Time is of the Essence – PLEASE DONATE TODAY!

Like many industries, the COVID-19 pandemic has placed the global professional arts community in financial and structural freefall. Throughout the world, even major organizations are facing uncertain futures. 

Closer to home, we here at the PEI Symphony Orchestra (PEISO) are adhering to directives from our public health officials in the nationwide effort to minimize the impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic. Consequently, for the protection of our audiences, artists, and staff, we were left with no choice but to:

  • cancel the final concert of our 2019-20 season at the Confederation Centre; 
  • cancel two major fundraising events including our annual Night at the Races Gala, Sponsored by Red Shores;
  • and cut short our popular annual fruit sale at the Charlottetown Farmers' Market. 

We made these painful decisions unblinkingly, as they were right and necessary to protect the community we love. But as a consequence, we are now short some $18,500 in critically needed income. 

PLEASE ACT AND DONATE TODAY!

Contributing now will help to ensure the continued operation of our symphony through this uncertain time. With your donation, we will pull through this, and continue to bring people together through music in our 2020-21 season and into the future.

 

What We Need & Why

The PEISO now urgently seeks $12,000 to offset the significant financial strain caused by the pandemic. We will deeply appreciate donations in any amount; every contribution helps!

Your gift will support musicians and staff, venue and music rentals, office and administrative costs and other expenses directly related to our mission of delivering high quality orchestral and chamber music concert events to Islanders.

 

What You Will Receive in Appreciation for Your Support

Please see on the right a short list of donation levels, each with a corresponding thank-you gift, ranging from concert tickets, to musician sponsorships, to a private chamber concert for you and your friends (you can even request the repertoire for such an event and we will gladly honour your request if possible)!

 

Who We Are

The Prince Edward Island Symphony has brought quality orchestral music to our province for more than 50 years. Each four-concert season brings together sixty or more accomplished musicians, including full-time performers and teachers, advanced students and expert players from other professions. 

Each season our diverse, multigenerational audience experiences performances that enhance our Island’s cultural and economic life. There's nothing quite like the power, majesty and grace of hearing a live symphony orchestra perform - and the PEI Symphony is the Island's own! 

 

Our Impact

Our orchestra has a powerful impact on social and economic life here in Prince Edward Island: 

  • The PEISO brings high-quality orchestral and chamber music concerts to Islanders year-round.
  • The PEISO's $250K+ annual budget is primarily used to hire musicians, and to purchase supplies and services right here in PEI, thereby contributing to our local economy.
  • The PEISO conducts outreach programs that bring musicians and chamber ensembles to Island schools, nursing homes and community centres.
  • The PEISO gives professional PEI musicians, teachers and music students the opportunity to grow as we come together as a musical community to perform outstanding symphonic repertoire to the highest artistic standard. 
  • The PEISO provides talented young PEI student musicians the opportunity to perform with an orchestra, as regular section members and/or soloists.
  • The PEISO enables Islanders to encounter talented Canadian composers, guest soloists and guest conductors who are invariably thrilled to discover our orchestra’s excellence, our community’s warmth, and our Island’s overwhelming natural beauty. 
  • The PEISO provides prominent roots/pop songwriters and performers from the Maritimes (artists like Lennie Gallant, David Myles, Tara MacLean and groups like Paper Lions and Vishtèn) to have the exciting opportunity to perform with a live symphonic orchestra, using arrangements often commissioned and scored right here by our local music professionals. But above all…
  • The PEISO builds community: We bring talented musicians together who joyfully work collectively to create a beautiful symphonic performance for all those who attend our concerts because of their appreciation and enjoyment of high-quality live symphony orchestra performances.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

The very best way to support the PEISO is to enjoy our concerts in person! 

While our 2020-21 season is fully planned and features works by Rimsky-Korsakov, Beethoven, Rossini, Gounod and more, we are still adjusting our concert dates in light of COVID-19 pandemic. Please be assured, the full season will be announced soon.  

Season Subscriptions are already available for purchase now and at early-bird rates (until May 31) - please visit our website for details, or email admin@peisymphony.com.

Donations of any size are always accepted on the Support Us page on our website. If a lump sum is too burdensome and you'd prefer make smaller regular contributions, consider becoming a Sustaining Supporter through an automatic monthly donation. Signing up is easy and takes only minutes - simply choose the 'Monthly' option on our CanadaHelps page here!

Thank you for helping us keep the music playing for many years to come here in Prince Edward Island!

*Please note tax receipts will be issued for the amount donated minus the retail value of the associated perk ie. concert tickets, season subscriptions, etc. This is in accordance with Canadian Revenue Agency standards for charitable giving.” 

Photos by Darrell Theriault (Island Live) and Philip Matusiewicz

story:
Our Story

The Cambodian Space Project began simply as a group of people getting together to play music with the idea of bridging cultures and with the hope of creating social awareness through putting on free concerts for disadvantaged, poor and remote communities in Cambodia. Fronted by Srey Channthy, a singer born into war and poverty, the CSP has taken this ethos and its music to the world, through touring and recording.


 

The Cambodian Space Project kicked off at a small bar in Phnom Penh in 2009, inspired by the Cambodian Rock of the 1960â€™s, psychedelic sounds influenced by the British Invasion bands and American GI Radio spilling over from the war in Vietnam. This wonderfully spirited and free sounding music still resonates today. Many of the musicians of Cambodiaâ€™s Golden Era later, tragically disappeared in the Killing Fields but today their musical legacy is more important than ever, it shows that the genocidal Khmer Rouge responsible for the deaths of so many musicians and artists in Cambodia, could never completely destroy the culture it intended to extinguish and its resurgence today shows the vitally of the human spirit â€“ you can kill the singer but you canâ€™t kill the song. 


CSP has members from vastly different backgrounds but is bonded by the desire to play great music, push boundaries and to chase our dreams. In a country such as Cambodia, where so many people live in abject poverty, we hope that The Cambodian Space Project offers inspiration for others, especially young musicians and artists seeking the chance of a meaningful future in Cambodia.  Our music has been featured on the BBC, ABC Australia, Radio Netherlands as well as community and college radio around the world. Highly influential Dutch newspaper Volksrant put the CSP's debut at number 1 on its list for best World Music albums of 2011.

javascript:nicTemp();The CSP has received astonishing reviews and audience response and our mission is to build on this success but to remain committed to charitable work in Cambodia.



The Cambodian Space Project fronted by Srey Channthy, a remarkable young Cambodian woman, Channthy has struggled most of her life to support her family through all manner of appalling jobs and for many years did this on approximately $60 per month. Thy has worked as a child laborer, on building sites, rubber plantations, in a mine, she was once kidnapped by a sex trafficking ring but managed to escape this terrifying ordeal. She is a tenacious character and a charming performer who writes, sings and records her own, very original new songs, tracks like Have Visa No Have Rice, Whisky Cambodia, Not Easy Rockâ€™nâ€™Roll, making her an exception in the Cambodian music scene where women are not encouraged to write their own material or to be too vocal about their personal experience. Channthy regularly takes time to speak to young people in schools and orphanages and talk about her life and her work with the CSP.

 

With the help of friends and supporters Channthy & The Cambodian Space Project has successfully released two titles, a 45rpm single Iâ€™m Unsatisfied and a debut album 2011: A Space Odyssey both releases made possible through the support of Hong Kong indie label Metal Postcard Records. We now hope to build on this work by mixing and releasing fourteen new tracks. These tracks will form an exciting new album, an LP taking its title form one of Channthyâ€™s fantasticly original songs Not Easy Rockâ€™nâ€™Roll. We believe this music will constitute and a very exciting and important release, particularly as it originates in Cambodia where there is little opportunity for singer songwriters such as Srey Channthy to reach a wider audience and build a career. We need your help to complete our mission â€“ a completely amazing new album of psychedelic Cambodian Rockâ€™nâ€™Roll. 


The Impact

The success of our campaign will enable us to release an inspirational album and attract new opportunities for our project to expand and grow, it marks an important time in CSPâ€™s career and effort to establish a foothold as an international touring band. We hope our music and indeed the story of how itâ€™s been created and where it comes from will reach a wider audience around the world. It will draw attention back to Cambodia and to the plight of the rural poor and enable us to spend more time in Cambodia, performing and working in such communities and enable us to share this experience through concerts, workshops and to contribute to supporting and teaching others. The activities through releasing and touring a new Cambodian Space Project album will generate experience and income and allow us to re-invest this back into the emerging Cambodian music community. This enables Channthy and The CSP to continue working free of charge in schools, orphanages, public forums in poor and underprivileged communities in Cambodia and other parts of the world.

    


What We Need & What You Get

We need $7,000 to mix and master a completed album of 14 songs.

This budget will enable us to complete to a highly professional level, the mix down of 14 tracks weâ€™ve already recorded while living and working in Cambodia. Weâ€™ve selected the best tracks from a series of recordings, made over the past two years, to complete our second album. It is important that this stage of the production be completed by an experienced and professional sound engineer to the level of excellence achieved on our first LP by music producer Lindsay Gravina of Birdland Studios (Lindsay donated much of his time). We aim to achieve and even better result and believe we have a far more exciting collection of new songs to present.

 

Our 7k target is based on the best three quotes to achieve our production goals. Our budget does not include the money weâ€™ve already spent in recording or the additional studio time donated to the project nor the flights and accommodation for band members. Total budget and costs for completing our 2nd album exceed 15k. Our budget break down for 7k fundraising is as follows -

 

$1000 â€“ 20hrs editing time

$4000 â€“ 40hrs mix-down time by experienced producer with a proven track record.

$1000 â€“ audio mastering for both digital and vinyl release.

$1000 â€“ graphic design for cover and promotional material. 


We offering very unique, creative and highly collectable "perks" including:

 

$1. Weâ€™re inviting all sponsors and contributors to join us at our launch party in Cambodia. You are part of our story in making â€œNot Easy Rockâ€™nâ€™Rollâ€ possible. Donors of $50 or more will be listed in the credits. Thank you.

 

$10. Our external gratitude to you for your support of our music project.

 

$20 an original Cambodian Space Project t-shirt sent to your address.

 

$30. A signed copy of our completed album and thank you note sent to your address.

 

$50. A signed copy of our completed album plus a CSP t-shirt and thank you note sent to your address.

 

$100. A limited edition screen-print 1/50 of CSPâ€™s original poster art handmade in Cambodia â€“ see series here for examples (please note: designs subject to availability previous editions have sold-out quickly and are limited to 50 copies).

 

$200. Includes 2 T-shirts, 2 Screen-prints, 2 copies of our album, a black & white portrait print of Srey Channthy, a letter of thanks from the CSP, and a Cambodian silk scarf.

 

$500. 5 x Ltd edition Screen-print series, a limited edition vinyl release with your name in the credits, 5 T-shirts, 2 copies of our album, a black & white portrait print of Srey Channthy, a letter of thanks from the CSP, and a Cambodian silk scarf.

 

$1000. We will play at your party, wedding, bahmitva, opening or special event in our region, Cambodia, Vietnam or Thailand.

 

$5000. Cambodian Space Project - Package Royale. We will play at your party in Europe, USA, Asia, Australia, New Zealand and will send you your selection from all perks listed. You champion!

 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please join us on Facebook or share this page with your friends.

http://www.facebook.com/pages/The-Cambodian-Spa...

story_txt:
Our Story

The Cambodian Space Project began simply as a group of people getting together to play music
with the idea of bridging cultures and with the hope of creating social
awareness through putting on free concerts for disadvantaged, poor and remote
communities in Cambodia. Fronted by Srey Channthy, a singer born into war and
poverty, the CSP has taken this ethos and its music to the world, through
touring and recording. 

 
The Cambodian Space Project
kicked off at a small bar in Phnom Penh in 2009, inspired by the Cambodian Rock
of the 1960â€™s, psychedelic sounds influenced by the British Invasion bands and
American GI Radio spilling over from the war in Vietnam. This wonderfully
spirited and free sounding music still resonates today. Many of the musicians
of Cambodiaâ€™s Golden Era later, tragically disappeared in the Killing Fields
but today their musical legacy is more important than ever, it shows that the
genocidal Khmer Rouge responsible for the deaths of so many musicians and
artists in Cambodia, could never completely destroy the culture it intended to
extinguish and its resurgence today shows the vitally of the human spirit â€“ you
can kill the singer but you canâ€™t kill the song. 

CSP has members from vastly different
backgrounds but is bonded by the desire to play great music, push boundaries
and to chase our dreams. In a country such as Cambodia, where so many people
live in abject poverty, we hope that The Cambodian Space Project offers
inspiration for others, especially young musicians and artists seeking the
chance of a meaningful future in Cambodia.  Our music has been featured on the BBC, ABC Australia, Radio
Netherlands as well as community and college radio around the world. Highly influential Dutch newspaper Volksrant put the CSP's debut at number 1 on its list for best World Music albums of 2011.
javascript:nicTemp();The CSP
has received astonishing reviews and audience response and our mission is to
build on this success but to remain committed to charitable work in Cambodia.

Channthy has struggled most of her life to support her family through all
manner of appalling jobs and for many years did this on approximately $60 per
month. Thy has worked as a child laborer, on building sites, rubber
plantations, in a mine, she was once kidnapped by a sex trafficking ring but
managed to escape this terrifying ordeal. She is a tenacious character and a
charming performer who writes, sings and records her own, very original new

story:
Dirty Fist! is a 5-piece female fronted folk band from Gainesville, FL.  

Dirty Fist originated with a banjo and an accordian back in 2007 and have evolved to include upright bass, fiddle, drums, trombone and trumpet.  We've been on many criss-crossing US tours and last summer we toured abroad in Northern Europe.

This summer we're planning a south eastern US tour, all the way from Florida to Indiana!  In order to make it happen we need your help.  Being a car-less, we gotta raise some $$ to rent a cargo van so the whole band can come!

If you donate to our tour, we promise your contribution will go directly into the tour transportation fund and not to our student loans, child support, alimony or rare cassette collection.

We also offer perks like if you donate $15 or more we'll send you our latest album, The Cypress Hunt or a Dirty Fist! hand screen printed t-shirt or patch.

Click on the paypal link below to donate! :)

story:
July 12, 2016

Dear Romanians and supporters of Romanian culture!

Under the umbrella and with the support of the Romanian-American Society of Washington State, our own community organization, I am thrilled to announce the 2016 edition of the Benaroya Hall Chamber Concert in Romanian Character that will take place on September 10th, 2016 at 8:00 PM. I  will be joined by distinguished Seattle Symphony's violinist, Mikhail Schmidt and Seattle Opera's own soloist soprano, Marcy Stonikas who is also a soloist with the Folksoper in Vienna. 

If you love Romanian music and culture this concert is for you! Our concert is titled 'in Romanian Character' for a reason: we are bringing to you a musical program that transforms the musical soul of Romanians into classical masterworks. 

Marcy, Mikhail and I are confident that you will appreciate the exquisitely elegant environment at Benaroya Hall, fantastic acoustics, pleasant seats, the whole experience of a September night that aims to make Romanian culture well known in Seattle and bring all of us closer together.

Our goal is to raise $6500 which will cover the artists fees, hall rental+ insurance+ ushers, piano tuning,dress rehearsal and the in-hall video recording. We hope you will enjoy the rewards that come with each donation level!

All of us at the Romanian-American Society of Washington State would like to send you our HUGE gratitude. We'd like to applaud you, the supporters, sponsors and founders of this second edition of the Romanian concert at Benaroya Hall!

We'd like to ask you to please SHARE this crowdfunding campaign with all your friends and relatives so we can reach as many Romanians and Romanian culture friends as possible.

Thank you for your generosity and I can't wait to see you at the concert!

Oana Rusu Tomai, pianist
