story:
What is allEars?

 

allEars is a festival for improvised music. It was started in 2002 by Lasse Marhaug, Maja Ratkje and Paal Nilssen-Love, but is now run by bass players Guro Skumsnes Moe and Christian Meaas Svendsen. The festival has always been booked by traveling musicians, ensuring that the music presented is always collected fresh from all corners of the world, and never booked for any other purpose than the music itself.

Guro and Christian. Photo credit: Peter Gannushkin

This campaign aims at making allEars 2018 an unforgettable experience for both audience and artists. The festival has a small budget, but we want to be able to pay our artists decent fees. All too often creative artists end up playing for little money under poor conditions. These artists are people who are devoting their life to music, not only their own creative output, but to the journey that music is. These artists are making a huge effort in creating sustainable communities in their respective cities. They are always helpful and supportive to traveling musicians, and they deserve nothing less than to be treated with the same hospitality and of course get paid for what they do.

By supporting us you help us create a festival which is sustainable for the local community in Oslo. You make sure that the artists are sufficiently paid and that they are treated in the best way. This in turn gives the audience the best musical performances. You also help us taking bigger risks in choosing venues and a sense of security for next year's endeavour.

PROGRAM 2018

 

Poster designed by Lasse Marhaug. For times and venues, please visit www.all-ears.no

 

What happens to all that money?

Your money will go to cover all the different expenses that we have to deal with: travels, accommodation, food, back-line, venue hiring, merch-production, promotion, ticketing + more. The artists get an equal fee for their performance (Norway-residing artists get a little less), their travel expenses are covered and they get at least two nights of accommodation. The organizers of the festival are not in it for the money, and will not take any of your contributions. Any surplus will go directly to cover expenses for future events. That's a promise!

 

Politics, philosophy and that type of stuff...

We live in a challenging time. A time where independent music and arts are increasingly devalued against an all-consuming economical capital.  It is a time when artists need to question and give an answer to the true value and importance of culture. This is an ongoing fight which allEars is very much a part of. At the same time we believe that art is not so important if not everyone is included to participate. For way too long this music has been reserved for a rather small homogenous group of people. It's not like we are trying to force this music on anyone, but we believe that everyone can find this music and the energy surrounding it joyful and meaningful. By bringing different people from all over the world together, we contribute in crossing all sorts of geographical, social and demographical barriers. That is a real and ever-so-important contribution to society: bringing people of different class, age, sex etc. together for mutual experiences. This is as an aspect of sustainability in the arts the way we see it.

$€£
Another important aspect of sustainability is money. We need to stop relying too much on government funding. We don't think it is evil or anything like that. In fact we are very thankful for all the contributions the festival have gotten so far. Turning towards crowd-funding might seem like no better at first glanse, but there is an important difference: through crowd-funding the public is already engaging themselves in the festival. They invest directly in the community we want to build. Also, as a backer, you get something in return. It can be a T-shirt, a gift package with LPs or CDs or even a private house concert with one of the festival's organizers. And of course you get a fantastic festival with superb musicians and outstanding live acts. We want you to know that wether we get money from the government, the public or from private sponsors we will never compromise on the autonomy of music. That is our stamp of approval!

Let's talk about...
We think music is important. In order for everyone to understand how important music is, we need to build a better vocabulary. That's why we will arrange for some debates and discussions for this year's festival. Keywords are sustainability, necessity, community.  We invite artists, the public, and some fancy names to talk about various themes within these topics. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways to help us out. If you for some reason can't or won't donate money we have many minor and not-so-minor tasks for you which we need help with. Driving artists, hanging up posters, cooking food etc. etc. etc.  Just contact us on Facebook and let's talk about options.

story:
Debut Album 

"Josie Duncan and Pablo Lafuente are rising stars of the Scottish folk scene. I saw their show at Celtic Connections last year and booked them that night." - David Foley, Folklub

We have been performing, practising and collecting for over a year now and hope to showcase this to the audience that we have reached over this time as well as to brand new audiences. To help fund the process you can pre-order the album itself, or you can look through our numerous other rewards! 

What we want to express on our album

  • A modern take on traditional material including Gaelic, Scots and American songs.
  • A versatile, accessible and complimentary approach to traditional song.
  • Never before heard self-penned songs. 

We want to give a really well rounded taster of who we are and what we do. 

What do we need to pay for? 

There are many costs involved in creating a new work like this, such as:

  • Studio costs £3.2K
    The largest cost involved in making this album is the studio costs involved. We hope to record the 10 track album with Scott Wood at Oak Ridge Studios, which we are extremely excited about.
  • Mastering £300
    We want our album mastered to the highest standard to ensure that we're delivering the best work we can. That's why we're delivering these tracks from one master to another. Mattie Foulds will be mastering the album. The combination of his musical mind as well as Scotts will create something really special. 
  • Musician fees (excluding ourselves) £900
    At Celtic Connections 2016, we joined forces and became a duo. One year later at Celtic Connections 2017, we connected with our new extended line up. Robbie Greig on fiddle, Graham Rorie on mandolin, Rufus Huggan on cello, Conal McDonagh on pipes and whistles and David Foley on percussion. As well as having tracks that only feature the two of us, we want to record with a mix of these musicians across the album including one full band track. These musicians are worth their weight in gold and we're so happy that they're on board to work with us! As well as this, Colin Macleod will be joining us for one song. Colin Produced Josie's first ever recording and we have both been long-time fans of his music. 
  • Printing £600
    Printing the album is as straightforward as it sounds but one of the most crucial elements. We can't wait to have our first big box of CD's arrive and to post them out to those of you that have pre-ordered them on this campaign!
  • Online Distribution £70
    We will make the album available worldwide on multiple online music platforms including itunes, spotify, google play and amazon. 

As you can see, this adds up to more than our crowdfunding target and the fees from upcoming gigs will also be going towards production and promotional costs. We will also be self-funding our promotional video and album launch, which you can buy tickets to as part of our 'VIP Packages'. 

Why do we want to make an album? 

Being able to create this album would truly open up a new door for us. Over our time as a duo we have been collecting songs and arranging original material. An album is an ideal platform to showcase yourself as an artist. Here is what we hope to achieve :

  • To showcase ourselves and our versatile approach to song.
  • To 'launch' ourselves onto the traditional music scene, which we feel so warmly welcomed into.
  • To develop new skills as a duo and as individual young musicians entering the profession.
  • To create something brand new.
  • To reach new audiences.
  • To have the opportunity to collaborate, work with and learn from industry professionals with a wealth of experience. 

Risks & Challenges

We recognise that this is a big ask and we can't express enough how much we appreciate all of your support. With out the funding we would not be able cover the costs mentioned above. If we do not raise enough funds, your money will be fully refunded and unfortunately in this case we will not be able to send out the rewards. 

If you commission us to perform a cover as a facebook video, this will be completed during the campaign - whether or not we reach our target.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is in the position to donate, yet may still want to support new art works such as this. Do not fear! You can still help us out and we would still very much appreciate it.

Other ways to help:

  • Share our campaign on facebook, twitter and any social media platforms
  • Like our facebook page
  • Tell all your pals and let them have a wee listen to us on Spotify or Youtube! :) 

Thank you so much for reading.

J&P

x
story_txt:
Debut Album 
"Josie Duncan and Pablo Lafuente are rising stars of the Scottish folk scene. I saw their show at Celtic Connections last year and booked them that night." - David Foley, Folklub
We have been performing, practising and collecting for over a year now and hope to showcase this to the audience that we have reached over this time as well as to brand new audiences. To help fund the process you can pre-order the album itself, or you can look through our numerous other rewards! 
What we want to express on our album

A modern take on traditional material including Gaelic, Scots and American songs.
A versatile, accessible and complimentary approach to traditional song.
Never before heard self-penned songs. 

We want to give a really well rounded taster of who we are and what we do. 

What do we need to pay for? 
There are many costs involved in creating a new work like this, such as:


Studio costs £3.2KThe largest cost involved in making this album is the studio costs involved. We hope to record the 10 track album with Scott Wood at Oak Ridge Studios, which we are extremely excited about.

Mastering £300We want our album mastered to the highest standard to ensure that we're delivering the best work we can. That's why we're delivering these tracks from one master to another. Mattie Foulds will be mastering the album. The combination of his musical mind as well as Scotts will create something really special. 

Musician fees (excluding ourselves) £900At Celtic Connections 2016, we joined forces and became a duo. One year later at Celtic Connections 2017, we connected with our new extended line up. Robbie Greig on fiddle, Graham Rorie on mandolin, Rufus Huggan on cello, Conal McDonagh on pipes and whistles and David Foley on percussion. As well as having tracks that only feature the two of us, we want to record with a mix of these musicians across the album including one full band track. These musicians are worth their weight in gold and we're so happy that they're on board to work with us! As well as this, Colin Macleod will be joining us for one song. Colin Produced Josie's first ever recording and we have both been long-time fans of his music. 

Printing £600Printing the album is as straightforward as it sounds but one of the most crucial elements. We can't wait to have our first big box of CD's arrive and to post them out to those of you that have pre-ordered them on this campaign!

Online Distribution £70We will make the album available worldwide on multiple online music platforms including itunes, spotify, google play and amazon. 


As you can see, this adds up to more than our crowdfunding target and the fees from upcoming gigs will also be going towards production and promotional costs. We will also be self-funding our promotional video and album launch, which you can buy tickets to as part of our 'VIP Packages'. 
Why do we want to make an album? 
Being able to create this album would truly open up a new door for us. Over our time as a duo we have been collecting songs and arranging original material. An album is an ideal platform to showcase yourself as an artist. Here is what we hope to achieve :

To showcase ourselves and our versatile approach to song.
To 'launch' ourselves onto the traditional music scene, which we feel so warmly welcomed into.
To develop new skills as a duo and as individual young musicians entering the profession.
To create something brand new.
To reach new audiences.
To have the opportunity to collaborate, work with and learn from industry professionals with a wealth of experience. 


Risks & Challenges
We recognise that this is a big ask and we can't express enough how much we appreciate all of your support. With out the funding we would not be able cover the costs mentioned above. If we do not raise enough funds, your money will be fully refunded and unfortunately in this case we will not be able to send out the rewards. 
If you commission us to perform a cover as a facebook video, this will be completed during the campaign - whether or not we reach our target.

Other Ways You Can Help
We understand that not everyone is in the position to donate, yet may still want to support new art works such as this. Do not fear! You can still help us out and we would still very much appreciate it.
Other ways to help:

Share our campaign on facebook, twitter and any social media platforms
Like our facebook page
Tell all your pals and let them have a wee listen to us on Spotify or Youtube! :) 

Thank you so much for reading.J&Px

story:
My name is Ingrid Plum, I've been singing since before I can remember. Last year, thanks to amazing crowdfunders, I got to study with Meredith Monk. She inspired me to start this new project called Taut.

This campaign is a pre-order for Taut. Meredith Monk spoke with me about writing music as a score and the role of the singer. It led me to explore this myself and I asked some incredible artists to compose scores, using whatever form they want, which I will interpret and perform. 

This project is taking things to another level for me, I've asked the composers to challenge me with their scores and I'm so excited to bring you these new works by these wonderful artists: Graham Dunning, Aine O'Dwyer, Iris Garrelfs, Jez Riley French, Bobby Barry, Lisa Busby, Lia Mazzari, Blanca Regina, Kev Nickells, Helen Frosi, Stephan Barrett, Nick Hudson.

 

Pre-order Taut

  • You can pre-order the book containing prints of the scores and a download of Taut performed and recorded at Iklectik. You can also get a thank you in the book! Or just order the album.
  • I need to raise £500 to be able to access Arts Council Funding I have applied for to then get the album rehearsed, recorded and manufactured.
  • If I don't reach my goal funds will be used to help get Taut happening at a more distant time in the future. I've been working on this project for nearly a year so fingers crossed!

If you pre-order Taut you're literally making it happen.

Funds from this campaign will prove to the arts council there is an audience for the project and will cover the printing costs of the book. 

  • Taut is breaking open the classical traditional model of composition and performance to bring you these new works by early to mid career artists. At the same time I'm taking my practice as a performer to a new level.
  • In 2016 I was so lucky that crowdfunders sent me to study with Meredith Monk. I told her this and she asked me to thank everyone for sending me over. This project is the next step, building on that experience.
  • The whole project will cost £7,000 so this is the first part of the puzzle to get in place. Once this falls into place through amazing people (with great taste) pre-ordering Taut, the whole project can get going with other funding!

The risk I face in this project is proving there are people interested in Taut, that there is an audience out there for new composition. So, if you're interested in these types of projects being made please show your support. Without this crowdfunding, the entire project won't happen.

I've been very lucky before, and I think that is because I never ask for charity. I offer an exchange and I'm realistic about what people can afford. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share the link to this campaign on your facebook and twitter.

story:
Our Story

Lisa Sanders is ready to make the leap of faith and take her music to the masses.  Lisa has six full length CD's to her credit and has worked with some of the most talented, singers, songwriters, musicians and producers in the business.  She has made music her full time career and is traveling, performing, meeting new contacts and working on a new CD.  Lisa has put together one of the best bands around.  She also has a great management team and new products...where you come in:  ALL OF THIS COSTS MONEY


The Impact

This campaign is a great way to help Lisa and her music continue moving forward.  As many of you know, it is extremely difficult to be a full time independent musician.  Even when you are extremely talented like Lisa, if you are not made of money, the costs of every day life, gas, and just having money to make cd's to sell can be overwhelming.  Lisa is now taking her music on the road, which is what she has to do to move forward outside of Southern California. Her airfare, hotels, rental cars, food and things that come up along the way have to be paid for.  Lisa has paid her dues here but in Nashville and other large venues, she is just making a name for herself.

When you participate in this campaign by purchasing an advance copy of Lisa's upcoming CD or one of the other amazing packages she has put together, you will be helping Lisa reach a broader audience, get her music on the road and hopefully the radio.  As well help her afford those that support her in getting her music out to the world. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise as much money as soon as possible for Lisa's upcoming trip to New York to meet some big time producers as well as fly back to Nashville to meet again with some other major players and play some great places like the Nashville Ear where she has been one of the few that has been invited to play.

Lisa will be using this money to produce her next CD as well as to get to and from these very important meetings coming up.  We are inviting you participate in this campaign with us and become a partner in this journey along the way with Lisa.  Lisa cannot do this without you.

You can donate as little or as much as you like.  $20 get's you a signed Advance Copy of Lisa's New CD Release.  $25 Gets You a signed Advanced Copy of the CD as well as one of Lisa's New Gorgeous signed photographs.  $50.00 will get you the signed Advanced copy of her Upcoming CD as well as her newest Shiver Tour T-shirt which is super sharp.    Donate $100 and Get the "Shiver" Package which Includes the Advanced Copy of Lisa's CD, A Shiver Shirt, Hat and Poster.  We also have a Bronze, Silver, Gold and Platinum package for $250, $500, $1000 and $2500.

Time is of the essence for Lisa on this.  This campaign will in and of itself cost Lisa money.  If she does not make her goal, the company will take as much as 12% of any money she collects.  All contributors will receive advanced breaking news!


Other Ways You Can Help

We REALLY REALLY Need your help to get the word out about this campaign.  Send it via email, facebook, myspace, reverbnation, phone or any other way you know how to friends and family.  Anyone who loves music, knows Lisa, is looking for a great way to help another or just loves independent musicians.  We so appreciate all you do and Lisa knows that she cannot make this journey without you, her family, friends and fans!

story:
Help the Ben Kole Trio!

Hey there! We are hoping to record our first studio album here in Nashville but need help taking care of the upfront costs. 

Here's our projected costs of this album:

-4 days in the studio at $300 per day ($1,200)
-10 songs mixed at $100 a song ($1,000)
-Mastering at $32 per minute of music (about $1,500)
-Printing 1000 CDs ($900)

Total:
$4600

IndieGogo takes 5% of what we raise plus we'll need to cover the cost of shipping your perks to you, so we set our goal at $5,000.

If we could get 500 people to pre-order the album at $10 we'd have all the funding needed to make this album. And boy would we appreciate the help!

We would love for you to essentially pre-order the album or more. Hopefully our perks will entice you to consider contributing more, but every little bit helps.

story:
What is Abandoned Tracks?

Abandoned Tracks is a documentary that looks at the unused railway tunnels and tracks that are in Australia. 

Originally, it was an idea to be a 3 part documentary web-series I was wanted to do at University in 2016.  I did one of the 3 episodes last year, which looked at the Helensburgh tunnels on the South Coast of Australia. These Helensburgh tunnels are located approximately halfway between Sydney and Wollongong. 

This documentary is looking at the St James and Central Stations and their unused tracks as well as their history. 

About Me:

Caitlin Monaghan

  • I'm currently studying my Advanced Diploma of Screen and Media at TAFE
  • I recently finished my Bachelor of Communication majoring in Media Arts Production
  • I've done a similar documentary on the Helensburgh Tunnels (between Sydney and Wollongong)
  • I've really gotten into documentaries in the last couple of years and while they are hard work, I do enjoy them.

What We Need:

  • I'm aiming for $2000, as $1720(about 430 p/hour and having someone to keep an eye on the crew while we're in the tunnels) will go towards getting access to the tunnels at Central and St James for a 4hour period. 
  • As a student, I can't do huge perks but depending on how much you donate will weather you get a thanks in the credits or a link to the project (as well as a credit).
  • If the goal isn't reached, that's okay, something will get worked out.

The Impact

The support for the campaign will showcase that there is interest in documentaries showcasing the unused tracks and tunnels that are all over Australia. Having previously done a documentary of the Helensburgh Tunnels, there are people who interested and there are stories surrounding these tunnels that people don't really know about.

Risks & Challenges

Even if the funding isn't raised completely and I can't get access to the tunnels, the money will probably go into getting decent quality historical photographs of both stations and the tunnels that lay unused.

Other Ways You Can Help

As a student, we understand very well that money can be tight. But thankfully there is always a way to help without leaving you broke. 

  •  Social Media is one of the fastest ways to make a project known especially to the right audience. Every like, share and follow on our Instagram and Facebook pages help us gain insight and reach a wider audience to whom may further aid our goal.
  • And remember if you have any questions we are always listening, just be sure to message us on Facebook or leave a comment on this page.  

From myself, I thank you.

Plan for more Abandoned Tracks?

Possibly. As there many unused tracks and tunnels around NSW and the rest of Australia.

story:
Short Summary

  • We are Yassassin and since we started the band in late 2015 we have been blessed with some lovely press attention and fan appreciation for our music. We have had the chance to work with amazing people and played with bands we love. Our biggest dream is to live from our music and we have already gotten further than we ever could have imagined. Now we are determined to take over the world!
  • Going on a UK tour will mean great exposure and will help us reach new audiences with our music. It will also be a useful experience that will hopefully open up doors to new even greater opportunities in the world of music.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We have drawn up a budget for the tour. Taking into account the costs of van, petrol, driver and accommodation it comes to roughly £2,000. 
  • We intend to keep a film diary on tour and will also post regular updates online to let you all be involved in our adventure. This tour is not only for us, it's for you too! 
  • To show our appreciation we'll randomly pick 5 lucky winners from the contributors who'll receive a merchandise gift pack with signed goods and special treats.

story:
The Campaign

Hello.

  • We are a punk rock band from Des Moines IA.
  • We love Jesus and the freedom He gives.
  • We are raising funds to cover the cost of our new EP "Light for Dark Places". It is finished, and it sounds awesome.

     

  • We want to share it with you, but we have to pay it off first. 

  • We need your financial support to bring this music to light. We hope to encourage those who find themselves in dark places.

The ask

To meet the financial needs of releasing the EP we need:

  • 2500$ for remaining studio costs (mixing, mastering, production), 700$ for donation perks, and 300$ for shipping and distribution.
  • Why so much $ for perks you ask? Because we want to give you awesome stuff! (Limited edition T-shirts, Professional quality photo booklet documenting the making of the EP, Autographed music equipment, Private concerts for you and your friends, etc.).
  • Meeting our fundraising goal will allow the EP to be released within the first half of 2018.

The Impact

  • We strive to meet people where they are at spiritually by combining music and truth.
  • God has done amazing things through this project so far. We expect to see more in 2018.
  • You make it possible to move forward through your generous financial provision.

The Risks

  • Making high quality music is expensive.
  • Playing music is not a lucrative venture.
  • The generosity of our amazing friends and family is how we plan to overcome this financial hurdle.

The Support

If you can't financially contribute at this time, here are other ways you can help:

  • Prayer- He hears. "And God is able to bless you abundantly, so that in all things at all times, having all that you need, you will abound in every good work." 2 Cor 9:8
  • Share- Tell your friends, share on social media @theaugustguns. Spread the word.
  • Care- Give our first EP a listen at www.theaugustguns.com. Come say hi at a show.

Until we see you out there, shine on.

-The August Guns

story:
We are poor kids with expensive dreams.  

Our current adgenda is: record a full-length record in October, get our van a transmission, load up on merch for ya'll, and tour all of America in 42 days so everyone can have a chance to see and meet us.  All of this isn't possible with the funds we are saving up from our part-time jobs (of course, we'll try it regardless).  This is where you come in!  If you could help us out financially at all, we will be forever grateful. Oh so grateful.  We will find you on our 6 week All-American adventure and thank/hug you personally.  Most of the people at our shows don't come off as rich, so don't feel obligated whatsoever to give us any money you need for your own living routine.  We don't want to feel like dicks for putting your lunch money into our gas tank. You could buy Keystone instead of Budweiser next time you're on a beer run, and BAM you got a couple extra bucks for donating.

Recording:

We'll be heading to Minneapolis to record our new full length album. We will be recording for a week starting October 14th. Starting early next year, we will be doing a 42 day national tour in support of this record and anything you could possibly contribute .

National Tour:

1-23 Fargo, ND
1-24 Minneapolis, MN
1-25 Milwaukee, WI
1-26 Chicago, IL
1-27 St Louis, MO
1-28 Bloomington, IN
1-29 Kalamazoo, MI
1-30 Akron, OH
1-31 York, PA
2-1 Boston, MA
2-2 Montclair, NJ
2-3 Brooklyn, NY
2-4 Philadelphia, PA
2-5 Baltimore, MD
2-6 Harrisonburg, VA
2-7 Raleigh, NC
2-8 Atlanta, GA
2-9 Gainesville, FL
2-10 Tallahassee, FL
2-11 Lafayette, LA
2-12 Baytown, TX
2-13 Austin, TX
2-14 Odessa, TX
2-15 Albuquerque, NM
2-16 Flagstaff, AZ
2-17 Las Vegas, NV
2-18 Los Angeles, CA
2-19 Bakersfield, CA
2-20 Oakland, CA
2-21 Sacramento, CA
2-22 anywhere northern CA
2-23 Portland, OR
2-24 Seattle, WA
2-25 Boise, ID
2-26 Salt Lake City, UT
2-27 Denver, CO
2-28 Kearney, NE

If anyone could help us out or recommend any bands/venues/houses to hit up, please let us know! That would truly mean the world to us.

We are very excited to party with you, America.
story_txt:
We are poor kids with expensive dreams.  
Our current adgenda is: record a full-length record in October, get our van a transmission, load up on merch for ya'll, and tour all of America in 42 days so everyone can have a chance to see and meet us.  All of this isn't possible with the funds we are saving up from our part-time jobs (of course, we'll try it regardless).  This is where you come in!  If you could help us out financially at all, we will be forever grateful. Oh so grateful.  We will find you on our 6 week All-American adventure and thank/hug you personally.  Most of the people at our shows don't come off as rich, so don't feel obligated whatsoever to give us any money you need for your own living routine.  We don't want to feel like dicks for putting your lunch money into our gas tank. You could buy Keystone instead of Budweiser next time you're on a beer run, and BAM you got a couple extra bucks for donating.
Recording:
We'll be heading to Minneapolis to record our new full length album. We will be recording for a week starting October 14th. Starting early next year, we will be doing a 42 day national tour in support of this record and anything you could possibly contribute .


National Tour:
1-23 Fargo, ND1-24 Minneapolis, MN1-25 Milwaukee, WI1-26 Chicago, IL1-27 St Louis, MO1-28 Bloomington, IN1-29 Kalamazoo, MI1-30 Akron, OH1-31 York, PA2-1 Boston, MA2-2 Montclair, NJ2-3 Brooklyn, NY2-4 Philadelphia, PA2-5 Baltimore, MD2-6 Harrisonburg, VA2-7 Raleigh, NC2-8 Atlanta, GA2-9 Gainesville, FL2-10 Tallahassee, FL2-11 Lafayette, LA2-12 Baytown, TX2-13 Austin, TX2-14 Odessa, TX2-15 Albuquerque, NM2-16 Flagstaff, AZ2-17 Las Vegas, NV2-18 Los Angeles, CA2-19 Bakersfield, CA2-20 Oakland, CA2-21 Sacramento, CA2-22 anywhere northern CA2-23 Portland, OR2-24 Seattle, WA2-25 Boise, ID2-26 Salt Lake City, UT2-27 Denver, CO2-28 Kearney, NE
If anyone could help us out or recommend any bands/venues/houses to hit up, please let us know! That would truly mean the world to us.We are very excited to party with you, America.

story:
Short Summary

We are Above All Else

Nelson: Lead Vocals/Guitar

Michael: Rhythm Guitar/Vocals

Doug: Bass Guitar(Beard of the Year candidate)

Austin: Drum set

Our band has been together for almost a year now, and we want to have something to show for it. We have been in and out of local recording studios, even singing in Nelson's closet. We believe our fans deserve a EP of professional quality  and we have a chance to work with a producer that has worked with Kings of Leon and who believes our band is worth investing in. He is giving us a lower price to help out on a financial level because he is a personal fan of our work. We don't want to miss this opportunity to take our a band to the next level.

With your contributions, we hope to record a 4 to 5 song EP completely mastered. We feel our outreach will be strengthen by a professional EP and our message can spread throughout the inter-webs:

"Above all else, be true to yourself"

 

What We Need & What You Get

The full $500 will go directly to recording and mastering. Our producer is cutting us a huge deal and really want's to get the recording finished before the new year.

Our perks:

5 Dollars: Digital copy of our EP

10 Dollars: Signed physical copy of our EP

20 Dollars: You pick the cover, we put it on YouTube with a personal thank you! (includes signed physical copy)

35 Dollars: Skype date with the band. We will play 3 songs, have dinner, watch a movie, or just talk. It's up to you! (includes signed physical copy)

50 Dollars: Personal live show streamed to you(and your friends) online. We give you and no one else the pass-code. You decided how many people watch.(includes signed phsyical copy)

100 Dollars: Signed copy, YouTube cover, Skype date, personal show online, AND a producer credit on the EP. We will also make a personal thank you video, and you will receive the EP before the release date.

The Impact

We have been through a vocalist, a violin player, and three guitarists in the past year. As we have grown together as a band, constantly we have dealt with the struggles of a member having to leave. Finally, we have secured a full lineup, and we are ready to give our fans the EP they deserve. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some ways you can help:

Share our link to all your friends online via your social network of choice. 

Follow us on Twitter

Like us on Facebook

Listen to our demos on Reverbnation

 

Thanks for supporting our first EP,

Above All Else

story:
Hello!

My name is Ned Roberts and I'm a folk singer and songwriter. In November 2012 I travelled to L.A. to record my debut album with producer Luther Russell. He's produced records by Richmond Fontaine, Noah and the Whale, and Sarabeth Tucek. This chap on the right:

                               

We decided to record it the old fashioned way – entirely live onto a 4-track reel-to-reel tape machine. It was a great experience, and we came away from those sessions with 16 tracks. 12 made the final sequence, of which three have been released as singles over the last year. Check them all out, including B-sides and bonus tracks, HERE.

                                


Those singles have been greatly supported by BBC Radio (6 Music, BBC Scotland, Radio 2), and stocked by Rough Trade in London. I teamed up with Will McCarthy Promotions to release my second single Blues #6 ft. Sarabeth Tucek, which was picked up by Lauren Laverne and Jo Whiley. This in turn led to a recent UK tour supporting the wonderful American folk singer Anais Mitchell.

PRE-ORDER THE RECORD!

Now the time has now come to release the full LP. I'm very proud of it, and would love it to be available to all of you. The record itself is complete – produced, sequenced and mastered – ready to go. All that is needed now is to produce the cds, promote it, and gig relentlessly. This is where you can get involved and actually make it happen...

Simply pre-ordering the album for £12 will make an immeasurable difference. If that's a tad too much, but you'd still like to support, there's also an advance download for £8. 

There are also other larger incentives if you'd like to get more involved – including the ltd edtion “Red Sun” and “Blues #6” vinyls, and London based sitting room gigs, and so on (see right-hand-side of page).

COST BREAKDOWN

The money raised from pre-orders and other incentives will fund:

CD production - £1,250

Promotion - £1,000

Any extra funds raised will go directly towards touring / 12" vinyl release / video production for the new single.

If you would share this page and tell any friends who you think would be interested, that would be immense. Thank you!


Album photography - Dan Pick (danpickvideo.com)

story:
Hello My Name is Lindsey Chidester, and I'm 14 years old . I have have been singing for as long as I can remember. For the last two year I have gotten the greatest pleasure of going to Blue Lake Fine Arts Camp (BLFAC). This year I decided to try out for The Blue Lake Fine Arts Camp International Exchange program, I found out that I was accepted to go
With this fundraiser I need to raise $6,325 dollars. This basically covers airfare, luggage, and it helps pays the host family I would be staying with during the three weeks in Europe . If I reach my goal I would be getting a great learning experience, an amazing singing opportunity, and I would be able to visit places some (especially me) only see in textbooks. If I do not reach my goal by the time I need it,  I would keep the fundraiser going until the 2016-2017 international tour. It would be kept nice and safe in a bank account until needed.
The impact this tour would mean to me would be tremendous. I have done small tours before with a city choir in my hometown of Royal Oak,Michigan, but those tours would never compare to this one, yes they were very good tours and they gave me a lot of knowledge on music and my singing, but if I get this opportunity my music background would expand. Any donations you could give would be greatly appreciated by me,and also my family.

The only risk I can possible think of me going on this tour would be that the host family I would be staying with wouldn't know how to speak English, but I could overcome that by learning some basic words of their language and teaching them basic words of my language.
If you are not able to donate please spread the word for me about my fundraiser and just be their and support me in my decision to make this big step in my life... Thank You!!!

story:
THANK YOU.

We reached our goal of $500, and thus have recuperated the costs of producing such a video (although cast and crew worked on a volunteer basis, we did have to feed them - and give them costumes and props). In any case, thanks to everybody who contributed and supported the endeavour. The video is available online, as seen above, and has been getting fantastic press from fantastic blogs and magazines from around the globe.


See video-related posts at: EXCLAIM.CA, CVLT NATION, METAL SUCKS, THE OBELISK, among others.


The original pitch and updates are listed below.


Godstopper are a Toronto-based group taking cues from the noisy likes of Melvins, Gandharvas, Today is the Day, Unsane, Torche, YOB, Khanate, and more. Formed in 2010 by Mike Simpson in an attempt to create something in line with the heavy post-metal that Toronto has lately fostered but to also go beyond the typical limitations of metal and hardcore. With a sound complex and thick with influences ranging from 90s alternative to doom to sludge to shoegaze and noise, the band's motives are as difficult to pin down as its sound.


Some positive words about Godstopper:


via METAL SUCKS (USA)

via TERRORIZER (UK)

via LURKER (UK)

via SHINY GREY MONOTONE (UK)

via PORCYS (Poland)

via Aaron Turner (of Isis, USA)

via Andrew Nolan (of The Endless Blockade and Slaughter Strike, Canada)


The EP is available for listening and download on BANDCAMP.


Production Stills (UPDATE 2012-02-21)







I. The Video

The video for Everybody Writes Good Songs intends to draw heavily on the aesthetic of documentary films and blur the line between reality and fiction to create a unique and unconventional music video. Clean House explored the homestead of its characters with a gritty, voyeuristic lens and the use of available lighting (candles, car headlights, lamps). Everybody Writes Good Songs will build upon this and introduce a documentary crew recording gritty scenes of peregrine captives and authorities through an institution and into the forest. We believe we'll have a video as bleak and crushing (yet eerily melodic) as the track.


Click and watch Clean House (2011) via Godstopper & Justin Oakey


After completing a new music video for Finland's new forest-folk supergroup Hexvessel, Justin Oakey was recently interviewed by LURKER to discuss independent filmmaking, underground music, and where both converge. The interview can be read here: The Lost Art of the Music Video.


More work by Justin Oakey available here:

VIMEO.COM/JUSTINOAKEY

BURIALOFFERINGS.TUMBLR.COM


II. Donations

Our previous video was created entirely out of favours and pocket change. For this next video, we're looking to get $500 to cover the costs of costumes, props, transport to locations, and feeding those who will be helping us out. It's a very small sum for this kind of production, meaning it is a bare minimum to cover the costs - no individual will gain a cent from this. We're looking to make something bizarre, unconventional, and ultimately interesting, not to make money. As extra incentive, there are some "perks" listed for the first donors to claim them - including unreleased material, the remaining copies of the EP on cassette, and t-shirts, as well as being mentioned in the upcoming album's liner notes.


If you want to support Godstopper or underground and independent art, please post this campaign to your social networking websites and help us out.

story:
Our Story

A grassroots non-profit, The Chad Foundation for Athletes and Artists provides heart screenings to young athletes and students. The organization was formed in honor of son, brother and friend, Chad Burtrum, who, at 26, died of Sudden Cardiac Arrest. Gregarious, kind and spirited, Chad was a healthy, strong man with no prior history of heart disease. 


The Chad Foundation works to prevent such sudden, tragic deaths from occurring through early detection and prevention. Heart screenings can detect early risk factors for heart diseases such as hypertension, high cholesterol, obesity and diabetes, and may prevent Sudden Cardiac Death. To date, the organization has provided near 6,000 heart screenings to high school and college students and the disenfranchised in five states and Austria and Sweden. We were the very first organization to provide echocardiogram screenings to high school students in North Hollywood, CA. We are fortunate to have some of the best hospitals in the country support our program: Childrenâ€™s Hospital Los Angeles, Johns Hopkins and NYU.


We also create art, through books, film and theatre, that articulates our motto "Healthy Body, Mind and Spirit." The Chad Players have performed six Off-Broadway performances, including one special performance for three hundred New York City homeless men and women. Our third production of "Days of Wine and Roses" was brought to Atlantic City as the community event of the year. The play highlights the deleterious effects of substance abuse on the family.


We invite you to join us in protecting young hearts and their futures as we strive to expand our program to other states.


The Impact

When Chad Foundation began its work, awareness of HCM (hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, an abnormally enlarged heart muscle) was extremely low. At the time, it was believed only 11 or 12 young people died annually from Sudden Cardiac Arrest. The CDC now reports that 5,000 people between 15 and 34 years of age die from this "silent killer." Considered the gold standard, the echocardiogram screens for structural abnormalities and the EKG detects electrical anomalies, yet these are not standard in youth prescreening medical exams and are not normally covered by insurance companies. 


In countries like Italy, screenings have been mandatory for the past 25 years with a 94% save rate. Our program has found a 10% rate of heart anomalies for every 100 people screened. We strive to raise awareness of Sudden Cardiac Death in the young in all 50 states, teach others about the warning signs and the importance of preventive screenings as the best way to detect lethal heart abnormalities and prevent early heart disease. Our goal is to provide at least one screening in every state, which communities can replicate, with the ultimate goal of mandatory heart screenings for all our US athletes.


What We Need & What You Get

Chad Foundation needs donations that empower us to expand our heart-screening program state by state. Parents, athletic trainers, athletes, artists and health professionals support our work. There are no paid salaries in our organization; every dollar raised goes toward operational costs of our preventive screening program.


We plan to provide heart screenings in 5 states, MA, CT, MI, CA and NY. If we exceed our goal, we will be able to provide screenings to other states that have never had heart screening programs for their youth. Even if we do not meet our goal, we will complete as many screenings as possible!


Your gifts, large or small, allow us to organize screenings for youth, travel to their communities, provide supplies and personnel. In return, you will have the greatest gratitude of every parent and family member with a child who has benefited from our program, and you will have helped protect a child's future.


We are working on a book and screenplay on the foundation's journey, and in the future we may be able to offer discounts or passes in appreciation of your Gifts--stay tuned!


Other Ways You Can Help

Firstly, raise your, your family's and friends' awareness of Sudden Cardiac Death in young people, its causes, warning signs (fainting, blackouts, dizziness, especially related to physical activity, is NOT NORMAL for teens). Remember that heart anomalies can be present at any age. We have found babies with a hole in their hearts and adults in their late 30s. 


  • See your physician! 
  • Know your own family heart health history (Has anyone died from heart problems before the age of 50? Have/had high blood pressure, diabetes, high cholesterol?)
  • Advocate that cardiovascular questions are present on health questionnaires your child fills out in schools
  • Make sure AEDs (automated external defibrillator) are in all your schools, offices, recreation centers, gyms
  • Know what the â€œChain of Survivalâ€ is and take CPR classes
  • At your next race or walk, think about donating the proceeds for a heart screening at your local high school or have a fun dance event to sponsor a heart screening!
  • Tell those who are interested in their child's heart health about the Chad Foundation and the work that we do!
  • Tell other people about the Chad Foundation on Facebook, Twitter, your blog, or forums
  • Add Chad Foundation on Facebook and help us gain support! http://www.facebook.com/pages/The-Chad-Foundation-for-Athletes-and-Artists/368894949802472?ref=tn_tnmn


From the Heart, we thank you for spreading the word. Take care of your heart and those of others--especially young people!

story:
What Is this?

Sister Mountain Brother Sea is a Chrisitan Folk band from Joplin, MO.  We have been invited to go down to New Orleans, LA, to play music for Anchor Mission USA's 3rd Annual Ministry Conference.  Playing music and sharing our hearts with men and women in the city of New Orleans.

Joining us for the trip will be local church/venue Solace Church, who are members of Anchor Mission USA.

We'll be going down on January 10th, and coming back on January 12th.

This is a Missions Trip to share our songs and be a part of an incredible ministry!

 

What We Need & What You Get

The Money from the donations will go to help us pay for our immediate expenses.  These include:

-Lodging ($10 per Person Per Night for 2 Nights)

-Food ($25 per Person for 3 Days)

-Gas ($250 in total for a Round-Way Trip)

 

For you Support and Donation:

-We will be providing custom designed Patches

-A copy of our EP

-Custom printed Posters (Signed and Unsigned)

-Live Recordings of our songs in different Locations during the trip

 

What Happens if we don't hit our Goal?

If we do not hit our goal, the remainder of the funds will still go towards the trip, and we will have to pay for the trip out of our own pockets.

But we believe that You will help send us on this Missions Trip to support and encourage the leaders of ministries from all over the United States for this incredible weekend of prayer and ministry in New Orleans

The Impact

What we Hope to do is encourage and minister to those in Ministry, and share our music right there in the French Quarters, of New Orleans:

You will be a part of an indie band's journey to make a difference bigger than the band or our music.  The message is that "With Heart and With a Message, we can encourage others"

We will busk the streets of New Orleans, recording our journey, and prepping the band for another year of writing songs and seeing God work through our heart for our ministry through this band.

We want to be supported by Christian, non-christians, folk music lovers, hardcore kids, our parents, our families, Joplinites, Folks from out of town, and by anyone who has a heart for home-grown music inspired by love!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you just can’t afford to contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

You can get the word out and make some noise about your campaign on:

-Facebook

-Twitter

-Pinterest

-Share our Youtube VIDEO

Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you so much for taking the time to watch our video.  We are honored to play music and share them with others, and if you can be a part of our journey we'd be honored!

story:
Who are we?

Two danish musicians with an idea and a website that has been in development for a year.

 

The idea

Once in a while you discover some amazing music, and then you realize that the band is from half around the world. Why should the venues and bookers dare to book this?

 

More concerts

If we create a centralized and dedicated web service where everyone can show venues what they want to see in concert, how much they would pay for the tickets, and how far they want to travel to attend the concert. The bookers and venues will then know that there is a fanbase, and then they are able to see if it will be profitable. 

 

Don't miss the sale!

If a venue decides to book a concert, the users who meet the venues' requirements to price and location/distance will get invited to buy concert tickets by email. We will try to make sure that the users of Cravegig have ticket reservations for a period of time.

 

Upcoming and local bands... More gigs for you!

All bands and artists can sign up, free of course. By asking your fans and friends to "crave a concert" with you at Cravegig, you can prove to the venues, bookers and cafés in your area, that you have a fanbase. This means that they probably won't loose money if they book you.

 

Better economy for the venues and bookers!

This has some expenses... Hosting the website, development, administration and promotion. The venues pay a tiny fee for each ticket sold through Cravegig, but this expense should be lower than what they would normally have been using to promote the concert.

 

 

What we have now

We have been spending the past half year on developing the website which finished yesterday. We are not experts, but we think it's a good start. But we faced a problem - server capacity, which basically means that the server is too slow.

 

What We Need

At the moment the website is way to slow. Another issue is, that for this concept to work, we need to attract a lot of users through advertisement.

 

  • To cover server expenses and optimization of the website

  • To cover expenses to advertisement, primarily on social and music websites.

 

How much we need for these expenses depends on how many users we will get and how fast. Our estimate is $500 to cover website optimization, $1000 to cover server upgrade the first year and the rest to kickstart the advertisement campaign. The more we get for advertisement the better chances for the concept to prove its worth.

 

What you get

The whole purpose of Cravegig is to generate more concerts to all of us. We dream that this service soon will become something your inner music lover could not live without. The service will be free to use for ordinary users and bands. We don't have any nice gadgets to offer, but take a look at the perks. It might be a good investment.

 

Want your band or your friends' band to get promoted to the frontpage in your area? Check out the perks!

 

Check out the current version of the website:

www.cravegig.com

 

Follow the dream on facebook:

http://www.facebook.com/cravegig

story:
2 day is the day I've been waiting for!
The last final hours of the year tick away as does my asking for support on this project.  I'm ready for a new year to begin.

Please visit my website to review all of campaign story - I've been updating & changing this page every week to inspire you to contribute!

I've done my best 2 get ur attention via creative vids about me & THE Rh+ FACTOR.   I need your sponsorship, your show of support right now.  Contribute what you can to my campaign & support me creating new works of art.  Help me get this project off the ground & heart while I'm at my BEST SELF.

IN CONCLUSION:

I'll be able to continue working on THE Rh+ FACTOR:                                                         

1)  A humorous mémoire about my life & times since age 5.  My life has truly been stuff you CAN'T MAKE UP!

2)  12 new recordings of old songs - storytelling for me started with song                                                                                                                                                                                          3)  A new 'one-woman show' -  live streamed.

Donate for a PERK designed specifically for YOU!

Help me get this project off the ground & heart while I'm at my BEST SELF.

Pls contribute 2 my campaign & support me creating new art for the world.

Ways U Can Help:

SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN INFO & LINK 

* Check out the creative & hip PERKS on the right... every $'s a huge help

* POST A COMMENT  here on my IndieGoGo Campaign or my website

If you're uncomfortable with online transactions, no worries!    Send payments directly to:                                                                                                  

John Kilgore Sound & Recording                                                                                                 630 Ninth Avenue, Suite 307, New York, NY 10036       -       212-245-4623

Questions? Please contact John Kilgore or Vera Beren
john at johnkilgore dot com
vera at johnkilgore dot com

Visit my website to review my campaign thus far - I've been updating & changing this page every weekly to inspire you!

HAPPY 2015 2 U & URS....Cheers 2 GOOD HEALTH & GOOD LIFE !

story:
Hi everyone,

So I have set myself the MAHOOSIVE challenge of organising a charity concert in October 2015! It's going to be called 'The Sisterhood Concert' and true to its name it's going to be a one night celebration of all things female, starring all women performers: Singers, Dancers, Comediennes & Public Speakers. As well as being an awesome night of music, laughter and story telling, it's also to raise money and awareness for the great work that the charity "Women's Aid"  do to  help women and their children who are fleeing domestic violence!

I will be honest and say that my budget for this concert is very VERY minimal and I'm doing this all out of my own pocket, with a touch of creative accounting and imagination lol! The plan is to get as much sponsored for free by the events suppliers, but I'm having a real struggle convincing a venue to sponsor the venue hire cost for free, so this is where my back up plan comes in... YOU lol! That's right, I need your help to raise £3,000 to cover the cost of the venue hire, because if I don't have a venue, then I don't have a concert to hold!.

Now your probably wondering why you should put your hands in your purses and wallets for some woman who decided one day to just go and organise a concert and with no budget either! well let me tell you my "WHY" behind this concert:

For me it's two fold, firstly I have a personal connection to the 'Women's Aid'; a few years ago they helped me out of a really really bad situation, they got me rehoused and my life back on track and I am eternally grateful to them for all the support and help they gave me  during those dark times and I have been looking for the right way to say thank you to them ever since; so when I came up with this concert idea, it just seemed the perfect way to give back! 

The second part is personal to me and my journey in life, like a lot of people I came to understand the pains and stresses of life quite young in my childhood, there was a lot of family strife during my childhood years, mainly involving my mother who was unfortunately an alcoholic. Now I'm not here to tell you a sob story or to demonise my family and mother, I love them all dearly and in no way blame or use them as an opportunity for sympathy here, I simply tell you this to you give you a insight into my journey so far.  I have since learnt that in life, what at the time can feel like a curse often turns out to be your blessing in you life. what my childhood showed me was that I wasn't alone in feeling like I wasn't good enough and that putting on a "happy front" is so common for so many people, but more specifically women, having made some of my own serious mistakes and facing them by getting help and talking to people I've come to realise that there are so many women who need help! and as a result of my own personal journey I've become a bit of a female empowerment warrior - which is where my concert comes in! 

whilst I definitely want it to be a awesome night of entertainment for the audience, more importantly to me I want it to touch the hearts, minds and spirits of all those women who feel uninspired, hopeless and just not happy with themselves or their lives; I  want women to know they are NOT alone and that together as a sisterhood we can face anything together, by breaking the silence and talking about our fears, pains and demons. I want this concert to represent hope, strength and love that women should have for themselves, their daughters, sisters, cousins and our fellow women.

So that's it, I know a very long winded explanation of why I need your help, but your help I do need! without a venue I cannot hold my concert which I KNOW and BELIEVE is going to be more that just a great night, it's going to be the start of a movement, THE SISTERHOOD MOVEMENT!

Thank you for taking the time to consider my campaign and any donations you are able to give will be greatly appreciated and if you can't afford to donate, please take a quick moment to share my campaign with friends and family!

have a beautiful day and god bless.

xx
